loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 40 years old. She is married, and together they have been blessed with five children. She has two adult dependents. She has been running her business for the past four years, selling clothes to clients in her area. 

She would like a loan of KES. 30,000 which she will use to buy more clothes in bulk. 

She currently makes an estimated monthly income of KES. 40,960. 

She will use her income to expand her current business and pay for her loan.

loans.use: to add more clothes in bulk to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase diesel, fertilizer, and pesticides.

loans.name: José Javier

texts.es:
En la parroquia Lodana de la ciudad de Santa Ana, conocida por sus bellos paisajes y por sus hermosos balnearios de agua dulce que son muy visitados por muchos turistas, cada 15 días se reúnen las socias del Grupo De Crédito  Lodana.
En este lugar vive don José, tiene  43 años de edad, esta soltero y vive con la mamá. El lleva  4 ciclos Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten salir adelante en su actividad agrícola.
El señor José es un hombre que le gusta trabajar y así salir adelante,  el trabaja en el Municipio local pero que le encanta el campo y la agricultura, por esta razón él se dedica a cultivar los campos que tiene cerca de su hogar, cultiva verduras, maíz y frutas en toda época del año ya que cuenta con los terrenos apropiados y con sistemas de riego. 
Este crédito es para comprar fertilizantes y pagar de mano de obra del desbrote de los cultivos.  Sus sueños son seguir con sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Every 15 days the partners of Grupo de Crédito Lodana, gather at the Lodana parish, in the city of Santa Ana. This last one is known for its beautiful landscapes and its gorgeous hot springs of fresh water (which are highly visited by many tourists).

In this place lives don José, a single 43-year-old man who lives with his mom. He’s had 4 loans with Grupo de Crédito, and he likes it because every credit allows him to move forward in his agricultural activity.

Mr. José is a man who likes to work, and in this way, get ahead in life. He works in the local government, but he loves the field and agriculture. That is why he cultivates the fields that are near his house. He grows vegetables, corn and fruits at any given season of the year. He is able to do that thanks to the suitable land and the irrigation system. 

He will use this loan to buy fertilizers and to pay for labor in the uprooting of the crops. His dream is to be able to preserve these last ones.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay for labor.

loans.name: Khemradj

texts.en:
Khemradj thanks all his Kiva lenders for helping him with his rice production.

He repaid his loan fully and wants to continue with rice production. With the profits from last season, he could renovate his house.

Khemradj is requesting another loan of SRD 7,500 for the purchase of inputs for his rice production.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Husam

texts.en:
Husam is 23 years old. He lives with his family, consisting of three siblings and his parents in a sector in Jordan called Irbid.

Husam is a university student majoring in Computer Information Systems, and he is in his last year. He is planning to work in his study field after graduation so that he will support his family.

They don't have enough money to pay for his upcoming semester fees because of a financial crisis they are facing. Because of that, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is 24 years old. He lives with his family, consisting of five siblings and his parents in a sector in Jordan called Irbid. 

Mohammad is a university student majoring in Computer Information Systems, and he is in his last year. He is planning to work in his study field after graduation so that he will support his family.

They don't have enough money to pay for his upcoming semester fees because of a financial crisis they are facing. So he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Jocinta

texts.en:
Jocinta is a 37-year-old mother from Kisumu county, which is located in the western part of Kenya. She is married, and supports three people in her family. She was blessed with two children who are 14 and 1 years old.

She has a green grocery stall which has been operating for the last six years, and generates a monthly income of KES. 45,000. 

She has applied for her second loan with Vision Fund Kenya.

Her dream is to run a wholesale business and build a nice home for her family.

loans.use: to purchase green grocery to sell

loans.name: Rosa America

texts.es: Rosa de 51 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hermano, ella trabaja de elaborar piñatas para fiestas de cumpleaños desde hace varios años su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia y con las ventas que realiza ha logrado cubrir los gastos de su hogar. Doña Rosa solicita un crédito que le permita comprar más materiales como: papeles de todo tipo de colores, pegamento, alambre, papel de diario entre otras cosas que le sirven para la elaboración y así podrá obtener mejores ganancias y podrá tener una mejor calidad de vida junto con su hermano.
texts.en:
Rosa, age 51, lives at her own house along with her brother. She works making piñatas for birthday parties. She has been doing this for several years now, and her business is located at her own place of residence. With her sales, she has managed to cover the household expenses. 

Doña Rosa is requesting this loan to buy more materials, like: papers of different colors, glue, wire, newspaper, among other things that she needs to make the piñatas. This way she’ll be able to obtain more profit and have a better quality of life along with her brother.

loans.use: to buy papers of different colors, glue, wire, newspaper, etc.

loans.name: Satiesh

texts.en:
Satiesh thanks all Kiva Lenders for supporting him in his rice production.

He has repaid his loan to Kiva lenders on time and could save some money for building of his house. 

He approaches Seva MFI and Kiva lenders for another loan of 10000 SRD to purchase fertilizer and pesticides and continue production so he can finish building his house.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Soekhdew

texts.en:
Soekhdew is feeling very blessed with the helped of Kiva lenders and he thanks them a lot. 

He repaid his loan fully to all Kiva lenders; with the profits he could pay for the education of his children and he also could save for his future.

Soekhdew wants more help for his rice production so he can save more and send his children to high school. 

He needs SRD 10,000 to purchase inputs like diesel, fertilizer, and pesticides.

loans.use: to purchase diesel, fertilizer, and pesticides.

loans.name: Widjai

texts.en:
Widjai thanks all Kiva lenders for helping him with his rice production. 

With the profits of last season he started building his own house. Widjai is a committed and hardworking farmer; he repaid his loan on time.

He asks more help from Kiva lenders so he can finish building his house. 

He needs SRD 8,000 for the purchase of fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Olga Rosario

texts.es: Olga es madre soltera y con 31 años de edad ella tiene 4 hijos de 13, 9, 6 y 2 años de los cuales los 3 hijos mayores se encuentran estudiando y la de 2 años asiste a un centro infantil mientras que Olga  se va a trabajar al jornal en el campo, ella  tiene un año de experiencia en la crianza de chanchos ya que una vecina le enseña el cuidado de estos animales, Olga va a empezar con esta actividad de crianza de chanchos para tener otro ingreso, es por eso que es muy necesario  y va a ser de mucha utilidad el crédito que le otorgue Fodemi, con el dinero Olga va a comprar chanchos para emprender este negocio,  esta mujer luchadora aspira tener otro ingreso para cubrir los gastos de sus hijos y comenta que es muy dura la vida cuando una madre sola tiene que hacerse cargo de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Olga is a 31-year-old single mother. She has four children, ages 13, 9, 6 and 2. The older children are currently studying, while the youngest of 2 years of age goes to a children’s center. Olga works in the field. She has one year of experience raising pigs, since a neighbor taught her this activity. 

Olga is looking forward to make of this activity another source of income. That is the reason why she is in great need of this loan given by Fodemi. With the money, she will buy pigs to start her own business. 

This hardworking woman needs another income to pay for her children’s expenses, and she comments that is a hard life when a single mother has to take care of her children on her own.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Carlos Mauricio

texts.es: Carlos tiene 37 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su madre, hermana y tres sobrinas. Carlos es un hombre trabajador, responsable y visionario quien se dedica a la prestación de servicios de seguridad y además trabaja como fotógrafo desde hace mucho tiempo. De esta forma colabora con la economía del hogar y se gana el sustento diario. Carlos solicita este crédito a FUSAI dado que desea invertir en la construcción de un servicio sanitario ya que se encuentra en mal estado. Con el monto solicitado comprará cemento, arena, ladrillo, y hierro.
texts.en: Carlos is 37 years old. He lives in his own house with his mother, sister and three nieces. Carlos is a hard-working, responsible and visionary who is dedicated to security services. In addition, he has worked as a photographer for many years. With these activities, he contributes to the household expenses and earns a daily livelihood. Carlos is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in the construction of a bathroom since it is in bad condition. With this amount, he will purchase cement, sand, brick and steel.

loans.use: purchase sand, bricks, cement and steel to build a bathroom

loans.name: Martha F.

texts.en:
Martha of BOWODA seeks a Kiva loan to purchase Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products at wholesale and sell retail. Martha is the Executive Director of the Bassa Women's Development Association (BOWODA), a women's groups with hundreds of chapters and thousands of women members throughout Grand Bassa County, Liberia. just two hours drive east of the capitol city of Monrovia.

BOWODA's mission is to advocate for Women's Rights and Empowerment Through Training, helping to educate women and teach them about entrepreneurship and self determination.  They have savings and loans that they can use to give out loans to their members to engage in entrepreneurial activities.  They empower women through health education and advocacy for women and children for the right to go to school, anti-violence workshops, anti-rape education, HIV/AIDs prevention, family planning, and much much more.  BOWODA hopes that the sales for SE4ALL products will empower their women by improving their health, and providing light! as well as weekly fuels savings.  They plan to use the Kiva loan to purchase these essential products wholesale then sell them for a small margin in order to use the profits to expand their programs to help empower women chidden.

loans.use: to purchase Sustainable Energy for ALL (SE4ALL) products to distribute to women groups around Grand Bassa County.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida works hard to support her family. Nida is married and has a business buying and selling cashew nuts in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of cashew nuts to sell.

Nida has been in this business for 1 year.  She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of cashew nuts to sell

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 58 years old and married with five children.  She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Rosalinda is borrowing PHP 6000 through NWTF to buy additional feed for her pigs.

Rosalinda has been pig fattening for 23 years and earns additional income from fishing and farming rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional feed for her pigs

loans.name: Songono

texts.en: Songono is a 28-year-old single man. He deals in poultry which he has done for 4 years, as his major source of income, however his major challenge is limited capital. Songono joined Ugafode so as to get financial assistance and expand his business.  He also deals in coffee as his second source of income. He is a hard-working man and he hopes that with the financial boost of UGX 2,000,000 he will be able to buy poultry feed and young chicks cheaply that he will sell in a very short time to make more profits. He appreciates Ugafode for the financial support which improves people's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy poultry feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy enough drinks for her business.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 40 years old. She sells tomatoes and she has been in this business for the past eight years. With this loan, Rose would like to buy more items such as tomatoes, sugar, and rice for resale. With the profits from the business, she will provide food for her family.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, rice, and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en: Jeanne is 34 years old. She is married and has four children. Jeanne sells bananas and has been in this business for the past ten years. With this loan, she will buy more bananas for resale. Jeanne will use the profits from her business to reinvest in the business for a better future.

loans.use: To buy more bananas for resale.

loans.name: Subhashree Shg Group

texts.en:
Subhashree Self-Help Group consists of nine women from a village in Odisha. They formed this group to help share their problems and to solve their problems themselves. 

One of the members is Bhumisuta, who was selected as the president of Subhashree SHG. The lady standing with her hand raised in the photo is Bhumisuta. 

Bhumisuta is 45 years old and is staying with her husband and her two children. She is involved in growing and selling vegetables in her village. Her husband is supporting her in this activity. She has requested a loan of 198,000 INR, which will help her to purchase the required resources for vegetable cultivation. She says her portion of the loan will help her to purchase vegetable seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides, and to cover operational expenses like labor charges.

Other members of this group are involved in different activities like animal rearing, milk selling, paddy cultivation, etc. All are very happy and thankful to Kiva for this kind help and support.

loans.use: to purchase vegetable seeds, fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Ramond

texts.en:
Ramond is feeling blessed and is very grateful to Kiva lenders for helping him with his rice production. 

With the profits of last season he paid the tuition fees and bought school books for his child.

He has repaid his loan to Kiva lenders on time and asks them to lend him SRD 8,000 once more for purchasing diesel fuel and fertilizers for his rice production.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and diesel fuel.

loans.name: Bomi Women Development Association Group

texts.en:
The Bomi Women's Development Association seeks a Kiva loan to purchase Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products at wholesale and sell retail. Yamah is the group leader for the Bomi Women's Development Association, headquartered in Joseph Town, Tubmanburg (in the group photo Yama is located second from the left, in the red shirt, holding the CH2200 clean cookstove).  The group consists of women from all over Bomi County, with 150 members (70 active).  Members of the group are nurses at the local clinic, staff at nearby Mary's Meals, owners of restaurants and catering services, sellers of peppers, plantains, cassia, and other foods grown at their families farms.  They've come together to combine their small resources to purchase seeds, appliances, and other goods in order to pursue business and alleviate poverty.

The communities of Bomi have no access to electricity and cook with solid fuels.  Sjedi approached the coup to share with them Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products such as clean cookstoves, solar home lighting systems and solar lateens that charge cell phones, anti-malarial bed nets, and clean water filters in order to improve the health and livelihoods of these women and their families.

The Bomi Women's Development Association is seeking a small micro-loan from Kiva.org in order to purchase 10 CH2200 improved charcoal cookstoves for 10 members and to pay off the cost of $30 per stove after 3-months.  IF this trial period goes well, we will scale-out the program to more community members and solar home products and solar lanterns.

loans.use: To purchase Sustainable Energy for ALl (SE4ALL) Products

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en: Deborah of Women of Peace and Development (WPD) seeks a Kiva loan to purchase Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products at wholesale and sell retail. Deborah is the president of WPD.  WPD focuses on advocacy on behalf of women and children, conducing anti-violence against women workshops, and training rural women on modern agricultural technics, and making eco-stoves from clay.  WPD gets its training from grants from Women's Campaign International, UNDP, and the MInistry of Lands, Mines, and Energy, to attend Training of Trainer workshops so they can then head back into their community to impart best practices, new techniques, and education. Led by Deborah, WPD will distributor clean energy products like the improved cookstove and small solar home systems and use the profit to expand their program to empower women.

loans.use: to purchase Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products wholesale to sell and distribute to other women's groups and rural communities.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta de 27 años de edad se dedica a trabajar en su molino, procesando todo tipo de alimentos, como maíz, frijoles, harinas, salsas, entre otros. Tiene ya algún tiempo con el negocio y posee amplia experiencia que le ayuda a generar muy buenas ganancias, es muy conocida por las personas de la localidad, la clienta quiere mejorar su vivienda construyendo unos cuartos y mejorar el lugar donde tiene su negocio, pero con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias no le alcanza para poder realizarlo, por esa razón solicitan un crédito para la compra de los materiales necesarios como: arena, cemento, ladrillos, hierro y pago de mano de obra y asi pueden vivir todos como familia seguros y cómodos.
texts.en: The client is 27 years old. She is dedicated to working in her mill, processing all types of food like corn, beans, flour, sauces and other products. She has had the business for some time. She has extensive experience that helps her generate good earnings. She is well known by people in her community. The client wants to improve her home by constructing some rooms and improve the area where she has her business. What she earns is not enough to make improvements. For this reason, she is requesting a loan in order to purchase necessary materials like sand, cement,bricks, steel and to pay for labor. The family can live safely and comfortably.

loans.use: purchase sand, cement, bricks, steel and pay for labor.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is 30 years old and married with four children, three of whom are in school. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell such as soap, milk, chips, egg, noodles, etc.

Michelle has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store for four years and also earns an income from buying and selling cashew nuts. Michelle aspires to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell such as soap, milk, chips, eggs, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Cassien

texts.en: Cassien is aged 54. He is a father of eight children. He sells cows and has been in this business for the past six years. With this loan, Cassien would like to buy more cows for resale. He will use the profits from his business to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To buy more cows for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fish for her business.

loans.name: Nune

texts.en:
Nune lives with her family in Achajour village of Tavush region. She is a mother of three children: two sons (aged 26 and 22) and a daughter (19 years old). 
Nune's husband and their two sons are involved in the construction business. They work hard to sustain their living and cover daily costs. Nune's daughter Naira studies at university and is currently in her second year of study. 
Nune has applied for this loan to be able to pay for her daughter Naira's university tuition. Because of many costs, it is very difficult for this family to save money for Naira's education so this loan is very important for the whole family.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition for her daughter

loans.name: Drocelle

texts.en: Drocelle is 53 years old. She sells bananas and has been in the business for the past five years. With the loan, she would like to buy more bananas to sell. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings.

loans.use: To buy more bananas to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more ingredients such as rice, pepper, onion, oil, meat, and fish, as well as coal for her business.

loans.name: Maa Bhagabati Shg Group

texts.en:
Maa Bhagabati Self-Help Group was formed in 2011 and is composed of eight members in a small village in Odisha. Maharagi is the lady who is standing with her hand raised in the photograph. Maharagi, age 36, is an educated member of their group, so she was selected as the leader of Maa Bhagabati SHG. Maharagi has two children. She is living with her husband and her two children. Her children are continuing their schooling. 

With the loan that she is receiving, Maharagi plans to boost her agricultural business, and to do so she will purchase chemical fertilizers, rent a field and pay for the cost of labor. In order to strengthen her agricultural business, she plans to improve her strategy and make use of new farming techniques. 

Both Maharagi and her husband have been involved in this activity for ten years. They have good knowledge of paddy rice cultivation and vegetable cultivation. Maharagi currently grows rice. She has requested this loan to expand her agriculture activity. Her ambition is to enlarge the business for which she is receiving financial support and to diversify her activity by growing vegetables.

loans.use: to purchase chemical fertilizers, rent a field and pay for the cost of labor.

loans.name: Domingo Salvador

texts.es: Domingo de 44 años de edad vive en casa propia con su familia, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol desde hace varios años, comercializa en los alrededores de la zona con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Domingo está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía y así poder continuar con sus siembras para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Domingo is 44 years old and lives in a house that he owns with his family. Domingo makes a living growing corn and beans for a number of years. He sells his products in the surrounding areas and uses the money from sales to cover some household costs. Domingo is applying for this loan in order to buy seeds, fertilisers, manure, anti-disease treatments and more, and to improve the land (shown in the photograph). This loan will allow Domingo to continue sowing his crops and to offer his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilisers, manure, anti-disease treatments and more, and to improve the land.

loans.name: Jaime Antonio

texts.es: Jaime de 30 años de edad se dedica desde hace 20 años al cultivo de maíz y frijol y ese tiempo le ha dado la experiencia necesaria para poder obtener un buen cultivo, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos, Jaime está solicitando un crédito para poder mejora el terreno donde desea realizar nuevamente la siembra que es el que muestra en la fotografía así como también comprar los insumos necesarios como: fertilizantes, abonos, herbicidas, controles de plagas, semillas, etc. para poder obtener mejores ingresos y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Jaime is 30 years old and for 20 years he has been growing corn and beans. This time in this work has given Jaime the necessary experience to be able to grow good crops. He uses the money that he earns from his crops to cover some household costs. Jaime owns his house, and lives there with his wife and four children. Jaime is applying for this loan in order to improve the land (shown in the photo) where he wants again to sow his crops. Jaime will also buy necessary supplies such as fertilisers, manure, weed-killers, anti-disease treatments and more. With this loan Jaime will earn a higher income and can give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilisers, manure, weed-killers, anti-disease treatments and more.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flour and dough in bulk.

loans.name: Francoise

texts.en:
Francoise is 40 years old. She is married and she works together with her husband. 

She owns a boutique and has been in the business for the past 18 years. With the loan requested, she would like to buy more retail items such as rice, sugar and soaps for sale. The profits from the business will be used to renovate the house.

loans.use: To buy more maize and sugar to sell in her boutique.

loans.name: Mbando

texts.en: Mbando is 40 years old. He is married with five children. He sells cows and has been in the business for the past ten years. With the loan, he would like to buy more cows to sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate his house.

loans.use: To buy more cows to sell.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: Maria es una mujer muy alegre y luchadora, es casada y tiene 4 hijos de los cuales una ya es casada, un joven que es bachiller y que no pudo seguir estudiando debido a la falta de recursos económicos de sus padres, y las dos hijas menores  asisten al colegio, María se dedica a la venta de productos come verduras, hortalizas,  granos entre otros en las ferias de las  ciudades más cercanas, su esposo se dedica a trabajos de albañilería, María va a invertir el crédito en la compra de productos para ofrecerlos en el mercado, lo que aspira Maria es poder tener el dinero suficiente para darles la educación a sus hijas y en el futuro comprarse una casita ya que en la actualidad vive en una casa por la que  paga arriendo.
texts.en: María is a happy and plucky woman. She is married and has four children: the eldest is married and her youngest two daughters are in primary school. María's second child was studying at high school but could not continue due to a lack of money to pay for it. María makes a living selling items such as vegetables and grains in the city's nearby markets. Her husband is a builder. María will invest this loan in buying goods to sell at the market. María wants to have enough money to provide her daughters with an education. In the future she would like to buy a small house as the family currently lives in a rented house.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Enid

texts.en:
Enid is a new client to the organization who has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan shillings. She is aged 42 years, married and blessed with four children. She lives in a peri-urban area in the Southern division of the Rukungiri municipality.

She is a businesswoman who deals in the charcoal trade as her main source of income, which she has done for over six years. The business is paying because most of the people in the area are low-income earners who use charcoal for cooking; she has therefore been able to make some money from this business, and she has been able to get income to buy her family's needs. However, she has been faced with a challenge of limited capital for expanding her businesses. 

With this loan from UGAFODE, she is hopeful that her businesses are going to expand. She thanks UGAFODE for the financial support given to the clients and looks forward to getting many more loans.

loans.use: To buy charcoal for selling

loans.name: Maa Jagatajanani Shg Group

texts.en:
In 2014, 12 women from a small village in Odisha stepped out and decided to build a secure future for their families. They formed a group named Maa Jagatajanani Self-Help Group. The members of Maa Jagatajanani Self-Help Group are all women from the district of Sonepur in Odisha, India. One of them is Lili, who was selected as their president. In the picture, the lady standing with raised hand is Lili. 

Lili is 32 years old and lives with her husband and her two children. Her husband is a farmer and has been involved in the activity of cultivation for a long time. She got the idea of doing vegetable cultivation from her husband, so she gathered some other women from her neighbourhood and told them about her plan. They liked her idea and appreciated her. She took on the leadership of the group and started to cultivate vegetables and sell them in her village. Initially, she started growing only a few vegetables like potatoes, tomatoes, and onions, but later on, she grew bitter gourd, snake gourd, cucumbers, lady fingers and brinjal (eggplant). 

She has a very good relationship with her customers as she sells fresh vegetables to her customers. Now she has a new idea to purchase some more seeds, vegetable plants, fertilizers, and pesticides to increase her production and grow vegetables on a large scale, for which she has requested a loan to take land on rent and buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: to pay for land on rent and buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Shomokh Group

texts.en:
This group is called Shomokh. It consists of four women from Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB.

Suad is a 35-year-old married  woman and lives in her own house with her family. She works as a tailor. Her business was set up in her place of residence many years ago. She sews all kinds of clothes for the people in her area. She is very detail-oriented and does a very good job. 

She works with an old, traditional sewing machine. This old machine makes her feel tired quickly so that she takes a long time to sew a few pieces of clothing. She couldn't afford a new machine, so Suad is asking for a loan 50,000 YER from AMB to purchase a new sewing machine.

This will allow her to keep the loyalty of many customers, friends, and neighbors. Suad looks forward to obtaining better profits to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine to replace the old one.

loans.name: Maa Saraswati Shg Group

texts.en:
Urkuli, the lady standing with her raised hand in photo, is 41 years old and married. She has two children who are both in schooling. Her family lives in a village of the Sonepur District in Odisha, India. 

She and her husband earn a living through working as farmers and cultivating rice and vegetables. Having been in this business for seven years, she is able to earn approximately 4,000 INR per month to meet her family’s needs. 

Urkuli is leading a group named Maa Saraswati Self-Help Group. Its 10 members are applying for a loan with Peoples' Forum. The members of Maa Saraswati SHG are engaged in different kinds of activities like agriculture, general store, dairy farm, wood business. Urkuli is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers, seeds, pesticides and some irrigation tools for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to raise more crops and sell them for a good price to make a better living to send her children to a good school.

Urkuli is very happy with the loan and says many, many thanks to Kiva for this kind opportunity.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds, pesticides and some irrigation tools for her farmland.

loans.name: Benkadi 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe BENKADI 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des familles traditionnelles à KOULOUWO dans la commune de KABOILA dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  de riz  avec madame MAFOUNE assise au millieu sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme  BENKADI 2. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 3 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 4 bidons d’herbicide de qualité différente et payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir  0,75 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village et à SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  120 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son intérêt et d’autre part aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the Benkadi 2 group are married women with an average age of 39 and, on average, 3 children. They mainly live in traditional families in Koulouwo in the Kaboila commune, Sikasso Circle, third administrative region of Mali. They are working with the MFI Soro Yiriwaso in order to carry out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their 7th group loan with the MFI Soro Yiriwaso and have properly repaid the previous loans.

Mafoune, sitting in the middle of the picture with the other Benkadi 2 members, grows rice. She plans to use her loan to buy 3 50-kilo bags of fertiliser, 4 cans of pesticide of varying quality and to pay the cost of the labour she needs to cultivate 0.75 hectares of land. After the harvest, the produce is sold in the village and in Sikasso to a clientèle made up of men and women, for cash or credit. She expects to make an average profit of 120 000 francs per crop cycle. This profit will allow her to repay her part of the loan and to support her husband with the daily family expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertiliser and agricultural inputs and to pay the manual labour.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is a 26-year-old married female with two children; one is attending school. Dorothy operates a produce business in a busy market. She works four days a week, 11 hours a day, plus does farming as an additional income business. She began the business to have a source of income, since she couldn't make it for formal employment. 

Dorothy has a vision of buying a piece of land and business expansion. However, competition and low capital are challenges she faces. Dorothy is accessing a loan to buy beans and groundnuts to sell.

loans.use: to buy beans and groundnuts to sell.

loans.name: Fidela

texts.en:
Fidela is 36 years old, married, and has four children, two of whom attend school. She works very hard to provide for them. Fidela runs a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for six years. She sells a variety of items.

Fidela requested a loan from NWTF for 13,000 PHP, which she will use to buy additional stocks such as detergent soap, canned goods, cereals, coffee, milk, juice, fabric conditioner, etc. to sell. In the future, Fidela would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks such as detergent soap, canned goods, cereals, coffee, milk, juice, fabric conditioner, etc.

loans.name: Kahangi Women In Development Group

texts.en:
Evelyne used the previous loan to buy alcohol to sell. She has continued with that business in addition to tailoring, in order to boost her income. 

She has the responsibility of providing for the family and dreams of educating her children. She is a member of the Kahangi Women in Development group, where each member guarantees the other.  Her challenge is having  inadequate capital. 

Evelyne needs the loan to buy material to make clothes.

loans.use: to buy material to make clothes to sell.

loans.name: Eliphaz

texts.en:
Eliphaz  is a 44-year-old married male with fifteen children; six attendschool. 

Eliphaz operates a retail shop  and has been in business for 14 years. He also has a video hall to show films and rears animals for additional income. 

Eliphaz intends to use the loan to buy soda, beer, salt, sugar, and rice to sell. Eliphaz is hard working however, fluctuating prices and high rental costs are challenges that he faces.

loans.use: to buy  soda, beer, salt, sugar, and rice to sell.

loans.name: Sylivest

texts.en:
Sylivest is a 56-year-old married man living in Kagadi-Uganda with 10 children ranging in age from  36 to18 years old. One child attends school. He hopes to educate his child. 

He operates a retail shop and farms to afford school fees.   He is challenged by fluctuating prices. Sylivest is asking for a loan to buy salt and sugar to resell.

loans.use: to buy salt and sugar for resell.

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en:
Susanna is from Achajour village where she lives with her mother and brother. Her father and elder brother are migrant workers in a neighboring country, trying to find a well paid job and sustaining their family.
 
Susanna is a student in State University. She has applied for this loan to ask financial support and be able to cover her university tuition. This loan will greatly help Susanna and her family to cover her educational costs and continue education in the university. 

Please help Susanna with her loan.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition.

loans.name: Ichlas

texts.en:
Ichlas is from Shaab in northern Israel. She is part of a group guaranteed loan where each entrepreneur has their own business, and they guarantee each other’s loans. While Ichlas was never able to finish high school, she has always been determined to be responsible and advance her life. Her business is helping her. Ichlas opened her kiosk — a small store — two years ago near the local elementary school. Children from the school flock to her kiosk during break time and after school for snacks and small items.

She needed this loan to expand her stock and introduce additional items.

Ichlas is determined to keep advancing her business. She wants to see it expand and grow.

loans.use: To expand her stock and introduce additional items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock and pay for renovations

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase palm oil in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more food ingredients such as rice, fish, onion, pepper, oil, etc., as well as coal for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase pure water and assorted drinks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy palm oil in bulk (by the gallon).

loans.name: Malek Group

texts.en:
This group is called Malek, and it consists of four women who are all hardworking. They live in Sana'a, Yemen. They have taken a loan of 220,000 YER (Yemen rials). 

Fatima is 30 years old and a married woman with three children. She is an educated woman with a secondary education. She has a strong determination to improve the standards of her living. She said she had a small amount of money which she saved up herself. Fatima invested that money in her own business. She started her business five years ago, selling makeup and accessories in order to help her husband with the expenses of the family. She sees this business as a profitable for her. For further expanding, Fatima requested a loan of 60,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase more accessories, makeup, and cosmetics to resell to the women in her area.

Fatima expects a boost in her income. She looks forward to expanding her business more through selling more accessories, makeup and ready-made women's clothes.

loans.use: to purchase more accessories, makeup, and cosmetics to resell to the women in her area.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase plastic slippers to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchasing more blood syrup (herbal medicine), malarial drugs and pain tablets to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, pure water, and assorted drinks to expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more cooking oil, rice, and seasoning

loans.name: Isaura

texts.en:
Isaura is 32 old. She is single and lives with her parents and sisters. Five years ago, she started selling clothes to her friends, and they recommended her to other people, and her business grew. Her goal is to help her parents and become independent. 

She is asking for a loan to increase her inventory and grow her sales.

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a repeat client and has secured a loan of 2,000.000 UGX.  She is a widow with 6 children and comes from the village of  Kakinga parish, Kebisoni sub-county, Rukungiri district.

She is a hard working woman and raises cattle to generate income.  She relies on this income to meet her financial needs but realizes that her business capital alone cannot meet all her needs, which include school fees. 

She decided to join UGAFODE for financial assistance to buy more cows and increase  milk production.  She hopes that his dream of business expansion will be achieved. 

Grace praises Ugafode for financial assistance which has enabled her to educate her children and maintain her business.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Chutzorop Segundo Group

texts.en:
The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Chutzorop Segundo” is located in a rural area of Chichicastenango in the Highlands of Guatemala. Two new members have joined the Trust Bank and are quite motivated to participate in the Microcredit Plus Program of Friendship Bridge that combines small loans with non-formal education. The new members work in textile production as do most of the women of the Trust Bank. The traditional textiles of Chichicastenango are among the most colorful and beautiful in Guatemala.
Juana, better known as Juanita by the ladies, is the President of the trust bank. She is an enthusiastic 26 year old with three children. Together with her husband the couple works hard to generate enough income to support the family. They produce and sell different kinds of textiles. Taking the long range view, Juanita decided that having one business just was not enough and so she began selling fruit in her community. She is quite happy and pleased with the progress of her fruit business. Juanita is requesting a loan that she will use to purchase thread for her textile business and supplies for her fruit business.
Juanita and the ladies in the “Chutzorop Segundo” Trust Bank appreciate the monthly educational training given by a Loan Officer of Friendship Bridge. They learn how to manage their small businesses with seminars on effective business practices, budgeting, accounting, customer service and savings. Other topics include nutrition and health, self esteem and women’s rights as well as the use of medicinal plants. Learning together, the women of the Trust Bank bond even more and encourage each other to be successful.
It is difficult, if not impossible, for an indigenous women in Guatemala experiencing poverty to walk into a banking institution and secure a loan. KIVA investors are valuable assets to these women who are working quite hard to empower themselves and create better lives for themselves, their families and their rural community in Chichicastenango. Thank you, KIVA investors!

loans.use: To purchase thread for her textile business and supplies for her fruit business

loans.name: Benkadi 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe BENKADI 3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des familles traditionnelles à YELEKELA  un village dans la commune de KIGNAN dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur neuvième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  avec madame SALIMATA assise  à la première position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme BENKADI 3. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 1 sac de 50 kg d’engrais, 2 bidons d’herbicide de marque différente et payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, aux marchés de SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  93 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son intérêt et d’autre part aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten members of Benkadi 3 Group are married women, who average 37 years of age and four children each. Most of them live in traditional families in Yelekela, a village in the commune of Kignan, Sikasso Cercle, third administrative region of Mali.

They work with Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, in order to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are seeking their ninth farming loan from the MFI. The previous loans were repaid without problems.

They grow peanuts, just like Mrs. Salimata, the woman sitting on the left in the photograph. With her loan, she intends to buy one 50kg sack of fertilizers, two cans of herbicide of different brands, and cover plowing expenses for maintaining 0.5 hectare. 

After the harvest, the production is sold in the village and at the markets in Sikasso, for cash and on credit, to a clientele comprising both men and women.

Mrs. Salimata intends to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 93'000 per planting. This profit will enable her in part to repay the loan and interest, as well as to help out her husband cover the daily expenses of the family.

loans.use: to buy 50 kg of fertilizers, 2 cans of herbicide, and pay plowing expenses

Kadiatou, standing in the middle of the picture with the other Benkadi 4 members, grows rice. loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Helen is 44 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Helen has a general store business in the Philippines. Helen requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Helen has been in this business for 6 years. In the future Helen would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Isidra

texts.en:
Isidra works hard to support her family. Isidra is married and has a sewing business in the Philippines.

Isidra requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials like fabric, thread, etc. for her business.

Isidra has been in this business for 7 years now.

In the future Isidra would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like fabric, thread, etc. for her business

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 54 years old and married with three children.

Jennifer works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to buy more items like snack foods, soft-drinks, candies, biscuits, cooking oil, etc. to sell.

Jennifer has borrowed and repaid 9 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling coconut fruit.

Jennifer aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like snack foods, soft-drinks, candies, biscuits, cooking oil, etc. to sell

loans.name: Ken

texts.en:

Ken has a general store business in the Philippines. Ken requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Ken has been in this business for 4 years. Ken would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Leonora works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell plastic drum business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Leonora is borrowing PHP 27000 through NWTF to purchase more plastic drums to sell for her buy and sell plastic drum business.

Leonora has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans with NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more plastic drums to sell

loans.name: Lizilda

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Lizilda works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from direct selling Avon products. Lizilda is borrowing 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy ingredients like sugar, flour, etc., for her food production business.

Lizilda has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like sugar, flour, etc., for her food production business

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth is 37 years old and married with three children.

Maribeth works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy additional stock like noodles, soft drinks, beers, eggs, cereals, coffee, sugar, etc., to sell.

Maribeth has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Maribeth aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like noodles, soft drinks, beers, eggs, cereals, coffee, sugar, etc., to sell

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is 52 years old and married with one child.  

Paulina is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Paulina requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Paulina has been in pig fattening for three years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Paulina would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Ravelyn

texts.en:
Ravelyn is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ravelyn is 31 years old and has three children who are in school.

Ravelyn has a general store business in the Philippines. Ravelyn requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to buy more goods like canned goods, coffee, bread, soft drinks, juice, detergent, soap, shampoo, etc., to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

Ravelyn has been in this business for two years. In the future, Ravelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more goods like canned goods, coffee, bread, soft drinks, juice, detergent, soap, shampoo, etc., to sell

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 36 years old and married. Rosalie works very hard to provide for her family.

Rosalie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks such as vinegar, candies, biscuits, cooking oil and canned goods to sell.

Rosalie has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items such as vinegar, candies, biscuits, cooking oil and canned goods. 

She successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Rosalie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks such as vinegar, candies, biscuits, cooking oil and canned goods to sell

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Wilma is 46 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

Wilma has a food vending business in the Philippines. Wilma requested a PHP 18000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like rice, sugar, flour, cooking oil, etc. for her food production business.

Wilma has been in this business for 4 years. Wilma would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like rice, sugar, flour, cooking oil, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is 51 years old and married with five children. With one child still in school, Adelaida works very hard to provide for her family.

Adelaida's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Adelaida has restarted her fishing business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Adelaida has taken a PHP 9000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Adelaida is committed to rebuild her devastated life and would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 49 years old and has two children. Elizabeth is married and has one child who is still in school.

Elizabeth and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home was wiped out. 

Elizabeth is taking out a housing loan amounting PHP 9000 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to rebuild a house for her family. 

Elizabeth has been an NWTF borrower since 2009.

With your help, Elizabeth can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. She  would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en:

Epifania's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her general store business and is committed to regain what she lost. Epifania is taking out a PHP 8500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Epifania has been with NWTF since 2011 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. Epifania would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana works hard to support her family. Susana is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Susana requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

Susana has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Susana would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers

texts.en:

She operates a bar and lodge in addition to farming. She hopes to educate her children despite the challenge of competition. 

Christine requests a loan to buy crates of beer and soda to resell.

loans.use: to buy crates of beer and soda.

Gina is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 8500 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Gina has been an NWTF borrower since 2013.

With your help, Gina can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

Imee is taking out a PHP 9,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Imee has been with NWTF since 2009 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Imee would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy bulk quantities of palm oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase wood to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil, rice, and cooking seasonings to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more goats in order to raise and sell them.

loans.name: Hilda Celia

texts.en:
Hilda is a Kubo Financiero client, and this is her story.

Ms. Hilda is 39 years old. She is married, has three sons and lives with her parents. She has a food stall in her home, where she cooks and sells Mexican food and snacks such as quesadillas, gorditas, meat tacos, cecina, etc. She says she is proud of being able to help her husband with the family expenses, and one of her biggest accomplishments is sending her kids to school.

Her challenge is to grow her business and move it to a local spot outside her home. She is asking for a loan to buy a grill and some other inputs for her food stall.

loans.use: To buy a grill and some products for a food stall

loans.name: Allan

texts.en:
Allan is a repeat client of the organization who previously acquired a loan that he has fully repaid. The 44-year-old man is married and blessed with 5 kids with 3 of them attending school. The previous loan helped him to buy bales of clothes at an average cost compared to when he buys only a few clothes from retailers, because he spends a lot on transport to and from the city where he shops. The loan helped him to save much more which increased his profit from UGX 100,000 to UGX 250,000. 

With another financial boost, Allan's business will gain huge momentum and he will be able to increase his business profits and expand. His main challenge has been limited capital and competition. He has a dream of expanding his business to greater heights with this loan from UGAFODE. 

Allan is hopeful that his business will improve since he will be able to compete favorably in the market with enough capital, using the loan from Ugafode. He therefore appreciates Kiva and UGAFODE for the financial assistance rendered to him. Pictured is Allan with his wife who runs the business.

loans.use: to buy secondhand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Som Ol

texts.en: Som Ol is 23 years old. He is a student who lives at Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. Now, he would like to apply for loan of $2,625 to pay for his tuition fees. This loan will help him get a higher education. In the future, he hopes that he can get a job with a good salary to support his family.

loans.use: To pay for his tuition fees

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal COMUZONEI, el socio sigue dedicándose al negocio de venta de artesania, el socio lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pon cada día  a su negocio, él socio vende collares, aretes entre otros hechos en plata, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicito el crédito para la compra de aretes entre otros.
El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the COMUZONEI communal bank. He continues with his business selling handicrafts. He has worked in this business for many years and it is going well, thanks to the effort that he puts into his business every day. He sells necklaces, earrings, and other things made of silver. He hopes to be able to continue working so that he can continue to support his family.

The member requests this loan to purchase earrings and other things.

The member is grateful for the loan provided and promises to make his payments within the established time table.

loans.use: to purchase earrings and other things.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy building materials such as corrugated iron sheets, sand, nails, and cements, to build a house for his family.

loans.name: Afansi

texts.fr: Afansi, 54 ans, a commencé son commerce en 2003. Son mari est un  chauffeur. Afansi  travaille avec l’aide de deux personnes.  Elle est mère de 4 enfants. Actuellement, elle fait une demande de prêt d’une valeur de 500000FCFA  pour la première fois. Afansi  utilisera  ce prêt pour acheter des articles en plastique. Elle  s’approvisionne au grand marché de  Lomé. Afansi mène son activité dans une ruelle et espère dans l’avenir pouvoir se prendre une boutique grâce à son épargne et compte également investir plus dans l’éducation de se enfants
texts.en:
Afansi is 54 years old and began her business in 2003. Her husband is a chauffeur.

Afansi works with the help of two other people. She is the mother of 4 children. Afansi is currently requesting a loan of 500,000 francs CFA for the first time. She will use this loan to purchase plastic items.

Afansi stocks up at the big market in Lomé. She conducts her business in an alley right now but in the future hopes to open up a shop with her savings. She also hopes to be able to invest more in her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase plastic pails, pots, and buckets

loans.name: Maya Group

texts.en:
The indigenous Maya have a long and rich history in Guatemala and Southern Mexico. Eleven women have formed a Friendship Bridge Trust Bank in Guatemala and have proudly named it “Maya”. The ladies have a vision of empowering themselves with education and eliminating poverty in their lives by creating a profit in their small businesses.

Most of the women in the Trust Bank work in textile production and create the beautiful, elaborate and embroidered clothing that the indigenous women proudly wear. Many travelers and tourists travel to Guatemala in search of these textile treasures. 

Paulina is a 31 year old member of the Trust Bank with five years of formal education. She has one daughter. Shortly after she married, together with her husband, the couple began a tee-shirt business. They sell their tee-shirts by the dozen to merchants who re-sell them throughout Guatemala. Paulina is requesting a loan that she will use to purchase a sewing machine. This will allow her to improve and expand her business.

Paulina and the ladies in the “Maya” Trust Bank learn a great deal from the educational components of their monthly meetings with a Friendship Bridge Loan Officer. They are eager to learn how to manage their small loans and so presentations about effective business practices are quite useful. The women learn about accounting and budgeting for their small businesses. They also learn about indebedtedness and customer service. As many have had no formal education, they are eager to learn about nutrition, health, and hygiene as well as self esteem.

KIVA investors are valuable assets in the Microcredit Plus Program of Friendship Bridge. The women in the organization realize this and express their gratitude. The ladies look forward to a brighter tomorrow benefitting themselves, their families and their community!

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal COMUZONE I, la socia sigue con su negocio de peluqueria,la socia elabora diferentes tipos de peinados o cortes de acuerdo al pedido de los clientes, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando  a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de tijeras, secadoras entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: Mercedes belongs to the "COMUZONE I" communal bank. She is continuing with her hair cutting business. She does all different types of styles and cuts according to what the customer wants. She has been doing this business for a long time which provides her with both personal and economic satisfaction. She wants to continue to work in this way in order to support her family. She is requesting this loan to buy scissors, dryers amongst other things. Mercedes is grateful for the loan and promises to pay her installments on time.

loans.use: to buy scissors and driers, etc.

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia is 56 years old, married and blessed with only one child. She is a kind and industrious mother. 

They are currently residing in a rural community and make their living through farming. She helps her husband to get an income through hog-raising. She aims to improve and strengthen the business in order to generate a higher income, and she plans to acquire more piglets to raise. Due to financial constraints and insufficient capital, she wants to take out a loan of PHP12,000 to buy the necessary hog feeds, vitamins and additional piglets to raise.

She hopes that someday she will be able to further improve the business and increase their income.

loans.use: to buy hog feeds, vitamins and additional piglets to raise

location.town: Brgy. Lamo, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Maritza Elizabeth

texts.es:
En la parroquia Crucita del cantón Portoviejo hay un lugar conocido como los arenales aquí cada quince días se reúnen las socias del Grupo De Crédito Nueva Generación, es conocido por sus hermosas playas por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.
En este lugar vive la señora Maritza, tiene 32  años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 12, 11 y 4 años, la mayor estudia en colegio y los menores en escuela. El marido se dedica a la pesca. 
Doña Maritza es una mujer muy luchadora que así como muchas mujeres de la zona se dedican a la compra y venta de pinchaguas (pescado), ella se acerca a los lugares donde los pescadores llegan con los frutos que el mar les brinda para comprar este pez que es muy común en las playas de la localidad, para luego llevarlos a su casa limpiarlos y filetearlos para después vender ya sea por unidades o en tarinas, luego ella las vende a clientes que llegan hasta su casa por este delicioso alimento, lleva dos años dedicada a esta actividad con la cual se gana algo por su cuenta.
Este crédito es para  comprar pescado. Está en el Grupo De Crédito  hace 10 años y le gusta porque los créditos son muy importantes para ella. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
In the Crucita parish of the Portoviejo canton, there is a place known as the sandy area. Here, the members of the "Nueva Generacion" credit group meet every 15 days. This area is known for its food and for the quality of the people.

Maritza lives here. She is 32 years old, in a common law marriage, and has three children, ages 12, 11 and 4. The oldest is in high school and the younger ones also attend school. Her husband is a fisherman.

Maritza is a very hardworking woman. Like many women in the area, she makes a living by purchasing and selling pinchaguas, a type of fish. She goes to the places where the fisherman bring the fruits of their labor to purchase this fish, which is very common on the shores of the area, so that she can later take them home, clean them, and fillet them. Later, she sells them individually or in groups. She sells them to customers who come to her house for this delicious food. 

She has been working in this business for two years and has earned money for herself. This loan will be used to purchase fish. She has been in the credit group for 10 years and likes it because loans are very important for her. Her dream is to provide the best for her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en:
Felipa works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and has been in NWTF since 2014 and is now requesting a PHP 10,000 housing loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.

With your help, Felipa will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

Felipa would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

Josefa works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013 her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and has been in NWTF since 2013 and is now requesting a PHP 9500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can rebuild a house for her family.

With your help Josefa will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future Josefa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

Juliet is 34 years old and married with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Juliet's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her business and is committed to regain what Juliet lost. Juliet is taking out a PHP 4300 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to rebuild her a house for her family.

Juliet has been with NWTF since 2013 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. Juliet would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

Lorelie's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Lorelie has restarted her general store business and now needs to provide for her family with safe shelter.

Lorelie has taken a PHP 4410 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Lorelie is committed to rebuild her devastated life and would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Ma. Gina

texts.en:
Ma. Gina is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ma. Gina is 43 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Ma. Gina's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her pig fattening business and is committed to regain what she lost in the storm. Ma. Gina is taking out a PHP 9000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to rebuild her a house for her family.

Ma. Gina has been with NWTF since 2011 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Ma. Gina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Sharlene Margie

texts.en:
Sharlene Margie is 40 years old and married with three children.

Sharlene Margie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Sharlene Margie has been in this business for 15 years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Sharlene Margie aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Jorame

texts.en: Jorame is a 35-year-old married male with three children, two of whom are attending school. Jorame has a tailoring business. He works 12 hours a day and six days a week on a busy street. He began the business to have a source of income. He wants money to buy uniform materials and expand his business. Jorame is hardworking; however, lack of enough capital is a challenge he faces.

loans.use: to pay for uniform material.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 57 years old and married with two children. Rosalie works very hard to provide for them.

Rosalie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Rosalie has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries. 

In the future Rosalie would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Efrain

texts.en:
Efrain is 41 years old, married, and has one daughter. 

He has been in retail since he was a little boy. He started selling tools, then lived in the United States for a while. In the US, he worked, saved some money, and learned the craft of buying and selling gold. He visits pawn shops, buys cheap gold jewelry, and then he sells it and makes a profit.

Efrain says that he has been in this work for more than two years, has been able to achieve some financial stability, and has even been able to make some home improvements and buy a car.  He says that he is creditworthy. He is honorable and pays his debts on-time.

loans.use: to buy jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Suvdanchimeg

texts.en:
Mrs. Suvdanchimeg, 47, lives with her husband and daughter in Darkhan, second largest city of Mongolia. 

She and her husband have been collecting and selling recyclable materials since 2008. Their daughter is a hairdresser and currently unemployed. 

She is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to buy building materials such as bricks, cement, planks and fiberglass for house renovation. The house her family lives in has been deteriorating over the years due to heavy snowfall and strong storms. After renovation, her family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and then less pollutants will be released into the air.

loans.use: to renovate her old house

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal COMUZONE I ,la socia continua dedicándose al negocio de compra y venta de ropa, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia vende de manera independiente a todos sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia continua viajando para luego entregar sus pedidos a sus clientes, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de chompas.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the COMUZONE I community bank. She continues to work at her business, where she purchases and sells clothing. She is a responsible and diligent person. She independently sells to all customers who come to her business. She continues to travel so that she can later deliver orders to her clients. She hopes to continue working independently so that she can continue to support her family.

She requests the loan to purchase jackets.

The member is grateful for the loan and promises to make the payments according to the established timetable.

loans.use: to purchase jackets.

loans.name: Zoraida

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal COMUZONE I ,la socia sigue dedicándose al negocio de venta de flores, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, a la vez la socia continua dedicándose al negocio de venta de comida, la socia elabora diferentes tipos de platos como sopas, arroz con pollo, saltados entre otros, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para  de esta forma seguir apoyando  a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos como carnes, aceite entre otros.

La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Zoraida belongs to the "COMUZONE I" communal bank. She continues with her business selling flowers. She is a responsible and diligent person. She also is continuing her business selling meals. She makes different types of meals like soup, chicken with rice, saltados (a traditional dish of Peru), etc. Zoraida wants to continue working in this manner in order to support her family. She is requesting this loan to buy supplies like meat and oil, amongst others. She is grateful for the loan and promises to pay her installments on time.





La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.

loans.use: to buy supplies like meat, oil, etc.

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal COMUZONE I, el socio sigue dedicándose a ejercer su carrera, el socio es contador de profesion, el socio lleva buen tiempo ejerciendo su carrera el cual le trae satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de  esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para los estudios de su hija.
El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Felix belongs to the communal bank COMUZONE I. He still works in his profession, he is an accountant.  He has been working on this profession for quite some time and it has provided him with personal and financial satisfaction. He wants to keep working so that he can continue to support his family.
Felix is requesting a loan to pay for his daughter's education.
He is thankful for the loan he has received and commits to make his payments according to schedule.

loans.use: to pay for his daughter's education.

loans.name: Edita Elirita

texts.es:
