En la parroquia Crucita del cantón Portoviejo encontramos un lugar conocido como los arenales, aquí cada quince días se reúnen las socias del Grupo De Crédito Nueva Generación, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.
En este lugar vive la señora Edita, tiene 61 años de edad,  está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene 8 hijos mayores de edad, con ellos viven dos  nietos que los crio desde pequeñitos y que tienen 18 y 12 años y estudian en colegio. Su marido es comerciante. 
Doña Edita es una mujer muy trabajadora que le gusta ganar lo suyo con su esfuerzo, ella tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa, allí vende arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, frutas,  carne, pescado, camarón, queso y también vende ciertos remedios y artículos de bazar, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00  hasta las 20h00, sus nietos y su marido le ayudan cuando pueden, lleva más de 30 años con este negocio el cual le per mite ganarse la vida y darles lo mejor a sus nietos.
Este crédito es para surtir su tienda, para comprar arroz, azúcar, atún, detergentes, y otros productos.  Lleva 15 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que ha recibido con los créditos. Sus sueños son mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
In the parish of Crucita of the Portoviejo canton, we find a place known as Los Arenales. Here the Nueva Generación credit group meets every two weeks. This place is known for its beautiful beaches, its cuisine and the warmth of its people.

Here we meet Edita. She is 61 years old, married and has 8 children. All of them are grown. Two grand children live with them whom she has raised since they were small and are like her own children. They are 18 and 12 and both study in high school. Her husband is a merchant. 

Edita is a hard working woman.  She enjoys earning from her own efforts. She has a store in her house. She sells rice, sugar, oil, detergents, vegetables, fruits, meat, fish, shrimp, cheese as well as certain remedies and variety store items. She works every day from 6:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. Her grandchildren and husband help her when they can.  She has had her store for more than thirty years and this has allowed her to earn a living and also provide the best for her grandchildren.

This loan is to stock her store by buying rice, sugar, tuna, detergents and other products.  She has been in the credit group for 15 years and she likes the benefits she has received with the loans.  Her dream is to improve her store.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, tuna, detergents and other products.

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
En la parroquia Crucita del cantón Portoviejo hay un lugar conocido como los arenales aquí cada quince días se reúnen las socias del Grupo De Crédito Nueva Generación, es conocido por sus hermosas playas por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.
En este lugar vive la señora Ana, tiene 65 años de edad,  está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene 4 hijos mayores de edad e independientes. Su marido es comerciante. 
Doña Ana y su esposo tienen una tienda de víveres en su casa, allí ellos venden todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad como granos, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, frutas, carne, pescado, así como también ciertos  artículos de bazar y papelería, trabajan todos los días desde las 05h00  hasta las 21h00, llevan más de 10 años con su negocio el mismo que lo comenzaron con uno de los créditos que recibió del grupo y  con cada crédito lo han mejorado por lo cual está muy agradecida con el grupo.
Este crédito es para surtir su tienda, va a comprar granos, detergentes y otros productos de primera necesidad.  Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los  créditos empezó su negocio. Sus sueños son seguir mejorando su negocio y su vida.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the 'Nueva Generación' community bank meet in a place called Los Arenales, in the Crucita parish, in the Portoviejo canton. This area is known for its beautiful beaches, its cuisine and the warmth of its people. 

This is where Ana María lives. She is 63 years old, married, and has four children who are all now independent adults. Her husband is a shopkeeper. Ana and her husband have a grocery store in their home where they sell household products like grains, oil, detergents, vegetables, fruit, meat, and fish, as well as housewares and paper goods. They work every day from 5:00 am until 9:00 pm. 

They have been working in this business for more than 10 years. They started the business with one of the loans that they received from the group and have improved their business with each successive loan, for which they are very grateful.

This loan is to stock the business. She will purchase grains, detergent, and other household products. She has been with the community bank from the beginning and likes it because she started her business with one of the loans. Her dream is to continue to improve her business and her life.

loans.use: to purchase grains, detergents, and other household products.

loans.name: Nelda

texts.en:
Nelda is a 46-year-old resident of Tanza, Cavite, in the Philippines. She manages her own household while running her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Nelda operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which sells groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and then selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house, and her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she increases her sales.

Nelda dreams of expanding her business in the coming years. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
Marco vive en la ciudad de chincha, trabaja como empleado en una empresa de su ciudad con lo cual puede tener ingresos para poder salir adelante.

Marco esta muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada el podrá solventar algunos gastos personales y realizar mejoras en su vivienda y de esta manera poder mejorar su calidad de vida y seguir esforzándose para hacer realidad su gran sueño:”Tener un negocio propio”.
texts.en:
Marco lives in the city of Chincha. He works as an employee in a business in the city, which provides him with income to move forward.

Marco is very grateful to the Kiva lenders since, thanks to their support, he will be able to pay for some personal expenses and make improvements to his home. This way, he can improve his quality of life and continue to make a great effort to achieving his biggest goal, which is to own his own business.

loans.use: to improve his home and pay for personal expenses.

loans.name: Norie

texts.en: This time Norie is applying for a new loan of PHP 23,000 in order to purchase more stocks of groceries. She also earns income from her tricycle transportation business. She is thankful that NWTF and Kiva continue to give her and her family the opportunity to increase their income and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Melinda works hard to support her family.

She has a tricycle transportation business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store. Melinda is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF in order to buy spare parts for her tricycle transportation.

Melinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her tricycle.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling fruits in the Philippines, and earns additional income from food vending.  Emily is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF in order to buy more fruits to sell in her food stall.

Emily has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 39 years old and married with five children.

Elena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more grocery items to sell in her store.

Elena has borrowed and repaid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for twenty years and also earns an income from food vending.

Elena aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Arlene works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling spices in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Arlene is borrowing PHP 35,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of spices to sell.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of spices to sell.

loans.name: Edmar

texts.en: Edmar is 25 years old and single. Due to the lack of job opportunities, he engages in raising hogs to generate income. His ambition in life is to become successful and financially stable in the future. To achieve his goals,he wants to improve his business and make it profitable in order to earn a higher income. Having inadequate capital, he is asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy hog feed, vitamins and vaccines for his hogs.  Through this financial assistance, Edmar believes that he will improve his business and achieve his goals someday.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, vitamins and vaccines for his hogs.

location.town: Brgy. Lamo,Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: for the purpose of remodeling her home.

loans.name: Maria Laura

texts.es: Maria de 54 años de edad se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de productos de uso personal su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia y también vende de forma ambulante por las diferentes con las ganancias que están cerca de su casa con lo que obtiene de sus logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su nieta, la clienta desea acrecentar su negocio por eso solicita un crédito que le permita poder comprar todo lo necesario como: perfumes, esmaltes para uñas, desodorantes, lociones, cremas y también desea comprar ropa ya que tiene mucha clientela por dar sus productos a precios accesibles con la ayuda solicitada ella podrá obtener mejores ganancias y así seguirá dándole a su familia lo que necesita sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: Maria is 54 years old and works selling of every type of product for personal use. Her store is located in her place of residence, and she also sells her products by traveling around close to her house. From her earnings she is able to pay her household expenses, she lives in her own house with granddaughter. She hopes to expand her business, and for that reason she is requesting a loan that will allow her to purchase all that's necessary like: perfumes, nail polishes, deodorants, lotions, and creams. She also wants to buy cloths now that she has a lot of clients by giving them prices for her products. With the requested help she will be able to obtain better profits and continue providing for what her family needs without any limitation.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, nail polishes, deodorants, lotions, creams, clothes, etc.

loans.name: Emma

texts.es: Emma de 53 años de edad vive con sus dos hijos y su nuera en casa propia, ella se dedica a la venta de hot dog y tortas en un zona muy transitada, se ha hecho de mucha clientela fija pues las personas saben que todo  es elaborado con material de primera calidad, a precios accesibles pero sobre a todo con un buen servicio; Emma quiere aumentar las ventas para obtener mejores ganancias, pero no tiene suficiente capital para realizarlo por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar embutido, carne de soya, pan, aderezos, verdura etc. ella tiene buenas referencias de pago asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y al mismo tiempo tiene fe que lograra darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Emma is 53 years old. She lives with her two children and her daughter-in-law in her own home. She sells hot dogs and sandwiches in a busy area. She has an established clientele that knows that everything is made with high quality ingredients, has a reasonable price, and that there is good service. Emma wants to increase sales to obtain higher profits, but she does not have enough capital to do it. Thus, she is applying for a loan from INTEGRAL that will allow her to buy lunch meat, soy meat, bread, condiments, vegetables, etc. She has good references that ensure that she will be be able to settle her debt while also having faith that she will be able to give her family a better quality-of-life.

loans.use: to buy lunch meat, soy meat, bread, condiments, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Sofia Yrene

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal COMUZONE I, la socia sigue dedicándose al negocio de venta de chompas, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de chompas para su negocio.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank Comuzone I. She continues with her business of selling sweaters, has done it for quite some time. This business brings her satisfactions not only financial ones but also personal, she hopes to continue working so that she can keep supporting her family.
She is requesting the loan to purchase sweaters for her business.
She is grateful for the loan and she promises to make the scheduled payments.

loans.use: to buy sweaters for her business.

loans.name: Illary Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ILLARY,el banco esta ubicado en el departamento de Cusco.
La socia Ana tiene 62 años de edad es casada y tiene 05 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende diferentes tipos de productos como arroz, azucar, leche entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando  a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz, azúcar entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida  por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
Los demás socios se dedican a la venta de ropa, docentes, restaurante, manualidades, salon de belleza, mecánico, maestro constructor, tienda de abarrotes.
La foto fue tomada en dos grupos por el número de socios.
El socio que sale adjunto a la foto pidió permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
The partner belongs to the communal bank, ILLARY, which is located in the department of Cusco.  The partner, Ana, is 62 years old, married and has five children.  She alternates her daily activities with the business of her grocery store.  She sells different types of products such as rice, sugar, milk, and others.  She has been dedicating herself to this business for some time, which is doing well thanks to the commitment she puts into it everyday.  She desires to continue working in this way so that she can continue to support her family.  She requests this loan to buy rice, sugar and others.  She feels grateful for the granted loan and promises to meet the established quotas.  

The other partners make a living in selling clothes, teachers, restaurants, crafts, a beauty salon, mechanic, general contractor and grocery stores.  This photo was taken in two groups because of the number of partners.  The partner that appears attached to the photo asked for permission to be late to the meeting for work reasons.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar and others.

loans.name: Luiggi

texts.es:
Luiggi vive en la Ciudad de Ica junto a su esposa. Este joven emprendedor desde hace 3 años trabaja arduamente con su Mototaxi transportando a sus clientes de un lugar a otro con gran entusiasmo, ya que su objetivo es sacar adelante a su familia.
Sin duda alguna Luiggi es una persona luchadora que trabaja día y noche para poder cumplir uno de sus más grandes sueños: “Tener un carro propio”.
Gracias a los prestamistas de Kiva, Luiggi podrá utilizar ese apoyo recibido para comprar un juego de dormitorio y así poder descansar mejor y seguir trabajando.
texts.en: Luiggi lives in the city of Ica together with his wife. This young entrepreneur has been working hard the last 3 years on his motorcycle taxi transporting his clients from one place to another with great enthusiasm. His object is to get his family ahead. Without any doubt Luiggi is a fighter who struggles day and night to achieve one of his greatest goals which is to own his own vehicle. Thanks to the lenders at Kiva, Luiggi can use this support offered him to buy bedroom furniture and be able to rest better and continue his work.

loans.use: to buy bedroom furniture.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is 57 years old, married and has five children, three of whom are in school.

Julie is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Julie requested a PHP 37,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Julie has been raising pigs for twelve years.

In the future, Julie would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Angel Israel

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal COMUZONE II,el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, provincia de Cusco y departamento de cusco.
El socio Ángel tiene 67 años de edad tiene 03 hijos y es casado, él socio alterna sus actividades diarias brindando el servicio de taxi, el socio lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este trabajo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esa forma poder seguir apoyando a su familia. Él socio solicita el crédito para realizar el mantenimientos de su carro.
El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The partner belongs to the communal bank, COMUZONE II. The bank is located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.  The partner, Angel, is 67 years old, married, and has three children.  He alternates his daily activities with providing a taxi service.  He has been dedicating himself to this work for some time which is going well thanks to the effort he puts into his business everyday.  He desires to continue working in this way to continue helping his family. 

He requests this loan to realize maintenance to his car.  He feels grateful for the granted credit and he promises to fulfill the established quotas.

loans.use: To realize maintenance to his car.

loans.name: Fanny Luz

texts.es:
La socia continua dedicándose al negocio de venta de joyas, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia vende lo que son aretes,collares,pulseras entre otros, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de  esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar aretes entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Fanny continues her business of selling jewelry. Her business is doing well thanks to the commitment she puts into it every day. She sells earrings, necklaces, and bracelets, among other types of jewelry. She would like to be able to keep working on this so that she can continue to support her family.

Fanny is requesting a loan to buy earrings, among other things. She is grateful for the loan, and commits to making her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy earrings, among other jewelry.

loans.name: Ángela Georgina

texts.es:
En la parroquia Crucita del cantón Portoviejo hay un lugar conocido como los arenales, aquí cada quince días se reúnen las socias del Grupo De Crédito Nueva Generación, es conocido por sus hermosas playas, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.
En este lugar vive la señora Ángela, tiene 56 años de edad, hace varios años su esposo falleció pero de esta relación tiene seis hijos mayores de edad. 
Doña Ángela para salir adelante después de la muerte de su marido tuvo que empezar un negocio para salir adelante, ella tiene una tienda de viveras de consumo en su casa,  allí vende todo tipo de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, verduras y frutas,  trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, su hija le ayudan en su trabajo cuando pueden y este desocupada, pero por lo general es ella la que mas pasa en su negocio. Tiene 5  años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual sale adelante.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Grupo De Crédito  hace 4 años y le gusta porque ha hecho más amigas en el grupo. Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
In the parish of Crucita of the Portoviejo canton, we find a place known as Los Arenales. Here the Nueva Generación credit group meets every two weeks. This place is known for its beautiful beaches, its cuisine and the warmth of its people.

Here lives Angela, 56 years old.  Several years ago her husband passed away, but together they have six grown children.  In order to get ahead after her husband passed away, Angela started a convenience store in her home.  Here she sells all types of products such as rice, sugar, oils, detergents, vegetables and fruits.  She works everyday from 6:00 am to 8:00 pm and sometimes later.  Her daughter helps her when she can and is unoccupied, but most of the time it's Angela working in the store.  She has been working five years in this business and it has allowed her to get ahead.  This loan will help her to stock her store, as she will buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, sausage and other convenience store products.  

She has been in the credit group for four years and she likes it because she has made many friends in the group.  Her goals are to get ahead in her business and that her store grows more each day.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, sausages and other convenience store products.

loans.name: Marietha

texts.en:
Marietha is 35 years old and lives in Bonifacio ext. Aguada, Ozamiz City Misamis Occidental. She is a retailer selling different merchandise, which she has been doing for four years, to provide for her family's daily needs. She had many avid costumers who regularly buy from her store. 

Marietha requested a loan from PMPC, which she will use to to purchase inventories of RTWs, plastic wares, and basic commodities. With this loan, she hopes to generate more income.

loans.use: to purchase inventories of RTWs, plastic wares, and basic commodities

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio vive en la ciudad de chincha y para poder ganarse el pan de cada día trabaja como ayudante de construcción desde hace 5 años y de esta manera puede sacar adelante a su familia ya que es padre de un pequeño de 3 años por el cual da la vida.

Julio esta agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado para poder mejorar su vivienda y poder solventar algunos gastos personales y asi poder seguir trabajando y luchando para hacer realidad su gran sueño:”Darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia”.
texts.en:
Julio lives in the city of Chincha. To make his daily bread he has been working as a construction assistant for the past 5 years. Doing this he can get his family ahead as he is the father of a 3 year old, for whom he would give his life.

Julio is grateful to the lenders at Kiva as thanks to their support they are offering him, he can make improvements to his house and pay some personal expenses. Then he can continue to work and strive to make his dream a reality " to provide a better standard of living for his family".

loans.use: to make improvements on his house and pay some personal expenses.

loans.name: Christian Eric

texts.es:
Christian tiene 21 años y vive en la ciudad de Chincha, es un joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante, por ello cada día se esfuerza mucho para poder salir adelante, es por ello que trabaja como albañil desde hace 2 años.

Christian esta agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada el podrá solventar algunos gastos personales y asimismo podrá realizar la compra de enseres para su hogar y de esta manera poder mejorar su calidad de vida y seguir luchando por hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener una carrera profesional”.
texts.en: 21-year-old Cristian lives in the city of Chincha. He is a young man who is determined to succeed and so, every day, he does everything he can to make progress. That is why he has worked as a builder for 2 years. Cristian is grateful to Kiva lenders as, with their help, he will be able to cover some of his personal expenses and also buy equipment for his home. This will enable him to improve his quality of life and keep working to achieve his great ambition: "To have a professional career".

loans.use: To buy equipment and cover his personal expenses

loans.name: Elaine Marie

texts.en: Realizing that education is the key for her to achieve a better future, Elaine Marie, 19 years of age, wants to pursue her college studies. With that she is requesting a loan amount of PHP 40,000 to KIVA lenders thru ASKI for her tuition fees. According to Elaine, she is seeking assistance from the lenders because her parents do not have enough money for her college courses.  As the eldest child among three children, she wants to take responsibility by helping her parents finance the education of her siblings when she finishes even a vocational course. She wants to take a Microfinance Technology Course for her to have a diploma. Elaine believes that after five years she is already a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition fees.

loans.name: Artemeo

texts.en:
This is Artemeo, 53, resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Virginia, a housewife and mother to their child. Artemeo, together with his wife, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Artemeo maintains a tricycle business. He owns and drives one tricycle (motorcycle with sidecar) that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. He starts working early in the morning until late in the evening. There are times when he drives late evening until the wee hours in order to have bigger profits. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of PHP 300 in his transportation business every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting an amount of PHP 9,000 for his loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy motorcycle parts for the maintenance of his tricycle unit. He has to maintain his unit in good condition in order to have a regular income for the daily needs of his family. 

Artemeo hopes to open another business and dreams that his relationship with his family grows fonder. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their tricycle unit.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
This is Lilian. She is 45 years old, and a resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Nelson and a mother to her child. She, together with her husband manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Lilian is in an Arts business. She makes balloons out of plastic or crepe paper, which is an affordable decor for parties or fiestas. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 everyday.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy crepe paper, glue, patterns, plastic and other materials needed in her business. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.

Lilian simply dreams of providing for all the needs of her family and hopes that she will have more customers, not only in her community. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy crepe paper, glue, patterns, plastic and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Bunna

texts.en:
Bunna is 45 years old, and a resident from a small village in Prey Kabbas district, Takeo province. Bunna is married and has three children. To nourish the family and educate his children, Bunna is employed as a district policeman of a public sector, ensuring safety for people in his area. From this, he is able to earn a decent salary and generate additional income by helping his wife manage their farm.

Thanks to Hattha Kaksekar's new water loan program with a special rate, Bunna is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, safeguarding his family's health and protecting the environment. He will use the loan he's applying for to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank to improve his household sanitation practices for the sake of his family.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank to improve his household sanitation practices for the sake of his family.

loans.name: Santa Maria Group

texts.es:
El grupo Santa Maria está en su 1° ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, también forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde a través de la encuesta quieren conocer la situación de cada una y conforme a ello poder trabajar.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Lucia quien se dedica a la elaboración de comidas, ella vende de manera ambulante los productos que hace, y de esa forma se gana la vida de una manera honrada. Ella sueña con poder tener una tienda de comidas bien amplia donde poder ofrecer una mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes.
Lucia quiere este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para sus comidas, como ser verduras, condimentos, carne, pollo, aderezos y demás. Todas están contentas por la oportunidad que recibieron de poder seguir creciendo en sus microemprendimientos.
texts.en:
The Santa Maria group is in its first cycle as a communal bank of women, and is also participating in the poverty elimination survey, where they will use the results to evaluate their situations to be able to improve their conditions.

One of the members is Lucia, makes a living as a street vendor selling her homemade meals. In doing this, she is getting by making an honest living. She dreams of having her own store with many types of meals, where she could offer a larger variety of products to her customers. 

Lucia is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of supplies for her meals, such as vegetables, spices, meat, poultry, seasonings, and more. All of the group members are grateful and happy for the opportunity they have been given to continue growing their small businesses.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, spices, meat, poultry, seasonings, and more, to make meals to sell.

loans.name: Las Divinas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Las Divinas está en el 4º ciclo  del programa de Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. La mayoría de las integrantes realizan actividades productivas y las que no tienen proyecto de emprender para poder así ir aumentando sus ingresos. 
Una de las integrantes la Sra. Silvia, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comidas, y el préstamo lo pide para invertir en dicha actividad, es decir para la compra de mas insumos para la elaboración de los comestibles, como carne, verduras, condimentos y demás. Su marido también trabaja y de esa manera se ayudan para poder mantener la casa. Según esta primera de eliminación de la pobreza, ella se encuesta encuentra mejorando, pero de igual manera ella se está esforzando por superarse.
texts.en: The Las Divinas group is in its 4th cycle in the comite de Mujeres Emprendedoras (enterprising women's committee) programme, where all the members work and help each other to make progress. Most of the members work in producing things and those who do not are looking for a project to undertake so that they can boost their income. One of the members is Silvia, whose work involves preparing and selling food. She is seeking the loan to invest in her business, that is to buy more supplies for preparing food: meat, vegetables, spices and other things.  Her husband also works and so they both contribute to the upkeep of their house. In her first eliminating poverty questionnaire, she shows that she is improving, but she is also working very hard to better herself even more.

loans.use: To buy meat, vegetables, spices and other things to make food for sale.

loans.name: Sinat

texts.en:
Sinat, aged 65, is a humble man and a rice grower from Chum Kiri district, Kampot province. He owns and operates farmland, planting and harvesting rice to sell to earn a living, and has the support from his wife and children. He has been in this field for more than 20 years, and earns well for the family.

Thanks to Hattha Kaksekar's new water loan program with a special rate, Sinat is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, safeguarding his family's health and protecting the environment. He will use the loan he's applying for to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank to improve his household sanitation practices for the sake of his family. This will be his first loan and he commits to repay it back on time.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank to improve his household sanitation practices for the sake of his family.

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
Lita is from Bino-ongan, Enrique Villanueva, Siquijor. She is forty-eight years old and is married with two children.

In 2012, Lita applied for membership with PMPC. Hearing all the benefits, she never hesitated to become a member. She maintains the status of being a member in good standing and repays her obligations in a timely manner.

Recently, Lita asked for financial assistance of Php 25,000 to purchase additional ingredients such as baking powder, flour and sugar for her bakery. Through this, she hopes to increase her income and expand her business. She has found assistance for their financial needs through Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and she is thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: purchase additional ingredients such as baking powder, flour and sugar.

loans.name: Josie

texts.en: Josie is 40 years old, and lives in Bitoon Aguada, Ozamiz City Misamis Occidental. She has an agricultural business where she generates income and provides for their daily needs.  She manages a small-time poultry business with 300 chickens. Now, she is asking a loan to purchase poultry feed and laying mash. Josie hopes to sustain this new business venture.

loans.use: to purchase poultry feed and laying mash.

loans.name: Elena Doraliza

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Inmaculada se reúne cada quince días  en La parroquia La Sequita de Montecristi, cantón conocido por los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla que son apreciados dentro y fuera del país.
La señora Elena Tiene 41 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos los cuales son gemelos,  tienen 4 años y este año empiezan a estudiar en la escuela. Su esposo es maestro en una escuela de la localidad.
Doña Elena tiene una pequeña papelería en su casa, allí además de útiles escolares también  se dedica a la venta de productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los  días, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana. Actualmente lo que más vende son  los útiles escolares ya que es inicio de clases, ella lleva más de 13 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual se gana algo extra por el bien de su familia. También se dedica a la cría de chanchos y gallinas.
Este crédito es para comprar útiles escolares. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde el inicio y le gusta porque los créditos le son de mucha ayuda. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus pequeños.
texts.en:
The "María Inmaculada" communal bank meets every fortnight in the Parish of La Sequita de Montecristi, a canton that is famous for it's Panama hat which is valued both nationally and internationally.

Elena is 41 years old, is married and from this relationship she has two children who are twins. They are four years old and will start school this year. Her husband is a teacher in the local school. Elena has a small stationary store in her house and besides selling school supplies she sells Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and accessories for women). She works every day and leaves her products on credit , collecting each week.

Right now what she sells the most is school products as it is the start of classes. She has been doing this for 13 years and she earns some extra money for the well-being of her family. She also raises pigs and chickens. This loan is to buy school supplies. She has been in this communal bank since it's inception and she likes it because the loans help her so much. Her dream is to provide the best for her children.

loans.use: to buy school supplies.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is a business woman from Baybay Maningcol, Ozamiz City in the Philippines. She is sixty-eight years old and has eleven children. In order to earn money she decided to sell fish around their barangay, or village.

A few years ago, she became a member of PMPC to support her capital needs. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase more fish to sell. Remedios hopes to sustain her business and live comfortably with her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco is fifty-three years old, married and has five children. 

He is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Francisco requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for his pigs.

Francisco has been raising pigs for twenty-five years now, and has borrowed twenty times in the past from NWTF to sustain his business.

In the future, Francisco would like to save money to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for his pigs.

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
Judy is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Judy is 49 years old and both of her children are in school.

Judy has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Judy requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

Judy has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, Judy would like to save money so she can afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is thirty-five years old and married with four children. With two children currently in school, Marilyn works very hard to provide for them.

Marilyn's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. Marilyn has restarted her business buying and selling dried coconut meat and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Marilyn has taken a PHP 9,795 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Marilyn is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in future would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 61 years old, married, and has five children. She is a hard working entrepreneur.  Mary operates a general store business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for five years. 

Mary requested a loan from NWTF for 11,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase more goods such as snack foods, sardines, seasonings, and other groceries. In the future, Mary would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase snack foods, sardines, seasonings, and other groceries.

loans.name: Muhache

texts.en: Muhache appreciates her previous loan, as it improved her living standards. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She would like to apply for a loan to buy food ingredients such as onions, cooking oil, wheat flour, maize flour, rice, tea leaves and sugar. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients such as onions, cooking oil, wheat flour, maize flour, rice, tea leaves and sugar.

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
La Sra. Paula está casada, tiene 4 hijas mayores, todas ellas ya casadas e independientes. Ella tiene una pequeña despensa donde trabaja todos los días, y con lo cual ha dado a sus hijos todo lo que necesitaban, eso también ayudada por su marido, que es guardia de seguridad.
Ella es una persona muy trabajadora, y por sobre todo luchadora, que con mucho sacrificio y con la ayuda de su esposo pudieron sacar adelante a sus hijos.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder comprar bebidas, lácteos, panificados, verduras, enlatados y demás, y de esa forma poder seguir trabajando y luchando en su negocio.
texts.en: Paula is married and has 4 grown-up daughters, all of whom are married and have left home. She runs a small shop where she works every day and which has enabled her to give her children everything they needed. She has been helped in this by her husband, who is a security guard. She is a very hardworking and extremely determined person who, by making great sacrifices and with the help of her husband, has been able to provide for her children. She is seeking this loan to buy drinks, dairy products, bread, vegetables, tinned goods and other items so that she can continue working and striving for success in her business.

loans.use: To buy drinks, dairy products, bread, vegetables, tinned goods and other items

loans.name: Linaflor

texts.en:
Linaflor is 43 years of age, married, and gifted with three school-age children. 

To have an additional source of income, Linaflor engages in raising hogs within her community. Due to the high cost of school fees, she needs to increase her income to support the education of her children. 

To make improvements in the business, she wants a loan of PHP 18,000 to buy feed, vitamins, and vaccines for her hogs. Being a patient and industrious mother, she is hoping that someday she will make her business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and vaccines for her hogs

location.town: Brgy. Lamo,Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Joeben

texts.en: Joeben, 18 years old, is from Paltic, Dingalan, Aurora. He once thought of giving up his studies, however, he realized that the chance of having a better career is through a college diploma. Thus he decided to pursue it.  Joeben’s father is a fisherman, while his mother is a fish vendor.  His parents only finished elementary and secondary levels of education. He shared that his parents do not have the capability to pay his tuition fees in full.  Thus, they are requesting an educational loan of PHP 40,000 to the KIVA lenders thru ASKI. He plans to take a Microfinance Technology Course. He believes that having a diploma will open opportunities for him. With that, he will surely be glad if his request is granted, because it will not only help him, but his parents as well.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition fees.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 38 years old and has ten children, three of whom are in school. Mary Jane has a live-in partner. She and her family survived Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out.  Mary Jane is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 8,500 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor, to build a house for her family.  She has been an NWTF borrower since 2013.

With your help, Mary Jane can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of Super Typhoon Haiyan. In future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 40 years old, married, and has four children, two in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Mary Jane's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her general store business and is committed to regain what she lost. Mary Jane is taking out a PHP 9,500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build her a house for her family.

Mary Jane has been with NWTF since 2010 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. Mary Jane would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad is 62 years old, married and has five children, one in school. 

Felicidad is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Felicidad requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF  to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Felicidad has been farming vegetables for 22 years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Felicidad would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Nida Mae

texts.en:
Nida Mae is 34 years old and married with six children, five currently in school. Nida Mae works very hard to provide for her family.

Nida Mae's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Nida Mae has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Nida Mae has taken out a PHP 8,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Nida Mae is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in the future would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 54 years old and married with three children. Victoria works very hard to provide for her family.

Victoria's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Victoria has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Victoria has taken a PHP 9,500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Victoria is committed to rebuild her devastated life and would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Felixberta

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Felixberta works hard to support her family.  She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from charcoal retailing and abaca weaving businesses. Felixberta is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Felixberta has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Niña

texts.en:
Niña works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has been with NWTF since 2013. She has restarted her business and is now requesting a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she could build a house for her family.

With your help, Niña will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Niña would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Wakati

texts.en:
This is Wakati. Her previous loan was a big help in her sewing business. She has been in this business for years now, and it keeps on growing. 

She would like to apply for a loan to purchase cloth material and sewing threads for her business.She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to purchase cloth material and sewing threads for her business

loans.name: Merashid

texts.en:
Merashid is a hard-working and enterprising woman.She is a married mother of six school-age children. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food .

Merashid prepares dumplings using sugar, cooking oil, and wheat flour and sells to neighbors and passersby. She cites seasonality as her major challenge.

Merashid is requesting a loan to purchase wheat flour, sugar, and cooking oil for her business. She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, sugar, and cooking oil for her business.

loans.name: Nishuuli

texts.en: Nishuuli appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standard. She is requesting another loan to purchase onions, tomatoes, vegetables, and potatoes for resale .Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She thanks Yehu for its financial support.

loans.use: to purchase onions, tomatoes, vegetables, and potatoes for resale

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a married woman with one child going to school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.  For the past three years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbors and passersby.  She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenges. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase soap, wheat flour, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking oil for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase soap, wheat flour, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking  oil for resale.

loans.name: Vinani

texts.en: Vinani appreciates her previous loan that improved her living standard. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her grocery store business and earn a higher income. She would like to apply for a loan to buy more household consumables such as wheat flour, maize flour, rice, and sugar. She thanks Yehu for its financial support.

loans.use: to buy more household consumables such as wheat flour, maize flour, rice, and sugar

loans.name: Tuyukua Group

texts.es:
Las 20 integrantes de este grupo son mujeres muy emprendedoras, que están luchando por salir adelante, a través del esfuerzo de todas, y ayudadas con las capacitaciones y reuniones de apoyo que están recibiendo.
La Sra. Anatolia es la presidenta de este grupo, ella es una persona muy responsable y lo muestra en la forma en la que trabaja como coordinadora de su grupo. Anatolia vende tejidos de ñanduti, un tejido típico y muy bello del Paraguay, y por medio de esto ayuda a su marido con los gastos del día a día.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de hilos, agujas, y bastidores para poder seguir haciendo su tejido de ñanduti, y de esa forma venderlos para poder ayudar a su familia. Todas agradecen por la oportunidad que están recibiendo.
texts.en: The 20 members of this group are all very enterprising women, who are striving hard to make progress through their efforts and with the help of the training and support meetings which are available to them. Anatolia is the group's chairwoman. She is a very responsible woman as can be seen in the way that she works as group coordinator. Anatolia sells ñanduti embroidered lace, a typical and very beautiful Paraguayan textile and this business enables her to help her husband with the day-to-day expenses. She is seeking this loan to buy thread, needles and frames so that she can continue producing her ñanduti embroidered lace, which she can then sell to help her family. They are all grateful for the opportunity which is provided for them.

loans.use: To buy thread, needles and frames for making ñanduti embroidered lace

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es:
EL socio pertenece al banco comunal COMUZONE I, el socio continua dedicándose al negocio de venta de ropa, él socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso, él socio lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando  a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de casacas para su negocio.
El socio se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank Comuzone I. He continues with his business selling clothes, he is a responsible and hardworking person, and has worked on this business for a long time.  He does well because of the work he puts into his business each day, he wants to continue working to keep supporting his family.
The member requests the loan to buy jackets for his business.
He feels grateful for the loan and he promises to comply with the established terms.

loans.use: to buy jackets for his business.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos es casado, es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, tiene tres hijos, a quienes con la ayuda de su esposa están sacando adelante con mucho sacrificio, para poder darles una vida digna y que no les falte nada.
Carlos es zapatero, y se dedica a esto hace 20 años, es una persona muy trabajadora, que se ha abierto camino a través de su esfuerzo y con la ayuda de su familia.
Hoy pide este préstamo para poder construir su casa, donde podrá armar su taller de zapatería, y así seguir con su trabajo para continuar ayudando a su familia.
texts.en: Carlos, who is from the city of Carapegua, is married with three children who he and his wife, through great sacrifice, are providing for so that they can have a decent life and want for nothing. Carlos has been a shoemaker for 20 years and is a very hardworking person who has made headway through his effort and with the help of his family. He is currently seeking this loan to build a house where he can set up his shoemaking workshop. This will enable him to continue his work and carry on helping his family.

loans.use: To build a house and set up a shoemaking workshop.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is a responsible housewife who cooks and sells snack foods within the local community. She loves to cook and sell hamburgers, hot dogs, and other snack foods. It is her way of helping her husband gain income to sustain their necessities and save for future emergencies. She and her husband aspire to become successful and financially stable in order to give their children a better life. She wants to offer more kinds of foods to her customers but is unable to acquire the needed ingredients and materials due to a lack of capital. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000.00  to buy burgers, bread, eggs, hot dogs, ketchup, mayonnaise, and soft drinks. She is hoping that she will be granted her loan request to satisfy her customers' demands as well as meet her daily necessities.

loans.use: to buy burgers, bread, eggs, hot dogs, ketchup, mayonnaise, and soft drinks.

location.town: Brgy. Dopaj, Dupax del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora finds herself busy with her vending activities. She sells a variety of fruits and vegetables, at the wet market. She is from Aloran. At the age of 69 years old, she is known for her place.

She has previously obtained loans from PMPC, and all were paid back with no record of default. Recently, she applied for a new loan. She will use it to purchase fruits and vegetables to resell. She deeply wishes to add a market stall soon, for additional income.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables to resell

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell for her charcoal business. Teresita has been in this business for four years. She also earns more income from farming rice. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell for her business.

loans.name: Mwanamkasi

texts.en: Mwanamkasi is a very hardworking woman, who lives in her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. She has three children going to school. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.  Mwanamkasi operates a fruit selling business, and sells to passersby and neighbors. She cites seasonality as her major challenge. With the loan, she wants to purchase mangoes, oranges, and bananas for resale. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase mangoes, oranges, and bananas for resale.

loans.name: Bidalla

texts.en:
Bidalla greatly appreciates Kiva lenders for their previous financial support, which enabled her to get extra income from her fish-selling business.

Now, Bidalla wants to purchase iron sheets to repair her leaking roof. She thus joined Yehu, to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase iron sheets to repair her leaking roof.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a very hardworking and enterprising woman, who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work. Besides her fish-selling business, Fatuma prepares dumplings and sells them to passersby and neighbors.

She is asking for a loan to buy ingredients for her business, such as wheat flour, sugar and cooking oil. She is grateful for the financial support she has received.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, such as wheat flour, sugar and cooking oil

loans.name: Samah

texts.en:
Samah was born in 1987. She is married and a mother of two daughters and one son. Her husband (pictured) is a farmer. 

Because of Samah's sense of responsibility, she has been selling fuel at her house to people in her area, and her business has been a good source of income. Now she is seeking a youth loan to buy more fuel so that she can expand her business and raise her level of profit.

loans.use: To buy more fuel to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, pure water, and biscuits

loans.name: Samira

texts.en: Samira is a 42-year-old married woman, who is the mother of three children. She has been helping her husband to improve their living conditions, by selling baby pampers (diapers) at home. She was bringing those pampers from the wholesale market and packing them in smaller quantities to resell. Having built a good customer base, she is now planning to expand her business by purchasing housewares and foodstuffs. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For that, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to add housewares and foodstuffs to her business

loans.name: Deisy Alilinda

texts.es: Es originaria de Waspam, tiene 36 años, casada con 4 hijos: tres adolescentes que cursan su secundaria y un menor de edad de 5 años que estudia segundo nivel de pre-escolar. Cuenta con una experiencia de aproximadamente 15 años, en conjunto con su esposo. Desde hace aproximadamente 20 años vive en una casa de tambo de madera. Con el objetivo de tener una vivienda de minifalda de concreto y madera solicita financiamiento para comprar materiales de construcción: 25 bolsas de cemento, 7 quintales de hierro, arena fina, clavos, alambre de amarre, 200 pies tablar de madera y cubrir costos de mano de obra, para ir construyendo poco a poco su vivienda. Su sueño es tener una vivienda de concreto de dos pisos con las condiciones básicas, para que su familia viva de manera digna y segura.
texts.en:
Deisy Alilinda is from Waspam, is 36 years old, and is married with four children. Three of them are teenagers who study at secondary school, and the youngest is 5 and studies in the second grade of pre-school. She has been with her partner for around 15 years. She has lived in a wooden house for about 20 years.

With the aim of building a wooden house with a cement base, she is requesting a loan to buy building materials, including 25 bags of cement, 7 quintales of metal, fine sand, nails, wire tie, and 200 board feet of wood, and to cover labour costs, so that she can build her home little by little. 

Her dream is to have a concrete home with two floors with all the basics, so that her family can live in a dignified and safe manner.

loans.use: to buy building materials, including 25 bags of cement, 7 quintales of metal, fine sand, nails, wire tie, and 200 board feet of wood, and to cover labour costs.

loans.name: Liz

texts.es:
Liz tiene 22 años de edad es  madre soltera y vive en la ciudad de Carapeguá.
Ella es una joven muy emprendedora, quien empezó desde muy joven a trabajar como empleada doméstica y de a poco iba ahorrando su dinero para poder fabricar ella misma la tradicional hamaca y sobrecamas, ya que su madre se dedica a eso y así dejar de ser empleada doméstica.
Hoy día ya tiene clientela formada en la zona y así aumenta su pedido de productos, gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación ya pudo construirse una pequeña casa, y mantiene a su hijo por medio de su esfuerzo y su honrado trabajo.
Ella es una joven que a pesar de ser muy joven ya es madre, y es muy sacrificada. Solicita el préstamo para la compra de hilo, color y otros, para seguir con sus confecciones, ya que en esta temporada lo solicitan mucho sus clientes.
texts.en:
Liz is 22 yars old, she is a single mom and lives in the city of Carapegua.
She is a very entrepreneurial young woman.  From a very young age she started working in house cleaning services and slowly saved up her money to be able to make herself traditional hammocks and quilts, her mother also works in this so this was a way to stop cleaning houses.
Today she has a clientele in the area and the orders for her products increase thanks the effort and dedication.  She was able to build a small house and supports her son through honest work.
In spite of being so young she is a mother and has sacrificed a lot.  She requests a loan to buy threads, dye and other items, to continue with her designs, as this season her clients make many requests.

loans.use: to buy threads, dye and other items to make hammocks and quilts.

loans.name: Kuña Rory Group

texts.es:
Kuña Rory se llama este numeroso grupo de mujeres, donde cada una se puso como meta el crecimiento de todas, no solo en lo económico, sino también como personas. Las 23 mujeres están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, para que por medio de su trabajo y lucha puedan ir mejorando.
La Sra. Idalia es una de las que integran este grupo, quien hace y vende quesos, además tiene una despensa en la que trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas del día. Es una mujer muy admirable por el trabajo que hace y la manera en la que se sacrifica para poder ayudar a su familia. 
La Sra. Idalia pide este préstamo para la compra de quesos, ya que así podrá surtirse más, lo que le ayudará a tener mayor variedad que poder ofrecer a clientes. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe y que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Kuña Rory is the name of this large group of women, in which each member's aim is to foster the growth of the entire group, not only economically, but also as individuals. The 23 women are taking part in the poverty elimination survey, so that through their work and fight they can keep improving.

Idalia is one of the group members. She makes and sells cheese, and also has a grocery store in which she works every day from very early in the morning. She is a very admirable woman for the work she does and the way in which she sacrifices herself to support her family.
 
Idalia is requesting this loan to buy cheese, so that she can stock her store with more produce, which will help her to offer a greater variety to offer to her customers. She is grateful for this opportunity she is receiving which will be of great help to her.

loans.use: to buy cheese to sell.

loans.name: Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El grupo que lleva por nombre Esperanza  está en su octavo ciclo del programa de comités, es un grupo muy activo, que a través de la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, como un medio utilizado para conocer la situación de vida de cada una, y sumado a las capacitaciones que van recibiendo, pudieron mejorar bastante sus ingresos y calidad de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Fatima quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, lo que quiere decir que debe seguir esforzándose un poco más para poder mejorar poco a poco, todo esto a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y por medio de sus trabajos de costura, también de decoradora y peluquera ella es una  mujer muy trabajadora que tiene el espíritu jovial y muchas ganas de salir adelante y poder superarse.
La Sra. Fatima solicita de este préstamo para la compra de telas, agujas, tintes, tijeras, etc., y de esa forma poder seguir cumpliendo con los pedidos de sus clientes, y mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
This group is called the Esperanza  group and it is in its eighth cycle of the committee programme. It is a very active group, which, through the poverty elimination survey used as a means to assess the living circumstances of each member, and the training that they receive, is managing to improve the income and life quality of members.

One of its members is Fatima. In her most recent survey, she scored a level poverty of one, which means that she should keep working hard to improve little by little. All of this through effort and continuous work and her job dressmaking, decorating and hairdressing. She is a very hard-working woman who has a young spirit and a great desire to move forwards and succeed.

Fatima is requesting this loan to buy fabric, needles, dyes, scissors, and other items so that she can continue to fulfill the orders of her customers, and improving her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fabric, needles, dyes, scissors, and other items to use in dressmaking.

loans.name: Isabelina

texts.es:
La señora Isabelina es de la ciudad de Curuguaty, está casada, y comenta que se dedica a ser peluquera.
Se dedica al ramo de la Peluquería, donde tiene su propio negocio en su casa, y donde todos los días atiende a una gran variedad de clientes y clientas, y de esa forma sale adelante y tiene los ingresos para ayudar a su familia
Ella pide este préstamo para poder comprar nuevas maquinarias para su peluquería, ya que le permitirá dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes y seguir creciendo en su emprendimiento.
texts.en: Isabelina comes from the city of Curuguaty. She is married and works as a hairdresser. She has her own beauty salon, which is located at her house. Every day, she has many customers, both men and women. This source of income enables her to help support her family. She is asking for a loan in order to buy new machines for her beauty salon in order to provide better service and make her business grow.

loans.use: to buy machines for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Von

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province, Von is 51 years old, widowed, and a responsible mother of six children. To meet the family’s daily needs, Von owns and manages farmland, planting and harvesting rice, which is the primary source of her income. She has been engaged in this for nearly 25 years and earns additional income by selling grocery items in her village.

Due to the decrease of her merchandise stock, Von would like to borrow a loan from Hattha Kaksekar in order to sustain her business. She will use the loan she has applied for to buy sweets, biscuits, packed food, soft drinks, ingredients and other household products to sell in her store. This way she is able to satisfy her customers’ needs and improve her income. She expresses her thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy sweets, biscuits, packed food, soft drinks, ingredients and other household products to sell in her store.

loans.name: Moregrace Obasi

texts.fr: Obasi est âgé de 52 ans. Il est propriétaire d'un restaurant à Hedzranawoé et sollicite ce premier prêt de 600000FCA pour acheter des produits alimentaires.Père de 04 enfants, Obasi rencontre souvent des difficultés dans son entreprise et la plus palpable est le manque de provisions .Il espère accroître son activité avec ce prêt et surtout épargner pour assurer l'éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en: Obasi is 52 years old. He is the owner of a restaurant in Hedzranawoé, and is asking for a first loan for 600,000 FCA to buy food items. He is the father of four children. Obasi often faces difficulties with his business, and the one he feels most is the lack of provisions. He would like to grow his business with this loan and to save in order to secure his children's education.

loans.use: to buy food items.

loans.name: Bernarda

texts.en:
Bernarda is 59 years old and is from Aloran. 

She is a businesswoman who labors for her sari-sari (variety) store. In need of capital, she signed up for membership to PMPC. She has taken loans before and has paid her obligations in a timely manner. Recently, she applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities.

Bernarda hopes to sustain her business so she can continue to provide for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a water compressor.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is 30 years old and married. She has three children. She earns a living by farming rice, in the Philippines. She Jenny has been growing rice for seven years, and she earns additional income from trading in rice.

Jenny is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase additional fertilizer, and a new variety of rice seed.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizer and a new variety of rice seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase charcoal to expand her business.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is married and has four children, one of whom attends school. They live at their own house, which has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mwanakombo has operated a fruit stall business for the past ten years. She sells from home to her neighbors. She dreams of establishing a mini-greengrocery store, in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase fruits to resell, such as mangoes, oranges and bananas. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase fruits to resell, such as mangoes, oranges and bananas.

loans.name: Asumani

texts.en: Asumani is a 41-year-old, hardworking man. He lives at Kagadi, Uganda, with four children. The children are aged between 21 and 10 years, and all attend school. He has been selling produce and electronics since 2005 to earn income. He hopes to educate his children, in spite of price fluctuations.  Asumani intends to use the loan to buy maize flour for resale.

loans.use: to buy maize flour for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, pure water, and assorted other drinks to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil, rice and cooking seasoning to expand her business.

loans.name: Ghadeer

texts.en: Ghadeer was born in 1982. She is a separated woman, who has been depending on herself by selling clothes at her house for one year. She started selling a small quantity of them and found this business profitable. Now she is seeking a loan to expand her business by purchasing a larger collection of clothes.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to resell.

loans.name: Dinora

texts.es: Es originaria de Waspam, tiene 40 años, casada con tres hijos adolescentes que se estudian su secundaria, trabaja como conserje en una institución del gobierno central. Su esposo es agricultor. Desde hace aproximadamente 15 años vive en una casa de tambo de madera. Con los créditos anteriores otorgados por PANA PANA, le permitieron construir un anexo de madera, en el cual había establecido una pequeña pulpería. Sin embargo fracaso, debido a que el año pasado le robaron. Solicita su cuarto financiamiento para comprar materiales para cambiar la madera de su vivienda y pintarla: clavos, madera, 2 galones de pintura y cubrir costos de mano de obra.  Su sueño es tener una vivienda con las condiciones básicas para que su familia viva de manera segura y rehabilitar su pulpería.
texts.en:
She is 40 years old, married, and has three teenage children who are in high school. She is from Waspam, and works as a janitor at a central government institution. Her husband is a farmer. 

She has been living in a wooden stilt home for approximately 15 years. The previous loans granted by Pana Pana allowed her to build a wooden addition in which she had set up a small general store. However it failed because last year she was robbed. 

She is requesting a fourth loan to buy materials for replacing the wood of her home and painting it: nails, wood, two gallons of paint and to cover labor costs. Her dream is to have a home providing basic living conditions so that her family can live securely, and to restore their general store.

loans.use: To buy materials for replacing the wood on her home and painting it: nails, wood, 2 gallons of paint and to cover labor costs.

loans.name: Adela

texts.es: Es originaria de Waspam, tiene 34 años, casada con 3 hijos: 2 cursan su bachillerato y un menor de edad de 9 años que estudia su tercer grado de primaria. Desde hace aproximadamente 10 años trabaja como conserje en un hospital del Municipio de Waspam. Su esposo es comerciante. Con el objetivo de mejorar su vivienda solicita su segundo financiamiento para comprar materiales, para construir su vivienda de mini falda de concreto y madera: 2 puertas de madera, madera rustica y cepillada, zinc y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Su sueño es tener una vivienda de concreto con las condiciones básicas, para que su familia viva de manera digna y segura.
texts.en:
She is originally from Waspam, she is 34, married with 3 children: 2 are in high school and a 9 year old that is in 3th of elementary school.
10 years ago she started working as a caretaker at a hospital of the municipality of Waspam.  Her husband is a merchant.  With the goal to improve their living she requests a second loan to buy materials to build her house with concrete and wood: 2 wooden doors, rustic and treated wood, zinc and to cover the labor costs.  Her dream is to have a concrete house with the basic conditions so that her family can live in a dignified and safe way.

loans.use: to buy materials to build her house with concrete and wood: 2 wooden doors, rustic and treated wood, zinc and to cover the labor costs.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a single mother of two children, both of whom go to school. 

She is a second time borrower with Ugafode Microfinance, having paid the first loan very well. She’s a nurse who has a passion for working with children. She wants to take a loan of 1,000,000 UGX to put some furniture in her new rented home (having been sent away by her spouse from their original home). This she thinks will give her home a new look. 

She’s grateful to funders and really pleased with their passion and willingness to help people they don’t know. She hopes to start a single life and concentrate on taking care of her two children and taking them through school.
