In the photo is the client and the Ugafode credit officer.

loans.use: To buy furniture for her house

loans.name: Fanny Anielca

texts.es: Es una joven alegre, originaria de Waspam, tiene 24 años, casada con 1 hijo de 2 años de edad. Cuenta con una experiencia de tres años de ser enfermera.  Desde hace 3  años vive en una casa de tambo de madera. Con el objetivo de ampliar su vivienda, solicita su segundo financiamiento, para comprar materiales, para construir un anexo de madera, el cual será utilizado como cocina: zinc, clavos, madera, postes de madera y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Su sueño es tener una vivienda de concreto con las condiciones básicas, para que su familia viva de manera digna y segura.
texts.en: Fanny is a cheerful 24-year-old young woman who is married with a 2-year-old son. She comes from Waspam. She has three years' experience as a nurse. She has lived in a rickety wooden house for 3 years. Since her ambition is to extend her home, she is seeking a second loan to buy materials (zinc, nails, wood, wooden posts) to build a wooden annex, which will be used as a kitchen. She will also use it to pay staff. Her dream is to have a home made of concrete with basic amenities so that her family can have a decent and safe existence.

loans.use: To buy materials (zinc, nails, wood, wooden posts) to build a wooden annex, which will be used as a kitchen. She will also use it to pay staff

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy house building materials, like iron-corrugated sheets, sand, nails, and cement.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
La Sra. Irma se dedica a la decoración, en lo cual le esta yendo muy bien, siempre tiene mucho trabajo, y lo mejor es que sus clientes siempre quedan muy conformes con lo que ella hace, ya que tiene muy buenos trabajos. Comenta que en su primer préstamo que pidió a kiva, lo uso para poder comprar un globo loco para usarlo en sus eventos, y que le ayudo a tener mas clientes.
Hoy pide un nuevo préstamo para la compra de telas, mamparas, cubiertos, de sillas, y mesas ya que también alquila estos productos para los eventos y quiere renovarse. Agradece por esta nueva oportunidad que recibe de seguir creciendo.
texts.en: Irma works in party decoration in which she is doing very well, she always has a lot of work, and the best is that her clients are always happy with what she does because she does very good work. She says that in her first loan that she requested from Kiva she used it to be able to buy a bouncy house to use at her events, and it helped her have more clients. Now, she requests a new loan for the purchase of fabrics, partitions, seat covers, and tables because she also rents these products out for events and wants to replace them. She appreciates this new opportunity that she is receiving to continue expanding.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, partitions, seat covers, and tables.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El grupo Kuña Guapa está en su ciclo número 1º del programa de comité de mujeres, donde prometen poder su esfuerzo y trabajo continuo dentro del grupo, para poder ir creciendo en cada ciclo, y así ayudar a sus familias.
La Sra. Maria es la presidenta del comité y comenta que se dedica a al tejido y venta de ñandutí, lo cual es algo muy típico y tradicional del país, ella es una persona muy creativa que está saliendo adelante con mucho esfuerzo.
Pide este préstamo para comprar telas e insumos para la elaboración de sus artesanías en ñandutí. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer y salir adelante.
texts.en:
The Kuña Guapa group is in its first cycle of the women's committee program, in which they promise to carry on with their continuous effort and work within the group, so that they can continue growing with each cycle in order to help their families.

Señora María is the president of the committee and she states that she earns her living embroidering and selling "ñandutí" [an embroidered lace], which is something very traditional and typical of her country. She is a very creative person who, with great effort, is getting ahead.

She is requesting this loan to buy fabrics and supplies for making her artisanal ñandutí. She is grateful for this opportunity that she is receiving to be able to grow and progress.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and supplies for making artisanal "ñandutí"

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Virgen del Carmen está en su  tercer ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas se comprometieron a trabajar y a ayudarse entre todas para salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde dos de las diecisiete señoras se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir que deben seguir trabajando y esforzándose por salir adelante.
Una de ellas es la señora  Ana, quien en su  encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, y para poder ayudarla ha sido capacitada para realizar actividades como venta de cosméticos en su barrio para generar más ingreso y no descuidar su hogar, ya que tiene niños pequeños aun y desea colaborar con los ingresos del hogar sin descuidar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar cosméticos, y de esta forma poder trabajar en este desafío para ella y sus habilidades. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer y sentirse útil.
texts.en: The group 'Virgen del Carmen' is in its third lending cycle in the framework of the women's committee program. They all vowed to work hard and help each other in order to improve their lot in life. They replied to a questionnaire in order to determine their poverty level, and the results show that two of the seventeen members of the group live below the poverty line. They need to keep working hard in order to get ahead. Ana is a member of the group and scored a one on the poverty scale. The lending institution trained her so that she could sell cosmetics in her neighbourhood in order to contribute to her family's income without having to leave her children, who are very young, alone at home. Ana asks for this loan in order to buy cosmetics to sell and rise to the challenge. She is grateful for this opportunity to grow and feel useful.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Godbless Group

texts.en:
Lydia is in her early thirties, is single, and has a daughter who is in school. For four years now, she has helped support her family with her bar business. At the bar, she sells beer, water, soda, juices and spirits. She works from 12:00 noon to midnight, daily. She is able to make a good profit each month.

This will be Lydia’s first loan through Tujijenge Tanzania. She is applying for 6,000,000 TZS, which will be apportioned among the four members of her borrowing group, Godbless. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

Lydia will use her portion of this loan to buy more beverages for her business. Her ambition is to greatly improve her business and life.

loans.use: to buy more beverages for her business

loans.name: Damas Valientes Group

texts.es:
Damas valientes es un grupo que hace tres ciclos está trabajando unido, y donde todas se comprometieron a trabajar y a ayudarse entre todas para salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, que les permitirá conocer la situación de vida de cada una, y conforme a los resultados poder trabajar y mejorar sus vidas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Elva, quien entre el trabajo que ella hace cuenta que se dedica a la venta de ropas con lo que ayuda con los gastos del hogar, y también ayuda a su marido en la manutención de sus tres hijos. Dedica su tiempo y su esfuerzo para alcanzar sus objetivos, los cuales son el ayudar a sus hijos y que no les falte nada y poder mejorar sus ingresos. 
Ella pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas variadas para el frío, ya que se aproxima el invierno y quiere tener una buena variedad de prendas que poder ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en: The group 'Damas Valientes' (the name means 'brave ladies') has always been closely knit and is in its third lending cycle. All of them vowed to work hard and help each other to improve their lot in life. They replied to a questionnaire designed to determine their poverty level and help them take action to improve their lives through business opportunities. One of the members, Elva, contributes to household expenses and helps her husband support their three children by selling clothes. She spares neither time nor efforts in her quest to attain her goals, namely to provide for her children, leave them wanting for nothing, and increase her income. She asks for a loan to buy various items of winter clothing, so as to have a great variety of products on offer when her customers come to buy her wares for the coming winter.

loans.use: to buy various items of winter clothing to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to improve her business by restocking sacks of corns for maize flour making.

loans.name: Eladio

texts.es:
Don Eladio tiene 44 años de edad está acompañado hace más de 10 años  y el junto con su esposa viven en la ciudad de Carapeguá.
El señor Eladio desde muy joven empezó a trabajar en la construcción como ayudante de albañil, luego se  casó y empezaron a trabajar juntos con su esposa y montaron una pequeña despensa donde atiende la señora, mientras que Eladio sigue en su trabajo de construcción de obras como oficial.  Gracias a estos trabajos y al esfuerzo de los dos  pudieron construir una hermosa casa, que hoy día es su hogar.
Eladio solicita el préstamo para la compra de bebidas  y otros que en ésta temporada lo solicitan mucho sus clientes.
texts.en: Eladio is 44 years old and has been married for over 10 years. He lives with his wife in the town of Carapeguá. He started to work as a very young age, apprenticed to a bricklayer. After getting married, he and his wife started their own business, a small general store, tended by the wife, while Eladio, now an accomplished bricklayer, keeps on with construction jobs. Thanks to their efforts and their hard work, they managed to build a beautiful house of their very own to live in. Eladio asks for a loan in order to buy drinks and other items to sell at their store, in order to meet seasonal demand.

loans.use: to buy drinks and other items to sell.

loans.name: Las Margaritas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Las Margaritas se formó con la unión de varias vecinas y amigas de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso, están en su primer ciclo, donde la meta de cada una es su crecimiento, todo esto será posible por medio de la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, que a través de esta podrán conocer la situación de cada una y conforme a eso poder trabajar.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Sandra, quien queriendo ayudar a su familia por medio de su trabajo está en miras a emprender. Ella es muy entusiasta y quiere dedicarse a la venta de prendas variadas, y más ahora que se acerca el frio y ve que hay muchos clientes potenciales.
La Sra. Sandra solicita de este préstamo para emprender su negocio de venta de ropas, y poder comprar abrigos, pantalones, jeans y demás, y así poder ayudar a su familia, y tener mayores ingresos.
texts.en: The Las Margaritas group was formed when a number of neighbours and friends in the city of Mariano Roque Alonso got together. They are in their first loan cycle and they all share the same goal, which us to grow. This will all be possible as a result of the eliminating poverty survey which will show the economic situation of each member and work in accordance with it. One of the group's  members is Sandra who, wishing to work to help her family, is aiming to set up a business. She is very enthusiastic and wants to sell clothing of different types. The cold weather will soon arrive and so she can see that there a large number if potential clients. Sandra is seeking this loan to set up her business selling clothing and to buy coats, trousers, jeans and other items. This will enable her to help her family and also boost her income.

loans.use: To buy coats, trousers, jeans and other things necessary to run a clothing retail business

loans.name: Larraine

texts.en:
Larraine, 19 years old from Sta. Rosa, Nueva Ecija, recently finished her Bachelor of Science in Accountancy. 

She aims to be a Certified Public Accountant and will be attending a review course to better prepare herself for the CPA Board Examination. However, high fees for the review course and the living allowance, while being away from her hometown, will be costly for her family. Thus, she is applying for a loan program to ease the burden on her parents and start preparing for her brighter future. 

The loan amount of PHP 50,000 will be very helpful to pay for her CPA review course and living allowance.

loans.use: to pay for her CPA review course and living allowance

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 40 years old from Oroquieta City and supports her husband's fishing activities. She finds her business fulfilling especially since what she is doing is for her family. 

Evangeline is a fully pledged member of PMPC and has had several loans with no record of defaults. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase a motorized boat for fishing. She wanted to have an additional fishing unit that will help them with their livelihood.

Evangeline hopes to expand her business and to save more for the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase a motorized boat for fishing

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Sylvia works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell Ready To Wear business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending and direct selling of Natasha products. Sylvia is borrowing PHP 30000 through NWTF to purchase additional Ready To Wear products to sell in her buy and sell Ready To Wear business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and has now requested this additional loan to further build her business.

Sylvia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 26 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional Ready To Wear items to sell

loans.name: Mercedes Fabiola

texts.es: Fabiola  se dedica 4 años al comercio de ropa, ella es casado y tiene 4 hijos de los cuales la menor de 19 años existe el colegio,  Fabiola vive con 3 hijos y su esposo que se dedica a la agricultura y cuando le contratan también trabaja de albañil, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de  mercadería de ropa para ofrecerla de puerta en puerta y a sus clientes, los sueños de Mercedes son  poder incrementar su negocio y en un futuro ponerse un almacén de ropa donde exhibir su mercadería y seguir trabajando en beneficio de sus hijos.
texts.en: Fabiola has been selling clothing for 4 years. She is married and has 4 children, the youngest of who is 19 and still studying. Fabiola lives with 3 of her children and her husband, who works in farming and, when required, as a builder, too. She intends to use the loan to stock up on clothing which she will sell from door to door and to her customers. Mercedes' dreams are to be able to develop her business and, in time, set up a clothes shop where she can display her merchandise and continue working so she can provide for get children.

loans.use: To stock up on clothing

loans.name: Richel

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Richel works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Richel is borrowing PHP 50000 through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell to customers.

Richel has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a new collection of clothes to resell

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es: Oscar es casado y tiene dos hijas Oscar continúa viviendo en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento donde paga un alquiler Oscar sigue importando y vendiendo productos de limpieza industrial y/o textil y necesita credito para comprar mayor cantidad de productos para aumentar sus ventas Oscar es la única fuente de ingresos en su hogar por lo que necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Oscar is married, has two daughters, and still lives in La Paz in a brick and cement house where he pays rent. Oscar continues importing and selling industrial and or textile cleaning products, and he needs the loan to buy a larger quantity of products to increase his sales. Oscar is the only source of income in his household and for that reason needs help.

loans.use: to buy industrial or textile cleaning products for his wholesale business.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Managing a sari-sari store is Catherine's primary activity within the local community. She is 42 years old and blessed with three children. She and her husband aim to improve their standard of living and educate their children. Due to the high cost of school fees, they need to earn a higher income in order to support their children's education. 

In this regard, Catherine wants to acquire more stock of commodities to sell but she has limited capital. For this reason, she wants to take out a loan of 50,000 PHP to buy more stock of grocery items, fruits, vegetables, frozen foods and fish to resell. Through this loan, she believes that she will increase her product offerings and income as she continues to work hard and strive harder.

loans.use: to buy more stock of grocery items, fruits, vegetables, frozen foods and fish to sell

loans.name: Crescencia

texts.en:
Crescencia is 51 years old and married and has seven children, one of whom is still in school. She is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Crescencia has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been in this business for 14 years now, and has borrowed 16 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Crescencia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Franklin Santiago

texts.es: Santiago  vive  con sus padres, el es soltero y tiene 23 años de edad, Santiago se dedica a la crianza de chanchos desde que Fodemi le dio el primer crédito y es su madre quien le enseña la manera de cuidar a estos animales que son un buen negocio, Santiago también trabaja de albañil juntamente con su padre, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos,  y aspira de este negocio poder ampliarlo para seguir adelante para cubrir sus gastos diarios y de ser posible ayudar a sus padres.
texts.en:
Santiago lives with his parents. He is single and 23 years old. Santiago has earned his living raising pigs since Fodemi gave him the first loan. His mother is the one who has taught him the way to care for these animals, which are a good business. Santiago also works in construction alongside his father. 

He is going to invest the loan in the purchase of pigs; his aspiration is for this business to be able to expand so he can get ahead, cover his daily expenses, and help his parents if possible.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Imara Group

texts.fr: La Cliente Vatenaye est une Couturière et vendeuse des habits prêt à porter depuis 10 ans et membre d’un groupe d’Affaires «Imara» âgée de 44 ans, mariée et mère de 7 enfants qui  tous étudient. Elle est sociétaire d’un atelier, chez elle a don domicile et elle s’entraide avec son mari. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre son entreprise. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir pour acheter des nouveaux matériels : Tissus, fil, machine  à coudre, aiguilles, sison etc. Elle démarra avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite construire un atelier de grande envergure, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs en leur accordant de crédit sans garantie matérielle.
texts.en:
Vatenaye has been a seamstress and a ready-to-wear clothing seller for 10 years and is a member of the borrowing gropu "Imara." She is 44 years old, married, and the mother of 7 children, all of whom attend school. Vatenaye has a shop at her home and she works with her husband.

Vatenaye is requesting a loan from Hekima to expand her business. This new loan will allow her to purchase new supplies: fabric, thread, a sewing machine, needles, scissors, etc. She began her business with funds from her husband. In the future. Vatenaye hopes to build a larger shop, and to educate and feed her children. She thanks Hekima for their support of female entrepreneurs by providing them with credit without collateral.

loans.use: to purchase new supplies: fabric, thread, a sewing machine, needles, scissors, etc.

loans.name: Suleiman

texts.en: Suleiman is 39 years old. He is a father of three children who are between 7 and 12 years old. Suleiman sells cows. With this loan, he would like to reinvest in the same business with more cows to sell in the future. He will use the profits from his business to provide food for his family.

loans.use: To buy more cows for resale.

loans.name: Bicaca Dukore Cb Group

texts.en: Dukore means “let us work”. Dancille is the group leader and has been leading the group for two years. They have ambition and work hard to achieve better lives for themselves and their families. All the group members do different types of businesses but they all have a common goal of achieving results. Dancille has requested a loan to buy more bananas to sell. The profits from the business will be used to provide food for the family.

loans.use: To buy more bananas to sell

loans.name: Segundo Arturo

texts.es: Segundo es casado, y tiene 4 hijos de los que una está estudiando, Segundo es un señor que vive en el campo y se dedica a la agricultura de productos que se dan en este sector, comenta que la agricultura es un buen negocio siempre y cuando se les dé el debido cuidado a los cultivos y que para esto paga a personas que le ayuden en sus sembríos, Segundo se dedica a la agricultura desde que era un adolecente, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de abono y fungicidas para su cultivos, este señor trabajador espira seguir trabajando y sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Segundo is married and has 4 children, one of whom is in school. Segundo is a man who lives in the country and makes a living farming agricultural products. He says that farming is a good business as long as crops are properly cared for, which is why he pays people to help him in his fields. Segundo has worked in farming since he was a teenager. 

He is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of fertilizer and fungicides for his crops. He wishes to continue working to support his children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and fungicides.

loans.name: Karenge Twizamure Cb Group

texts.en: Twizamure, meaning “raise our selves”, is a group composed of different borrowers who run different business types. The leader of the group is called Veasine; she is 29 years old and single. She sells beans and sorghum. With the loan she would like to buy more beans and sorghum for resale. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings. Like her fellow group members, they have the same spirit of growing their business and make savings for all.

loans.use: To buy more beans and sorghum for resale

loans.name: Yuly

texts.es: Yuly es soltera pero tiene dos hijos Yuly vive en La Paz en una casa de acabado fino donde paga un alquiler Yuly es comerciante y debe soportar el caminar con bolsas grandes de su mercaderia Yuly vende ropa usada y necesita credito para comprar ropa juvenil que es lo que más vende estos últimos tiempos Yuly es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar por lo que necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Yuly is single and has two children. She lives in La Paz in a house that she rents and is a merchant who travels carrying bags of her merchandise. Yuly sells used clothing and needs a loan to buy children’s clothing, which is what she has been selling most of lately. Yuly is the only source of income for her household, which is why she needs your help.

loans.use: to buy children’s clothes for her clothes selling business.

loans.name: Nkoilale 1 Group

texts.en:
Chrispian works in the boutique her sister owns in Nkoilale, a rural village almost 100 km and at least a three-hour drive from Kenya national grid power. The village sits just a few kilometers from the Masai Mara and serves as a commercial hub for both the Masai residents who live in the town and for those in surrounding smaller villages. Without access to electricity, the residents must rely on generators, kerosene, candles, and small DC solar systems for their energy needs.

Chrispian currently uses kerosene lanterns to light her home and the boutique. Kerosene is expensive and smells unpleasant, leading Chrispian to close the boutique in the evenings. With connection to the micro-grid, Chrispian will keep her shop open later and expand her business to include phone charging. Both of these will allow Chrispian to generate additional revenue, which she plans on saving so she can open her own hair salon in the near future.

The solar micro-grid will provide Chrispian a constant and reliable power source to use for lighting and other energy services, such as radios and phone charging. Chrispian will pre-pay for electricity in small bundles using her mobile phone. The solar system will require no maintenance from Crispian, and a large battery bank ensures there will be plenty of power, even on cloudy days. Chrispian will be spending less money on the micro-grid power than she was on kerosene. Furthermore, the solar micro-grid is a lot better for the environment and Chrispian’s health than smoky, toxic kerosene lanterns.

Aside from Chrispian, five other business owners in the village are also a part of the loan connecting to the micro-grid: Lillian, Joseph, Florence, John, and Mikai. They are all looking forward to having reliable power at an affordable rate, which they will also use to grow their businesses. The micro-grid will thus spur economic activity in Nkoilale and provide better and cheaper options for more residents to use energy to improve their lives.

loans.use: to connect to the solar micro-grid installed in Nkoilale, enabling her to keep her boutique open later and charge customers’ phones to earn additional revenue.

loans.name: Segundo Alexander

texts.es: Alexander tiene 21 años de edad, vive con su madre y con un hermano que asiste a la escuela,  Alexander  vive en  un sector donde las tierras son productivas para la agricultura, pero existe el inconveniente que las lluvias son escasas lo que hace que sea un poco más laborioso el trabajo ya que a los cultivos hay que darles riego, Alexander a su corta edad dice que en la agricultura todo está en hacer su trabajo con paciencia y así lograr una buena cosecha, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de abono fungicidas y pagar mano de obra, aspira llegar a sembrar en grandes cantidades y ayudar a su madre y a su hermano.
texts.en:
Alexander is 21 years old. He lives with his mother and one brother who attends school. 

Alexander lives in an area where the soils are productive for agriculture; however, scarce rain is a disadvantage that exists, making the work a little more labor-intensive since the crops must be watered. At his young age, Alexander says that in agriculture, it's all about doing the work with patience to achieve a good harvest. 

Alexander is going to invest the loan in the purchase of fertilizer and fungicides, and to pay for manual labor. His aspiration is to eventually plant large quantities and help his mother and his brother.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for labor

loans.name: Luzvilla

texts.en: Luzvilla is from Burgos and earns for the family through animal sales. She raises cows and pigs and butchers them, selling at the market. Her capitalization is always sought from PMPC and she has maintained a good repayment record. Recently, Luzvilla has applied for a loan to purchase wood sticks, nails and nipa palm thatch for her cow pen. In the future, Luzvilla hopes to become a meat supplier in neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase wood sticks, nails and nipa palm thatch for her cow pen

loans.name: Tuvumiliane-Buza Group

texts.en:
Glady, who is married and has got two boys who are at school, is in her late forties. For two years now, she has helped to support her family by running several businesses, poultry and motorcycle for transportation. She is also a hairstylist when she is at home. Her business starts from 6 am to 10 pm daily and is able to make a good profit each month.

Glady is requesting her first loan via Kiva partner Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to buy chicks for her poultry business. She dreams of servicing more people and giving her kids a better life. She will share this loan with her loan group Tuvumiliane-Buza, which totals five members who will hold each other responsible to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy chicks for her poultry business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 32 year old lady from Kisumu County, in the western part of Kenya. She is married and supports three people in her family. She has one daughter who is three years old.

She is operating a money transfer service, a business she has been doing for the last eight years. She gets a monthly income of KES 20,000. Elizabeth has applied for a third loan with VISION FUND KENYA, which she will use to pay school fees for her niece and a daughter.

She will use the anticipated profits to plow back into the business. Her dream is to expand her business.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 54 years old and married with three children.

Marivic works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock, such as canned goods, bath soap, soft drinks, coffee, eggs, sugar, beer, etc., to sell.

Marivic has borrowed and repaid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Marivic aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock, such as canned goods, bath soap, soft drinks, coffee, eggs, sugar, beer, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Emelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell rice grains business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport. Emelyn is borrowing PHP 27,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell for her business.

Emelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana works hard to support her family. She is married and has a furniture-making business in the Philippines.

Susana has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more materials like woods, nails, etc. for her business. She has been in this business for 6 years now.

Susana would like to build and expand her business to secure the future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more materials like woods, nails, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Amina works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transportation business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from assembling sidecars. Amina is borrowing 30,000 PHP through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance for her motorcycle.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Amina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Suha

texts.en:
Suha was born in 1978. She is married and lives in a sector in Jordan called Dair Alla. Her husband is a driver. 

Suha has been selling detergents at her house for three years. Her business was a good source of income that helped her husband in improving their living conditions. 

Now she is seeking a loan to purchase a larger quantity of detergents to raise her profit.

loans.use: to buy more detergents to resell.

loans.name: Bijampola Mugalike Group

texts.en: Ponsiano is a 53-year-old married and hardworking Ugandan man living in Kagadi, with seven children aged between 25 and 12 with only four attending school. He owns a carpentry workshop and has done farming and sold produce since 2001 to generate income to support his family. He hopes to grow his business although he is affected by inadequate capital. Ponsiano intends to use the loan to buy timber to use in his workshop. He is a member of Bijampola Mugalike group, where each member guarantees the other to get a loan since they don’t have securities.

loans.use: to buy timber to use in his workshop.

loans.name: Adolf

texts.en: Adolf is a hardworking Ugandan man. He is 32 years old and married. He lives in Kagadi, where he is a timber dealer and owns a maize milling machine to earn money. He hopes to grow his business despite political instability. Adolf is requesting a loan to buy more timber for resale.

loans.use: to buy more timber for resale.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima was born in 1973. She is married and a mother of three sons. Her husband works at a supermarket. Fatima has been supporting her husband financially by selling clothes, blankets, and bed sheets for eight years. Her business became a good source of income for her family after she attracted a good number of customers. Now she is seeking a loan to purchase a larger quantity of products to sell, including accessories and towels. She believes this will be a good step to increase her profits.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes, blankets, bed sheets, towels, and accessories for resale

loans.name: Tugumisirize Saaco Group

texts.en:
Basiima is a Ugandan hardworking married man, aged 32 years, with four children. He lives in Kagadi, where he has been farming and selling alcohol for ten years to earn a living. He hopes to construct a good permanent house despite price fluctuations. 

Basiima is requesting a loan to buy jerrycans of alcohol for resale. He is a member of Tugumisirize Saaco. Each member guarantees the other to get a loan, since they don’t pledge securities.

loans.use: to buy jerrycans of alcohol for resale

loans.name: Edwin Rolando

texts.es: Edwin  vive en un lugar donde hay un clima algo cálido y por este motivo se da este producto como es el tomate de árbol, Edwin tiene 25 años de edad, vive con su madre y con 2 hermanos de los que uno de ellos está en el colegio, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de las plantas de tomate de árbol y abono, la preparación del terreno y  que a esta actividad se dedica unos tres años, la aspiración de Edwin es trabajar duro y que sus cultivos le dejen buena rentabilidad para seguir adelante en su vida y apoyar a su madre y a su hermano que está estudiando.
texts.en: Edwin lives in place where there is a warm climate and for this motive he has a product which is the tomato tree. Edwin is 25 years old, lives with his mom and two siblings, one of whom is in school. He is going to invest the loan in the purchase of tomato tree plants, compost, and preparing the land. He has been working at this for three years. His aspiration is to work hard so his plants give him a good return to continue moving forward in life and support his mom and brother who is studying.

loans.use: to purchase compost and tomato tree plants.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es: Ruben es soltero y tiene un hijo Ruben vive con sus padres en La Paz en una casa de adobe que le pertenece a sus padres Ruben trabaja en la alcaldía pero quiere credito para comprar una maquina de zapateria, de esa manera podrá tener un ingreso extra y le podra dar trabajo a su hermano Ruben es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar por lo que necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Ruben is single and has a son. Ruben lives with his parents in La Paz in an adobe house that belongs to his parents. Ruben works in the mayor's office but wants a loan to buy a shoe repair machine; that way he can have extra income and can provide work for his brother. Ruben is the only source of income at his home and this is why he needs your help.

loans.use: to buy a shoe repair machine.

loans.name: Sothea

texts.en:
28-year-old Sothea lives in a common-law marriage with her husband, with whom she has two children. She lives in a peaceful village in Prey Chhor, Kampong Cham province. She has always made a living from agriculture by growing rice, cassavas and other seasonal crops, which she are harvested and sold at the local market. She has been involved in this occupation for more than 10 years, earning a daily income of USD 6 per day.

This is Sothea's third loan. She will use the funds to pay for labor costs associated with preparing her land and to buy farm supplies such as fertilizers, pesticides and seeds. Her plan is to continue harvesting rice and cassavas in order to improve her family’s economic situation.

loans.use: to pay for labor for preparing her land and to buy farm supplies such as fertilizers, pesticides and seeds.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is a 57-year-old woman from Bondeni Estate in Kakamega county, which is located in the western part of Kenya. She is married and she supports 10 people in the family. She has two children who are 30 and 15 years old.

Anna is a small-scale poultry farmer. She has been doing this for the last 10 years and makes a monthly income of 12,000 KES.  Anna has applied for her second loan with VisionFund  Kenya, which she will use to purchase more chickens. She will use the anticipated profit to expand the business.

Anna's dream is to become a large-scale poultry farmer and support her family.

loans.use: to purchase chickens

loans.name: Zusette

texts.en:
Zusette is 50 years old, married, and has four children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has a business, selling spices, in the Philippines. She has been in this business for thirty years.

Zusette requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. She will use this amount to buy more spices and seasonings, like tomato, potato, and onions.

In the future, Zusette would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more spices and seasonings, like tomato, potato, and onions.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is 46 years old, married, and has one child. She earns a living by raising chickens, in the Philippines. She has been raising chickens for 15 years, and she earns additional income from a general store.

Rosie is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan in order to buy feed and vitamins for her chickens. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream -- to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her chickens.

loans.name: Belen

texts.en: Belen is 29 years old and has one child with her live-in partner. Their child is in school, and she works very hard to provide for her family. Unfortunately, her home and her business were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8. Belen has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter. To make this possible, she is requesting a loan for PHP 3,000 from NWTF to buy building materials and pay for construction labor. She is committed to rebuild her devastated life and would like to expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy building materials and pay construction workers

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is a married woman with four children, three of whom are currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Anita is 41 years old.

Anita has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional materials and gears for her fishing business.

Anita has been in this business for six years. In the future, Anita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and gears for her fishing business

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
Salama is a married woman with three school going children. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food.

For the past four years, she has operated a business of selling leso cloths ( women wraps ). She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of expanding to become a big supplier of clothes in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase pieces of Leso ( women wrap) for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase pieces of Leso cloths ( women wraps) for resale.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit is from Yerevan town. She took a loan from Kiva and SEF last year to pay for her daughter, Meri's, tuition fee. She was very grateful for the loan, as it helped her to pay for the university tuition and to give her daughter an opportunity to continue her education. Anahit is successfully paying the loan back and has now applied for the new one. She needs this new loan to be able to pay for Meri's university tuition for the current year.

Anahit will be very grateful to receive Kiva lenders' support once more.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter, Meri's, university tuition.

loans.name: Choquequirao Inc Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “CHOQUEQUIRAO INC”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Elizabeth ella es casada y tiene 58 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de agencia de viajes, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de agencia de viajes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar boletos turísticos para la agencia de viajes.

Los socios que están pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto después de la reunión porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 
 
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de venta de artesania, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de agencia de viajes.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the "Choquequirao Inc." communal bank. This bank is located in the district of Cusco, which is part of the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

The member is Señora Elizabeth. She is 58 years old, married, and has two children. Elizabeth works in her travel agency business from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m. She has already had this business for seven years and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to expand her travel agency. She is requesting the loan to buy tourism tickets for her travel agency.

The members that are added on to the group pictures had their pictures taken after the meeting because they asked to be excused for work reasons.

The other members earn their livings with a clothing-sales business, an artisanal crafts business, a grocery store, and a travel agency. 
 
The member is grateful to those who are part of this dream through this medium, and she promises to make her loan payments according to the established timeline.

loans.use: to buy tourism tickets for her travel agency

loans.name: Djiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DJIGUISSEME est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 52 ans et 7 enfants. Elles vivent tous dans des familles traditionnelles dans la ville de Fana, quartier Fana Coura, commune de Guégnéka, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro, (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréales, de condiments, de l’habillement et de poisson.
Les femmes du groupe DJIGUISSEME sont à leur dix-huitième prêt solidaire.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
La cliente DALLY , première personne à partir de la gauche est une vendeuse de céréales. Elle compte achète 8 sacs de mil chez ses fournisseurs à Beleco. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce à Fana à une clientèle mixte. Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 80.000 FCFA qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The Djiguisseme Group is made up of married women with an average age of 52 and and an average of seven children each. They all live within the frameworks of traditional families in the town of Fana, in Fana Coura District, in the commune of Gyégnéka, Dioïla Prefecture, Koulikoro Region (the second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They all know each other through the bonds of family, community and friendship. They earn a living in the buying and selling of cereals, condiments and fish.

This will be the eighteenth loan for the women of the Djiguisseme Group. In order to satisfy the enormous demand from their customers, they have turned to Soro Yiriwaso. The requested loan amount will be used to purchase the aforementioned items.

Dally, the first woman on the left, did not receive an education. She currently works as a cereal vendor. She plans on buying eight sacks of millet from her suppliers in Beleco. She sells her produce for cash in Fana to a mixed customer base. She sees herself making an average monthly profit of 80,000 FCFA, which will be reinvested into her business.

loans.use: to buy eight sacks of millet

loans.name: Vangie

texts.en:
Vangie, who is 18 years of age, desires to finish a college course. She is the daughter of a fisherman and a housewife, and she has three siblings who are also attending school. Her parents can’t support her college education. That is why she wants to obtain an education loan of PHP 40,000. She will use the loan to pay her tuition for studying Microfinance Technology.

Vangie hopes that the lenders will approve the loan, for it will pave the way for her, to seek a better job in the future and to support the educational expenditures of her siblings. She is certain that if she finishes the course, she can help her parents have a better living and enable them to eat the food that they were not able to eat before, because of financial constraints. After five years, Vangie sees herself as a successful woman.

loans.use: To pay her tuition fee

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 53-year-old mother from the Kisumu region, which is located in the Western part of Kenya. She is married and supports three people in her family. Margaret has three children, who are 24, 20, and 16 years old. She operates a food kiosk, which she has been operating for the past five years. She makes a monthly income of KES 4,000.

Margaret is taking her first loan with VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to purchase more tables and plastic seats. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business. Margaret's dream is to expand her business and support her family.

loans.use: to buy more tables and chairs

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Marilou works hard to support her family. She has a rice-farming business in the Philippines, and she also earns income from rice retailing.

Marilou is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF. She will use this amount to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies for her rice farming business.

She successfully paid back her previous loans, and now she has requested an additional loan, to further build her business. Marilou has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream -- to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertlizer and other rice farming supplies.

loans.name: Doris Esmeralda

texts.es:
Doris tiene 39 años de edad, estudio unicamente hasta 7º grado, ya que su padre falleció, y su madre no pudo seguirla apoyando para que terminara sus estudios, puesto que su madre la llevaba a que le ayudara a trabajar. Su esposo es agricultor,  de sus 3 hijos unicamente la menor vive con ella y estudia 5º  grado. 

Doris tiene 18 años de dedicarse a la venta de ropa,  pero hace un año inicio en el negocio propio  de venta de verduras y frutas. Ambos negocios los conoce muy bien, ya que cuando su padre murió, fue su madre quien le enseño estas actividades, así fue como aprendió las técnicas de comercializar los productos. Los lugares donde ella vende están a una distancia de cinco kilómetros. Viaja en autobús, todos los días se levanta a las 4:30 de la mañana para preparar el desayuno a su esposo y a su hija, después sale a vender, y regresa hasta las 3:00 de la tarde a su casa.

El préstamo sera utilizado para la compra de mercadería, para continuar con el negocio de venta de ropa. Con el otorgamiento del préstamo se esta contribuyendo a que Doris continué haciendo lo que mas le gusta, y a la vez tenga ingresos para su hogar.


Doris tiene muchos sueños, uno de ellos es poder dejarles donde vivir a sus hijos, para eso necesita remodelar su vivienda y construir el muro perimetral para mas seguridad. También le gustaría tener una pequeña tienda en su casa. Ademas quisiera poder comprarle un molino a su hijo, para que trabaje en lo propio.
texts.en:
Doris is 39 years old and has a 7th grade education because her father had passed away and her mother was not able to keep supporting her with school, so she would take her to work to help.  Her husband is a farmer and they have three children, but only the youngest lives with her.  She is in the 5th grade.

Doris has been selling clothing for 18 years, but she started a fruits and vegetables business a year ago.  She knows both businesses very well because when her father died it was her mother who taught her these things.  This is how she learned to sell products.  The place she sells from is five km away and she takes the bus every day.  She gets up at 4:30am to prepare breakfast for her husband and daughter, then she goes out to sell and gets home at 3:00 pm. 

She will use the money from this loan to buy merchandise so she can continue with the business of selling clothing.  This loan will help Doris do what she enjoys most and she will have an income for the household.

Doris has many dreams and one of them is to be able to leave her children a place to live, but she needs to remodel her house and build a perimeter wall to provide more security.  She would also like to have a small store in her home and be able to buy a grinding mill for her son so that he can work on his own.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Gisozi Icyerekezo Tcb Group

texts.en: Icyerekezo means vision, and is the name of this loan group, which is made up of different members with different business types. Isabelle leads the group and owns a store where she sells various items such as bread, soap, donuts and pampers. She will use this loan to add more items, including mineral water, fresh dairy and mayonnaise, to her inventory. She plans to use the profits she makes from her business to build a house. All group members dream of having better lives and believe they have chosen the right path to do that.

loans.use: to buy mineral waters dairy products and mayonnaise to sell.

loans.name: Kuña Renda 2 Group

texts.es:
Este es el ciclo 11 del grupo Kuña Renda 2, son todas mujeres jefas de familia que buscan el bienestar de sus seres queridos por medio del trabajo de todas ellas, y utilizando una herramienta que es la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza de la fundación paraguaya.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Laura, quien en su última encuesta mostro un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel  dos, es decir que se encuentra en un nivel medio, pero ella a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y por medio de las capacitaciones, ella se encuentra mejorando su situación de pobreza. Entre el trabajo que ella hace cuenta que se dedica a la venta de ropas variadas, de esa forma lucha por mejorar sus ingresos y sus condiciones de vida. También se debe destacar el trabajo de las asesoras, quienes hacen un seguimiento permanente de capacitaciones y verificaciones.
La Sra. Solicita de este préstamo para la compra prendas de invierno para vender, lo que le ayudará a poder seguir trabajando, y luchando por su familia para darles todo lo que ella no pudo tener.
texts.en:
This is the 11th loan cycle for the “Kuña Renda 2” group, they are all head of family women that look for the well-being of their loved ones through the work they do for them.  One of the tools they use is the poverty elimination survey from the Paraguayan Foundation.
One of the members of the group is Laura, in her last survey the results showed a poverty level 2, which means medium level, through her work and continued effort and the courses she is improving from her poverty situation.  Some of the work she does is to sell clothing, this way she tries to increase her income and life conditions.  Another job to make allusion to is the one done by the advisors, who continuously do follow up work on training and reviews.
She requests a loan to buy winter clothing for sale, this will help her to continue working and fighting for her family to give them everything she couldn’t have.

loans.use: to buy winter clothing for sale.

loans.name: Christian Julian

texts.es:
Christian vive en la ciudad de chincha, trabaja como obrero en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, con lo cual puede tener ingresos para poder solventar sus gastos de manuetención y apoyar a su madre con los gastos del hogar.

Christian esta agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar mejoras en su vivienda, como refacción de paredes, mejora de techo, entre otros; de esta manera podrá tener una vivienda en mejores condiciones y su calidad de vida podrá mejorar,así el podrá seguir trabajando y esforzándose por hacer realidad su gran sueño:” tener un negocio propio”.
texts.en:
Christian lives in the city of Chincha. He works as a laborer at a farm of his town. This gives him the income to cover his expenses and to help his mother with the household expenses.

Christian is thankful to the Kiva lenders. Thanks to the help they have given, he will be able to make some improvements to his home, like repair the walls, improve the roof, and more. By this, his home will be in a better condition and his quality of life will improve, so he will be able to continue his work and to strive to realize his great dream: "To have his own business."

loans.use: to improve his home.

loans.name: Noe Eli

texts.es: Noe de 37 años de edad se dedica desde hace varios años al cultivo de maíz, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Noe esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y así el podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: Noe is 37 years old and has been raising corn for several years.  He sells his products in different markets located near his home and uses his profits to pay some of the household expenses.  Noe is asking for a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, compost, insect control, herbicides, etc.  This way he will be able to provide a better quality of life for his family without limits.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en: Zenaida is 36 years old, widowed and has a child who is in grade school. To meet her family's needs, she manages a motorcycle transportion business. She offers service to the people in her village, and has been in this line of work since her husband died. She is requesting a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy oil and gasoline so that she can continue to offer safe travel to all her passengers. She hopes to keep increasing her profits so that she can pay for her child’s education.

loans.use: to buy oil and gasoline to use in her motorcycle transport business

loans.name: Santos Eduardo

texts.es: Santos de 43 años de edad vive en casa propia con su madre, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografía para luego salir a comercializarlos a los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, Santos está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y asi seguir con sus siembras para poder darle  a su familia una mejor calidad de vida sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: Santos is 43 years old and lives in a home of his own with his mother.  He raises corn and beans and when his harvest is ready, he stores it in the silos shown in the photograph and then takes them to the markets near his home.  Santos is asking for this loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, insect control, herbicide, etc.  In this way he can continue planting to be able to provide a better quality of life for his family without limit.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Leonis

texts.en: As the married parent of three children, Leonis works hard to support her family. She earns a living by buying and selling peanuts in the Philippines, and also earns additional income by running a general store. She has requested a loan for PHP 13,000 from NWTF to buy additional stocks of peanuts to sell. She successfully paid back her previous loan and would like to use this new one to further expand her business. Leonis has sustained her business with 19 previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of peanuts to sell

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa works hard to support her family. Elisa is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Elisa requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients like pork skin and cooking oil for her business.

Elisa has been in this business for six years now.

In the future, Elisa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like pork skin and cooking oil for her business

loans.name: Nzerena

texts.en:
Nzerena is an honest married Ugandan woman living in Kagadi. She used the previous loan to buy maize to sell. She has been selling produce and fish, and used proceeds from that business to start up a small bar. She hopes to grow her business despite challenges like poor roads. 

Nzerena is requesting a loan to buy maize and coffee for resale.

loans.use: to buy maize and coffee for resale

loans.name: Al- Hasani Group

texts.en: This group is called Al- Hasani and consists of four women from Hodeidah, Yemen. They have applied for a loan for 110,000 YER from AMB. Hanan is 32 years old, married, the mother of five children and lives in a rented house in a poor area. For the last four years, she has worked as a tailor out of her home. She sews all kinds of clothes for many different people, but has only one sewing machine. With that one sewing machine, Hanan takes long time to complete a small amount of work, and this negatively affects her business. She is very detail-oriented and does very well because she has earned the loyalty of many customers, friends, and neighbors.  Hanan is asking for a loan for 30,000 YER from AMB to buy another sewing machine, and looks forward to expanding her business by opening a dressmaking store.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: San Expedito Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Expedito se formó en la ciudad de Itá, con mujeres jefas de familia, que decidieron unirse para poder ayudar a sus familias por medio del trabajo en equipo, ayudándose las unas a las otras.
Una mujer diga de destacar es Ramona, ella se dedica a la venta de carbón, y cuenta que está creciendo poco a poco, ya que le está yendo muy bien, pues la venta de carbón cada vez se usa más, ya que es más económico para la gente. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora, y por sobre todo luchadora y emprendedora.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de más carbón, ya que así podrá seguir trabajando y teniendo una buena cantidad de su producto para sus clientes. Agradece por esta oportunidad que todas reciben al formar parte del programa de comités.
texts.en:
The group “San Expedito” was formed in the city of Ita, with women that are head of their family that decided to get together to support their families through team work by helping each other.  
One of the women is Ramona, she sells charcoal and is growing little by little, she is doing well as charcoal is being purchased more and more because it’s cheaper for people to use.  She is a very hardworking person, as well as entrepreneurial and a fighter.
She requests this loan to be able to invest it in buying more charcoal, this way she will be able to continue working  by having a good amount of product ready for her clients.  She is grateful for the opportunity that they all get by being part of the committee.

loans.use: to buy charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Antonia Elsa

texts.es: La Sra. Antonia es cliente antigua de la institución, sigue la misma actividad de la Venta de productos de uso doméstico en su tienda de barrio, cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra de mercadería, en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería al por mayor para seguir surtiendo su tienda,  ya que creció en su actividad,   se siente feliz y agradecida con los prestamistas de Kiva por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Antonia is a long-time client of this institution. She continues to pursue the same activity, selling household products in her neighborhood store. Things went well with the last loan. She used it to purchase merchandise. She is requesting this loan to use to buy merchandise in bulk to continue to stock her shop since its activity has increased. She is happy and grateful to Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to stock her general store

loans.name: Bienvenidos A Pilcopata Group

texts.es: Un grupo de vecinos y amigos formaron el banco comunal “Bienvenidos a Pilcopata” en el centro poblado de Pilcopata en el distrito Kosñipata en la provincia de Paucartambo en el departamento del Cusco. Grimalda tiene 32 años de edad es casada y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene una hermosa familia, ella y su familia viven en la hermosa ciudad de Pilcopata. Grimalda una madre trabajadora que desde muy niña aprendió a trabajar, ella es una persona carismática y amable que sale adelante con el apoyo de su pareja, ella se dedica a la venta de comida y en sus horas libres se dedica a otras actividades entonces ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar productos de primera necesidad como por ejemplo sacos de arroz, verduras, aceite y otras cosas mas. Este banco comunal está conformado por varias personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Los socios se dedican a la agricultura, a la venta de fruta, a la venta de coca, a la ganadería, al engorde de ganado, a la venta y compra de madera. Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
A group of neighbors and friends formed the "Bienvenidos a Pilcopata" [Welcome to Pilcopata] communal bank in the population center of Pilcopata in the district of Kosñipata, which is in the province of Paucartambo and the department of Cusco.

Grimalda is 32 years old and married. From this lovely relationship, she has a beautiful family. She and her family live in the beautiful city of Pilcopata.

Grimalda is a hardworking mother who, from the time she was a little girl, learned to work. She is a charismatic and friendly person who makes a living with the support of her husband. She works selling food; in her free time, she spends time on other activities. So at this point, she needs the loan to buy basic staples like, for example, sacks of rice, vegetables, oil, and other things. 

This communal bank is made up of various people who are always looking for opportunities to get ahead and, with their daily efforts, to give their children a better future. The members work in agriculture, fruit sales, coca sails, ranching, livestock production, and buying and selling wood. All the members express their gratitude for the opportunity provided and they promise to make their different loan payments according to their established timelines.

loans.use: to buy basic staples like, for example, sacks of rice, vegetables, oil, and more.

loans.name: Susana

texts.es: La señora Susana tiene 33 años, casada con un hijito de tres años de edad, ella se dedica  a  la crianza de pollos para su posterior venta, este préstamo es el primero que tiene con la institución, la señora Susana va a usar este préstamo para compra de pollitos pequeños, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es mejorar sus ingresos ya que los hará engordar para su posterior venta, La señora Susana enfrenta retos en su negocio que son mejorar su negocio y calidad de vida, el La señora Susana va a utilizar los beneficios mejorar sus ingresos y también comprar alimento mejorado para el engorde de pollos, La señora Susana desea para su negocio crecer en la crianza y venta de pollos y tener una granja grande de pollos,  ella es una persona muy  trabajadora y emprendedora con ganas de seguir adelante y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Susana is a 33-year-old married woman who has a little three-year-old boy.  She has a business raising chickens, which she later sells.  This is her first loan through this institution.  She will use the proceeds in order to purchase young chickens.  She will fatten the chickens for eventual sale.

She faces challenges in her business and wishes to improve her standard of living.  She will use the funds in order to purchase better feed to fatten her chickens and thus improve her income.  She wants to grow her business and to have a large flock of chickens.  She is a very hardworking and enterprising person who is motivated to get ahead and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase young chickens.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a farming of rice business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to pay the laborers' salaries for the cultivation of her farm. 

Ofelia has been in this business for 11 years. She earns more income from food vending.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she is requesting an additional loan to further build her business.

Ofelia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to pay the laborers who cultivate her farm

loans.name: Estefany Katterine

texts.es:
Estefanye vive en la ciudad de chincha y con mucho empeño y esfuerzo  logro iniciar su negocio de venta de golosinas desde hace un año, lo uqe le ha permitido poder tener ingresos para salir adelante cada día.

Estefany esta muy agradecida por el apoyo que le están brindando los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a esa ayuda ella podrá comprar más golosinas para su negocio, de esta manera podrá atender a los pedidos de sus clientes y mejorar sus ingresos, lo que le permitirá continuar con su negocio y seguir esforzándose para hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener una distribuidora de golosinas”.
texts.en:
Estefanye lives in the city of Chincha.  With a great deal of effort and determination, she managed to start her business selling candy one year ago.  This has enabled her to have income so that she can get ahead little by little. 

She is very grateful for the support from the Kiva lenders, since thanks to this help she will be able to purchase more candies for her business.  In this way she will be able to fill her customers' orders and to improve her income.  This will in turn allow her to continue in her business and continue to work hard in order to make her greatest dream a reality: to become a wholesaler of candies.

loans.use: to purchase candies.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is 52 years old and married, with four children. 

She is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Elma requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy seeds, fertilizer, and other farm supplies.

Elma has been farming vegetables for ten years now and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Elma would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Belen

texts.en:
Belen is 63 years years old and single. She works hard to support her nephews.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport. 

Belen is borrowing PHP 29,500 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more items to sell in her general store, like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, and soap. She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requests an additional loan to further build her business.

Belen has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell, like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, and soap.

loans.name: Yamileth Del Carmen

texts.es:
Todos los días a primera hora, una vez que ha dejado a su hijo en la escuela, Yamileth abre las puertas de su pequeña pulpería, en la que se encuentran productos básicos para el hogar, sus clientes siempre regresan puesto que ella les brinda atención de calidad. Es un mujer emprendedora e inteligente, tiene 25 años, está casada y tiene dos hijos. Inició su negocio hace un año con la ayuda de su papá, quien le brindo un pequeño capital, el cual ha logrado incrementar poco a poco.
Ella solicita el crédito para aumentar la producción de su capital, requiere comprar granos básicos, como arroz, frijoles; condimentos, refrescos, entre otros. Ella deposita su confianza en el financiamiento, puesto que es su única fuente de ingresos y junto a su esposo luchan por brindarles mejores condiciones de vida a sus hijos. Uno de sus planes futuros, es lograr establecer un tramo en el Mercado, al mismo tiempo, anhela estudiar un técnico en contabilidad, de manera que pueda manejar correctamente las cuentas de su negocio.
texts.en:
Yamileth opens the doors of her small grocery store early every day, after leaving her son at school. The store offers basic household items. Her customers always come back because she offers quality customer service. Yamileth is an enterprising and intelligent woman. She is 25, married and has two children. She started her business a year ago, with help from her father, who loaned her a small capital which she has increased little by little.
She is asking for a loan to increase her sales. She needs to buy basic staple foods such as rice, beans, condiments, sodas, etc. She is placing her trust on the loan because the store is her only source of income and she is fighting along with her husband to provide better living conditions for their children. One of her future plans is to open a store in the market. She also wants to study to become an accountant so that she can handle the finances of her business correctly.

loans.use: to purchase basic staple foods such as rice, beans, condiments, sodas, etc.

loans.name: Ismail Charles

texts.en: Ismail is a hardworking married man living in Kagadi, Uganda. He operates a boutique and sells produce to supplement his income. He hopes to grow his shop into a well-stocked boutique attracting many customers in his town in spite of many thieves. Ismail is requesting a loan to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Elmer Jules

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal SEÑOR DE HUANCA-TERMINAL, él banco eta ubicado en el departamento de Cusco.
El socio tiene 44 años de edad y es casado, él socio alterna sus actividades diarias brindando el servicio de transporte interprovincial, él socio lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, él socio es una persona responsable siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante  a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para realizar el mantenimiento del carro.
El socio se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “Senor de Huanca-Terminal”, the bank is located in the department of Cusco.
The member is 44 years old and is married, he alternates his daily activities by providing interprovincial transportation services.  He has been working on this for a good amount of time and he does well because of the work he puts into his business each day, he is a responsible person and through his work gets his family ahead.
The member requests the loan to pay for maintenance for his vehicle. 
He is grateful for the loan and commits to meet the repayment terms.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance for his vehicle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build walls on her house

loans.name: Cinthia

texts.es:
La Sra. Cinthia tiene 35 años, vive en la ciudad de Itá, está en pareja con el Sr. Aníbal donde ambos tienen una familia conformada por dos hijos, por quienes ambos están luchando para salir adelante.
Ella se dedica a las ventas de bebidas, con un pequeño negocio montado en su propia casa, además su marido también trabaja como constructor, y de esa forma ambos se están ayudando a mejorar. 
Cinthia pide este préstamo para invertir en bebidas, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas como viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Cinthia is 35, she lives in the city of Ita, her partner is Anibal, they have formed a family with their two children, for whom they are both fighting to get ahead.
She works selling drinks through a small business set up at home, her husband works in construction and this way they both help each other in order to improve.
Cinthia is requesting this loan to buy drinks and continue with her sales like she has been in the past.

loans.use: to buy drinks for sale.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
La socia Martha se dedica al negocio de venta de cosmeticos, la socia vende lápiz labiales, cremas y perfumes, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los productos de belleza. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar cremas, lápiz labiales y perfumes.


La socia se encuentra agradecida y desea expresar que cumplirá de manera  disciplinadamente con los pagos de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Martha’s business is to sell cosmetics, she sells lipstick, lotions and perfumes, she works from 8:00 AM to 7:00 PM, she has been doing this for several years, her dream is to have a location where she can sell her beauty products.  She requests the loan to buy lotions, lipsticks and perfumes.

She is grateful and wishes to express that she will meet the repayments of the loan with discipline.

loans.use: to buy lotions, lipsticks and perfumes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fishing gear.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Elma works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling purified drinking water in the Philippines and earns additional income from her general store. Elma is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy more containers of purified drinking water to sell.

Elma has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more containers of purified drinking water to sell

loans.name: Azniv

texts.en: Azniv lives in Mastara village with her family, which includes her parents, grandmother and brother Babken. Azniv's father is an army officer and is the only worker in the family. His salary allows him to cover household costs, but it is not enough to save for Babken's education. That's the reason Azniv has applied for this loan. She is asking for financial support to be able to pay for her brother Babken's university tuition. The whole family will be very grateful to all lenders who support their family with Babken's university costs.

loans.use: to pay for her brother's university tuition

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a hard working lady living in Kagadi, Uganda with two children who are 22 and 16 years old. Both of her children are attending school. She operates a retail shop and does farming to educate her children. As a loving mother, she hopes to educate her children to university in-spite of competition.  Agnes intends to use the loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Victor Hugo

texts.es: Hugo  es un señor separado de su esposa, tiene  36 años de edad y 3 hijos de los que solo el menor de 15 años se  encuentra estudiando en el colegio, Hugo se dedica a la agricultura de arveja, frejol, zanahoria, cebolla y otros productos que se dan por estos lugares, Hugo también trabaja en una empresa  de flores y comenta que con las dos actividades que se dedica puede hacerse cargo de sus gastos y los de sus hijos, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de mano de obra, abono y fungicidas para cuidar sus cultivos, Hugo anhela mejorar sus sembríos para poder salir adelante y  que su hijo saque un título profesional.
texts.en:
Hugo is separated from his wife. He is 36 years old, and has three children. Just the youngest one, who is 15 years old, goes to school. Hugo works as a farmer.
