Con el monto solicitado comprará lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos.
texts.en:
Claudia is 19 years old and lives with her family. She works selling milk, because she has three dairy cows that she worked very hard to acquire. They enable her to earn an income and contribute to her household economy.

Claudia is requesting this loan from FUSAI because she wants to repair the roof of her house, which is in disrepair and she wants to replace it before the winter. She will use the amount she is requesting to buy galvanized sheet metal, wood, and nails.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheet metal, wood, and nails to repair the roof of her house.

loans.name: Raeifa

texts.en:
Raeifa is a 51-year-old married mother of five. She started her own business designing wool handcrafts 20 years ago, which is a skill she acquired from her parents.

She has acquired a loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua in the past, and she now is requesting another loan to purchase a Knitwear machine for her work in order to save time and increase her productivity. She takes pride in her intricate crafts and hopes to continue expanding her business with this loan.

loans.use: to purchase a Knitwear machine for her work in order to save time and increase her productivity

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Leonila has been in this business for 25 years now. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Daniela Paola

texts.es:
Ella es la estudiante Daniela Paola, ella se ve interesada en el convenio con kiva por falta de recursos monetarios, ya que no tiene ayuda sostenible para pagar las cuotas con tan alto valor.
Los planes que ella tiene a futuro es poderle pagar los estudios a el hermano y colaborarle a la madre, poder desempeñarse en el campo laboral como Auxiliar Administrativo En Hotelería y así cumplir la meta de estudiar idiomas extranjeros.
Ella personalmente es responsable, tolerante, respetuosa y muy dedicada a la preparación personal u otras obligaciones.
En lo laboral se destaca por ser cumplida y responsable con los compromisos adquiridos, en lo familiar  es respetuosa con los suyos y sabe compartir opiniones e ideas con los demás, es colaboradora y comprensiva, le da lugar a cada integrante de la familia.
texts.en:
This is Daniela Paola, a student who is seeking a Kiva loan due to a lack of financial resources. She doesn't have sustainable support to pay high fees. 

Daniela Paola's ambitions include being able to pay for her brother's education and to help her mother. She also wants to make a professional career as an Administrative Assistant in a hotel and study foreign languages. 

Daniela Paola is responsible, tolerant, respectful of others, and very dedicated to her personal development and to meeting her obligations. 

Daniela Paola stands out for her politeness and reliability in meeting her commitments. She is respectful to her family and knows how to express her opinions and ideas with others. Daniela Paola is cooperative and understanding, devoted to each member of her family.

loans.use: to pay tuition for a semester.

loans.name: Eda

texts.en:
Eda will use this loan to pay for Koco, her husband’s surgery. Earlier this year, he had his inflamed appendix removed and after that, another surgical procedure was required due to the fact that the area around the stitches was infected. Now doctors say that he needs another intervention, unfortunately.

Eda and Koco are the parents of two. Eda currently works in a restaurant in the city of Korca where they reside, whereas Koco cannot work for the moment due to his worsened medical condition. Korca, their city, is known for the serenade, dating back to 1930, the complementary performance of men’s vocal and kithara instruments in our case walking and performing on the cobblestone streets at night or standing under the windows of their ladies. Nowadays, these performances are played live in restaurants. Eda works in one of them.

loans.use: to pay for her husband's immediate surgery of an infected area around the stitches from a previous surgical intervention

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 43 years old and married with six children, three of whom are currently in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Leonora's business and family home were destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. Leonora has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Leonora has taken a PHP 7,900 housing loan through NWTF to rebuild her family home. She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Leonora is committed to rebuilding her devastated life, and in the future, would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 46 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business direct selling personal collection products in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Judith has borrowed and paid back 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the business direct selling personal collection products for 10 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Judith aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Suvd-Erdene

texts.en: Mrs. Suvd-Erdene, 34-years-old, lives with her husband and daughter in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia. She has been working as a nurse at a local hospital since 2011. Her husband has the profession of serviceman at a power plant. The house they live in has deteriorated over the years so she is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to buy bricks, cement, fiberglass, and foam to renovate her house. After the renovation, her family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and then less pollutants are released into air.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, fiberglass, and foam

loans.name: Hector Andrés

texts.es:
Hector es un hombre muy trabajador, se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 15 años, actualmente tiene una parcela en la cual ha sembrado plátano , asimismo tiene su negocio de venta de animales domésticos como gallinas, patos, entre otros; con lo cual tiene un dinero extra para poder sacar adelante a su familia, ya que el vive al lado de su esposa y sus 2 hijos, que se encuentran en edad escolar

Hector  esta agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar abono, fertilizantes y dar sostenimiento a su cultivo, de tal manera que podrá obtener una buena cosecha y poder seguir luchando para hacer realidad su gran sueño:”Mejorar su calidad de vida”.
texts.en:
Hector is a very hard-working man. He has made a living from agriculture for 15 years. Currently, he has a parcel of land in which he has sown bananas. Additionally, he has his business selling domestic animals such as chickens and ducks, among others, from which he earns extra money to be able to bring his family out ahead. He lives at the side of his wife and their two children, who are school-aged.

Hector is thankful to the Kiva lenders since thanks to the help that they have provided, he will be able to purchase compost and fertilizer. He will be able to maintain his crop in such a way that he will be able to obtain a good harvest and be able to continue fighting to make his greatest dream a reality: “To improve his quality of life.”

loans.use: to purchase compost and fertilizer, among others.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet is 46-years-old, married to a tricycle driver, and she is a vendor. They were blessed with four children. Two have already finished school, through their income in the businesses. She wanted to educate all her children that is why she is now asking for additional capital of PHP 6,000 to invest in her small store. She will buy canned goods, noodles, eggs, and soap to sell. Someday, she hopes to keep improving her income and save funds for education purposes. She will be very happy to see all her children be professionals in their chosen career someday.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, eggs, and soap to sell

loans.name: Isabelita

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Isabelita works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell vegetables business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from farming rice and running a general store. Isabelita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell in her buy and sell vegetables business.

Isabelita successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Isabelita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Roselider

texts.en:
Roselider is a business woman who is very hardworking.  She is married with one school-going child.  She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water. 

Roselider has operated a charcoal selling business for the past two years. Her potential clients are neighbours and passersby. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future. 

With the loan she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase  sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en: Gerald is a 41-year-old male who lives in the town of Masindi-Uganda. He is charged with the responsibility of taking care of five children.  Gerald has got a phone accessories and solar business that he builds to add to his income to cater to the family. He wants a loan to buy solar panels and phones to sell. His dream is to educate his children to the university. However, he is challenged by competition.

loans.use: buy solar panels and phones to sell.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is a 45-year-old male who lives in the town of Masindi-Uganda. Patrick deals in ghee and cattle fattening to earn income. Patrick  has been in this business since 1994 with an aim of getting income to cater to his family's needs. He wants a loan to buy cows for fattening. His dream is to build a permanent house for his family, though he is challenged by inadequate capital.

loans.use: to buy cows for fattening.

loans.name: Fifi

texts.en: Fifi is a single female who lives in Masindi-Uganda. She is responsible for educating her four children. Fifi has a textile shop that sells clothes. She has rentals as a source of additional income. With the loan she wants to buy clothes to sell. Fifi has hopes of educating her children like any loving parent. However, she is challenged by inadequate capital.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan tiene 36 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su madre de 64 años de edad. Juan se dedica al cuido de ganado y es así como se gana la vida y mantiene la economía del hogar. Juan desea reparar el techo del corredor de la casa por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos. Espera poder constar con este financiamiento dado que no posee los recursos suficientes para hacerlo por su cuenta.
texts.en:
Juan is 36 years old and lives in his own home along with his 64-year-old mother. Juan makes a living from raising livestock and that is how he makes a living and maintains his home’s economy. 

Juan wishes to repair the roof to his home’s hallway, for which he is requesting this loan from FUSAI, to invest in the purchase of sheets of corrugated metal, wood, and nails. He hopes to be able to count on this funding given that he does not possess sufficient resources to be able to do it himself.

loans.use: to purchase sheets of galvanized metal, wood, and nails to repair the roof of the home's hallway.

loans.name: Jackeline Del Rosario

texts.es:
Jackeline vive en la ciudad de nazca, es una joven con muchas ganas de progresar en la vida, es por ello que con mucho esfuerzo trabaja como secretaria en una empresa de su ciudad y también tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de productos cosméticos, con lo cual actualmente puede solventar sus estudios universitarios, ya que actualmente cursa la carrera de administración.

Jackeline esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella ´podrá solventar los gastos de matrícula de su universidad, de esta manera podrá estar inscrita en el presente ciclo de estudios y seguira luchando y esforzándose para cumplir su sueño:” Ser una gran profesional y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia”.
texts.en:
Jackeline lives in the city of Nazca. She is a young woman who has a great desire to progress in life. It is because of this that she works with much effort as a secretary in a business in her city. She also has a small business selling cosmetic products, with which she currently can pay for her university studies, since she is currently studying Administration.

Jackeline is thankful to the Kiva lenders since thanks to the help that they have provided to her, she will be able to pay her university’s tuition expenses. In this way, she will be able to be enrolled in the present course of studies and continue fighting and making an effort to complete her dream: “To be a great professional and improve her family’s quality of life.”

loans.use: to pay tuition costs.

loans.name: Ofenia

texts.en: Ofenia is 56 years old and now a widow. She was blessed with four children and they live happily in a rural community. She has been engaged in buying and reselling various vegetables within the public market for almost six years. Due to the hardships of life, she aims to strengthen her business in order to earn a higher income and provide the necessities of her family. Due to capital insufficiency, she is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy more stocks of squash, tomatoes, taro, ginger, potatoes, beans and sweet potatoes to resell. Through this loan, she is hoping that she will improve her business and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to buy more squash, tomatoes, taro, ginger, potatoes, beans and sweet potatoes to resell

loans.name: Severiana

texts.es:
Severiana vive en la Ciudad de Huanuco. Esta mujer luchadora tiene 4 hijos a quienes ama y por quienes lucha incansablemente para  ofrecerles un mejor nivel de vida.
Desde hace más de 20 años esta mujer emprendedora trabaja como agricultora ofreciendo productos de alta calidad a los mayoristas. Uno de sus productos cultivados es el plátano.
Severiana se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas de Kiva, ya que con ese gran apoyo brindado ella podrá comprar insumos para abonar sus plantas y mejorar aún más la calidad del plátano y así cumplir uno de sus más grandes sueños: “Llegar a ser mayorista en venta de plátanos”.
“Gracias Kiva”.
texts.en:
Severiana lives in the city of Huanuco. This determined woman has 4 children whom she loves and for whom she fights untiringly to offer them a better standard of living.

For more than 20 years, this entrepreneurial woman works as a farmer, offering high-quality products to wholesalers. One of her cultivated products is the banana.

Severiana finds herself very thankful to the Kiva lenders, since with that great support provided, she will be able to purchase supplies to fertilize her plants and improve the quality of the bananas even more. She will therefore be able to complete one of her greatest dreams: “To become a wholesaler selling bananas.”

“Thanks, Kiva.”

loans.use: to purchase supplies to fertilize her bananas.

loans.name: Sebastian

texts.es:
Sebastian vive en Huánuco, es soltero y tiene dos hijos que son su mayor orgullo y por quienes trabaja con perseverancia para poder apoyar. Desde hace más de 15 años se dedica  a la actividad agrícola, trabaja con cultivos de plátano y café.
Inicialmente Sebastián cultivaba café, pero con el tiempo se dio cuenta que el negocio de venta de plátano era aún más rentable por lo que decidió incursionar en este producto.
En la  actualidad está trabajando en la limpieza e instalación de agua y desagüe de su caserío.
Gracias a los prestamistas de Kiva, este hombre ejemplar podrá comprar insumos para poder abonar sus cultivos y así obtener una mejor calidad en sus productos y venderlo a buen precio; de esta manera hará realidad uno de sus más grandes sueños: “Ser líder en la venta de Productos Agrícolas”.
texts.en: Sebastian lives in Huánuco. He is single and has two children who are his great pride and for whom he works with perseverance to be able to support. Originally he grew coffee but with time he came to realize that selling bananas was more profitable so he decided to try out this product. Today he is working on cleaning out and installing water and sewage systems in his farm house. Thanks to the lenders at Kiva this model father can buy supplies to be able to fertilize his crops. Then he can produce higher quality product and sell them at a good price. By doing this he can realize one of his dreams which is to be a leader in the sales of agricultural products.

loans.use: to buy inputs to fertilize his crops.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marites is 46 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Marites has a fishing business in the Philippines. Marites requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials and gear for her fishing business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her fishing business.

Marites has been in this business for seven years after her first loan from Kiva two years ago. Marites would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and gear for her fishing business

loans.name: Zaburoni

texts.en: Zaburoni is a hard working married man living in Kagadi, Uganda. He operates a retail shop together with selling produce to generate income. He hopes to grow his business into new markets in spite of his challenges of poor roads and price fluctuations. Zaburoni intends to use the loan to buy sugar and soap for resale.

loans.use: to buy sugar and soap for resale.

loans.name: Ayresh Group

texts.en:
Zeini is the featured borrower of the Ayrech group. She and the other borrowers in this group are good friends who look out for one another on a regular basis. They now hope to continue their support for one another through a loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua, which will help them alleviate some of their current financial burdens.
 
Zeini is a 56-year-old widow who has worked in a clothing store for the last 20 years to make her living. Zeini now needs a cooler for her house. This loan will help her cover the costs of this cooler.
 
Zeini is the lady at the center of the picture. As for the other group members, Maryam, the first lady from the right in the picture, is wearing the blue top. Aida, the second member of the group, is on the far left. She is of Filipino origin.

loans.use: to purchase a new cooler for her house.

loans.name: Leonel

texts.es:
Leonel vive en Huánuco, es soltero y tiene dos pequeños hijos a quienes quiere brindarles una mejor educación y mejorar su nivel de vida, es por eso que sale desde muy temprano a trabajar para poder solventar a su familia.

Desde hace más de 20 años se dedica  a la actividad agrícola, cultivando exclusivamente plátano y cacao.
Inicialmente el terreno era de su padre, con el tiempo al percibir que Leonel era una persona muy responsable y trabajadora entregó parte de sus terrenos para que él pudiera hacerse cargo de la producción.

Leonel está muy agradecido con los prestamistas de Kiva, ya que con su gran ayuda él comprará insumos para poder abonar su terreno y mejorar la calidad de sus productos, así cumplirá su mayor sueño: “Llegar a tener el mejor Platanal de la Región”.
texts.en:
Leonel lives in Huanuco. He is single and has two small children to whom he wants to provide a better education and improve their standard of living. It is because of this that he goes out very early to work to be able to support his family.

For more than 20 years, he has made a living from agriculture, cultivating exclusively bananas and cocoa.

Initially, the land was his father’s. With time, when he became aware that Leonel was a very responsible and hard-working person, he turned over part of his land to him so that he would be able to take charge of the production.

Leonel is very thankful to the Kiva lenders, since with their great help, he will purchase supplies to be able to fertilize his land and improve the quality of his products. He will therefore be able to complete his greatest dream: “To have the best banana farm in the region.”

loans.use: to purhcase supplies to fertilize his crops.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 53 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Gloria has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Gloria has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, Gloria would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Rajab

texts.en: Rajab is a 37-year-old married male. He lives in the town of Masindi, Uganda. Rajab practices farming, growing mainly maize and beans. He sells cereals as an additional source of income. He has been in business since 1998. He wants a loan to pay workers for weeding his garden. Rajab has a dream of educating his children. His business is challenged by changes in weather.

loans.use: to pay workers for weeding his maize garden.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel es un Sauceño nacido y criado toda su vida en este pueblo sencillo pero lleno de bondades por sus maravillosos campos y ríos caudalosos que embellecen y a traen a sus visitantes.
Tiene la edad de 42 años, padre de dos niños uno de ellos en edad escolar.
Se desempeña como Gestor de cobro en una Institución de la localidad donde tiene ocho años de laborar y agradece a Dios por tener un trabajo digno que le permite llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar.
Manuel se ha visto en aprietos porque con su bajo salario no le alcanza para gastos extras como el de salud, ya que en este momento está necesitando un crédito para comprar medicamentos, realización de exámenes y pago de consultas médicas para su pequeño hijo que ha estado enfermo.
Por tal razón solicita a los inversionistas de Kiva que le apoyen a través de Ceprodel con un financiamiento para cubrir estos gastos y sanar con la ayuda de Dios también a su hijo.
texts.en:
Manuel is a Saucean, born and bred all of his life in this town that is simple but full of kindness because of its marvelous fields and warm rivers that beautify and attract their visitors.

He is 42 years old and is the father of two children. One of them is school-aged.

He serves as a collection manages in a local institution where he has worked for eight years and thanks God for having a dignified job that allows him to bring bread home every day.

Manuel finds himself in a tight spot because with his low salary he does not have enough left over for extra expenses like health expenses. At this moment, he needs a loan to purchase medicine, exams, and to pay for medical consults for his small son who has been sick.

For this reason, he is requesting that the Kiva lenders support him through CEPRODEL with funding to cover these costs and also, with the help of God, heal his son.

loans.use: to purchase medicine, exams, and pay for medical consults.

loans.name: Nayrar Sartañani Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NAYRAR SARTAÑANI” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Virginia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de poleras y gorras, venta de zapatos, venta de lentes, hilado de lana de vicuña, servicio de transporte, venta de papa, elaboración de zampoñas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Virginia es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora que de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de poleras; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace diez y seis años, con el apoyo de su cuñada quien le enseño la forma de comercialización de estos productos, en la actualidad comercializa los mismos por docenas.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de poleras por cajas) que adquirirá de las ferias fronterizas de Bolivia - Perú y posteriormente lo comercializará a pedido del cliente. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada  y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de crédito y el área de salud que ofrece la institución y su grupo.
texts.en:
The credit union, "Nayrar Sartañani," will begin its fifth cycle with "Pro Mujer" as part of the Central Focus of Collpani. It is comprised of eight members and is directed by an executive board where Virginia is President. The businesses of the communal association members carry them forward. They are assorted businesses and among them are: t-shirt and hat sales, and flute production. 

The loan that they will take out will benefit these small business owners, of which Virgina is a member. She says that she first joined "Pro Mujer" after accepting the invitation of an institution promoter who visited her in her home. Currently, she has a business selling t-shirts. She came to know this business, which launched 16 years ago, with the help of her sister-in-law who taught her the business of selling these products. She currently sells them by the dozen. 

The loan that she is now taking is to increase her inventory (buying t-shirts wholesale). She will purchase them at the markets at the border of Bolivia and Perú and later sell them per customer request. This type of work allows her to make enough resources to support her family since she is married and has two children. 

When asked what she likes most about "Pro Mujer," she responds saying that she likes to credit section and the health section offered by the institution and her group.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts wholesale.

loans.name: Jaime Luis

texts.es: El señor Jaime es un reconocido cultivador de plátanos una hermosa profesión que aprendió al llegar al sector y que fue perfeccionando a medida que ejercía la profesión, con el anime de progresar y demostrar que puede ser un gran empresario Jaime solicita un crédito para la compra de Cerdos, actividad que iría muy de la mano con sus muy comunes oficios de agricultor con el crédito aspira a cumplir grandes sueños como brindarle a sus dos hijos una oportunidad de estudio, mejorar su casa y a un más importante darle una oportunidad de seguir soñando
texts.en: Jaime is a renowned grower of plantains. It is a beautiful profession that he learned after coming into the trade and was perfected throughout his professional experience. With the desire to progress and demonstrate that he can be a great businessman, Jamie is applying for a loan to buy pigs. The work will go hand-in-hand with common farmer duties. With this loan, he hopes to to fulfill big dreams like affording his children with the opportunity to study, improving his home, and most importantly, giving him the opportunity to continue dreaming.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Nelyn

texts.en:
Nelyn has a rice retailing business in Oroquieta City. At 57, she enjoys tending her stall with little help from her husband. This is how they support their children. 

Nelyn is micro-entrepreneur member of PMPC and has maintained a good credit record. She applied for a loan because she is in need of capital to purchase bags of rice to sell. 

Nelyn wishes to sustain her business and hopes to become a rice supplier in nearby towns and cities.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice to sell

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 26 years old. She is married and together they have been blessed with one child. Her spouse provides additional income. She has been running her business for six years now.

She has applied for a loan of KES 30,000 to buy tomatoes, onions, and fruits in bulk to sell to clients in her area. She currently makes an estimated monthly income of KES 20,000. She will use her anticipated profits from the business to provide for her family's basic needs. 

In the future, she hopes to buy a piece of land and build rental houses to increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, onions, and fruits in bulk

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fish to make into dried fish for her dried fish making business.

Gloria has been in this business for five years. Gloria earns more income from buying and selling fish.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Gloria has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to process into dried fish

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a Ugandan hardworking married woman living in Kagadi. She is 38 years old and has four children aged between two and ten years. She has been operating a salon business, motorcycle transport business, and also farming to earn a living. She hopes to complete her residential house despite the challenges of competition and limited capital. Rose is requesting for a loan to buy cosmetics for resale.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Lena

texts.en:
Lena is from Gyumri town. She lives with her parents and works as a lawyer. Lena took a loan from SEF last year and was able to pay for her university tuition. She is very responsible and is a hardworking girl. She has almost paid her first loan back. 

She has requested this new loan to help pay for this year's tuition. Lena will be very grateful to receive Kiva lenders' support again and be able to continue her education.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for university

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a married woman with four school children. She lives in a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Rebecca operates a food making business, making staples, like beans and chapati (flat bread) for sale to passersby and neighbors. 

With the loan, she wants to purchase food items, such as wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar, and beans. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income, and she hopes to establish a restaurant in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase food items, such as wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar, and beans.

loans.name: Melissa Andrea

texts.es: Melisa es una hermosa joven soñadora que quiere brindarle sus alegría y cariño a muchas jóvenes que como ella tuvieron la oportunidad de celebrar sus 15 años, fecha que ha marcado a muchas jóvenes en la vida y melisa no es una excepción y es por esta razón que hace poco inicio un negocio de decoración de eventos actividad que aprendió de su madre la cual en un principio le colaboro, solicita un crédito para la compra de una maquina necesaria para decorar las fiestas y el resto en surtido para realizar las hermosas decoraciones por las cuales se está haciendo conocer, este crédito le permitirá seguir creciendo y posicionar más su negocio, el cual es su principal deseo
texts.en:
Melisa is a beautiful young dreamer who wants to share her joy and affection with many young women who, like her, have the opportunity to celebrate their 15th birthdays. This is an event that leaves a mark on the lives of many young women and Melisa is no exception. For this reason, she recently started a business decorating events. It is a trade she learned from her mother who initially collaborated with her. 

She is applying for a loan to buy a machine needed to decorate parties and the rest will be used for materials to make the beautiful decorations for which she is known. This loan will allow her to continue growing and marketing her business. That is her primary desire.

loans.use: to buy a machine to make decorations and to invest in party decoration materials.

loans.name: Heidy Johana

texts.es:
Ella es Heidy Johana, ella se interesó por  unirse a CampoAlto para poder asegurar el futuro como una gran cosmetóloga, a ella le parece que CampoAlto le da muy buenas bases para ella poder seguir estudiado allí. 
Para ella sería una gran oportunidad el terminar este técnico y tener su propio salón de belleza para a si mismo poder ejercer todo lo que ah aprendido. 
El convenio kiva le servirá mucho para tener una ayuda económica, con este descuento ella sería más fácil al momento de hacer los pagos y poder cumplir los sueños y alcanzar las metas que tiene.
texts.en:
This is Heidy Johana, she became interested in connecting herself with CampoAlto to be able to ensure that she has a future as a successful cosmetician. In her opinion, it seems like CampoAlto gives her very good support to be able to continue studying.

It would be a great opportunity for her to finish this training and to have her own beauty salon so she is able to practice everything she has learned.

The agreement with Kiva will help her a lot financially and with this reduction it will be easier for her to make payments, to fulfill her dreams and to reach the goals she has.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of tuition.

loans.name: Nense

texts.en:
Nense is 28 years old and married with three children. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Nense requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Nense has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Nense would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is married and has two children who attend school. She owns a house that is without electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For over four years, she has operated a tailoring business, making garments for both men and women. She cites seasonality as her major challenge. Lydia dreams of establishing a boutique in the near future.

With the KES 25,000 she wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing threads for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing threads for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase goats to raise and sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy galvanized metal sheets, wood, and nails to repair the roof of her house.

loans.name: Yessica Suleyma

texts.es:
Yessica de 19 años de edad, actualmente está estudiando 3° año de bachillerato contador, esta soltera y vive junto a sus padres.

Ella se dedica a estudiar los fines de semana ya que en el transcurso de la semana tiene que trabajar, ella es sastre aprendió este oficio a los 15 años gracias a un curso implementado por una ONG en la comunidad donde ella vive,  el trabajo para ella es muy bueno ya que en poco tiempo a ganado mucha experiencia. Actualmente ella trabaja con el gobierno en la elaboración de uniformes para los alumnos del centro escolar, aparte de esto tiene un negocio familiar que es una granja de gallinas ponedoras,  con la cual ella tiene un ingreso junto a su familia aparte de la actividad productiva que realizan el trabajo lo tiene en su casa de habitación, gracias a esto ella no se tiene que andar trasladando a otro lugar para ejercerle y así se ahorra tiempo y dinero.

El préstamo que esta solicitado, es para comprar gallinas ponedoras y realizara unas remodelaciones a el lugar donde las tiene,  ya que se acerca la temporada de lluvia y tiene que proteger sus inversiones de una buena manera, también comprara el alimento para las mismas ya que necesita tener siempre cerca los concentrados para no perder el ritmo de alimentación de sus animales de esta manera, ella tendrá su producto a diario y a la hora de la venta vera reflejados sus esfuerzos en las ganancias que este le genere.

Ella desea que en el futuro sus esfuerzos sean bien recompensados teniendo una buena producción con sus gallinas ponedoras,  así como también desea que el trabajo que realiza como sastre aumente y que sea bien reconocida en otros lugares.
texts.en:
Yessica is 19 years old. She is currently studying her third year of bookkeeping school. She is single and lives with her parents. 

She spends her weekends studying since she has to work throughout the course of the week. She is a tailor and learned this trade at age 15 thanks to a course provided by a non-governmental organization in the community where she lives. This work is very good for her since she gained a lot of experience in a short amount of time. She currently works with the government making uniforms for school students. Aside from this work, she has a family business that is a laying hen farm. This brings an income with her family that is apart from her own work. She has it in her home. Thankfully, she does not have to travel to another place to do her work so she saves time and money. 

This loan is to buy laying hens and to make repairs to the place where they are kept since the rainy season is near and she has to protect her investments in a good way. She also will buy feed for the hens since they always need to be near feed as to not disrupt the feeding schedule of the animals. This way she will have her daily product and at the time of sale she will see her efforts in the profits it generates.

She hopes that in the future her efforts will be well compensated with a good production from her laying hens. She also hopes that her tailoring work increases and is well recognized in other places.

loans.use: to buy laying hens, feed, and to make improvements the place where they are kept.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma works hard to support her family. Alma is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fishing nets, gasoline, and other fishing materials.

Alma has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Alma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing nets, gasoline, and other fishing materials

loans.name: Diego Alejandro

texts.es:
Diego, de 23 años, vive solo y tiene una capacidad de trabajo impresionante.
El se dedica a la producción y venta de cerdos de levante y engorde, el oficio lo aprendió al trabajar gran parte de su vida en las fincas de algunos amigos, allí adquirió una vasta experiencia en el campo y por esta razón decidió iniciar con su propio negocio.
Este trabajo lo alterna a su vez con la recolección de chatarra y elementos reciclables, con estas dos actividades consigue los ingresos necesarios para su propio sostenimiento y para aportar con los gastos de su hogar.
Solicita un auxilio para comprar unos cuantos lechones y capitalizar un poco su negocio, hecho que le permitirá mantenerlo a flote y tener siempre animales para la venta.
texts.en:
Diego, who is 23, lives alone and has an impressive capacity for work.

He produces and sells pigs that he raises and fattens. He learned this work from working for the greater part of his life on the farms of some friends. There he acquired vast experience in the field, and for this reason he decided to begin his own business.

He alternates this work with collecting scrap metal and recyclable items. With these two activities, he obtains the necessary income for his own sustenance and to support the expenses of his household.

He is applying for assistance to buy a few piglets and capitalize his business a little. This will allow him to keep his business afloat and to always have animals for sale.

loans.use: to buy pigs to continue with his production.

loans.name: Maro

texts.en:
Maro lives in Darakert village with her parents and brother. Maro is a 21-year-old student. Her parents are employed in a private company and work hard to sustain their family's living. 

The income that they gather is enough for covering the family's basic costs only, and it is very difficult to save money for Maro's university tuition. That's the reason Maro has applied for this loan. She asks Kiva lenders to support her with the university tuition and hopes for their support.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition

loans.name: Raghida

texts.en:
Raghida is a 40-year-old single woman and an employee in a clothing store. She lives with her sister, and together they support each other financially. She likes her job, which she has held for nine years. It has provided her with great communication skills.

Raghida is acquiring a loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua for the second time. Previously she took out a loan to settle some of her nephew's education fees. Now she hopes to buy a supply of firewood before prices get too high in the peak season .

loans.use: to buy a supply of firewood before prices get too high in the peak season .

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es:
Julia, tiene 57 años de edad, ella es socia del grupo "Nuevo Amanecer" formado por seis integrantes. Desde hace mas de siete años se dedica a la venta de salchipapas y todo lo que es comida rápida. Su negocio ha ido creciendo poco a poco debido también al requerimiento y aumento de sus clientes, así como también sus clientes empezaron a exigirle mas variedad en sus platos de comida, por lo que decidió ofrecer servicio de pensión es decir menú completo para aquellos que lo requerían.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en la compra de insumos para la preparación de sus salchipapas y todo lo que es comida rápida, como sanguches, pollos broaster y bebidas gaseosas.
texts.en:
Julia is 57 years old. She is a member of the "Nuevo Amanecer" (New Dawn) group, which is formed by six members. For more than seven years she has sold salchpapas [a sausage and potato dish] and everything that is fast food. Her business has grown little by little due to both the requests of and increase in her customers. Since her customers also began to request more variety in her dishes, she decided to offer meal services, that is to say, a complete menu for those who demand it.

She will invest the loan that she receives in the purchase of supplies to prepare her salchipapas and everything that is fast food, such as sandwiches, broasted chicken, and carbonated drinks.

loans.use: to buy supplies to prepare fast food

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina is a businesswoman from Oroquieta City. She is hands-on entrepreneur with a rice retailing business. At the age of 39, she never gets tired of managing her business. For all her capital needs, she always seeks the help of the Cooperative. Recently, she asked for a loan to purchase bags of rice to sell. Gina hopes to open another rice outlet for her retailing business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice to sell

location.town: Oroquieta-Tabuc Sur, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occid

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
This is Carmen, 59, resident of Pasay, Philippines. She manages her own household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses – especially for her grandchildren who are still studying.

Carmen operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings when all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to buy cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands costs less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan. She will be using the loan to buy more products, like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments, seasonings and other products, needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Carmen hopes to grow her business and dreams of being able to give her grandchildren a good future. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients, like rice, pork, chicken and vegetables, and products needed for her business.

loans.name: Verginita

texts.en:
Verginita is 50 years old and married with five children, one of whom is in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Verginita is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Verginita has been raising pigs for 15 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Delia works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines, she and also earns additional income from fishing. Delia is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for her business.

Delia has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Klaudio

texts.en: Claudio is a 49-year-old married and hardworking man living in Kagadi, Uganda. He operates a mini depot and farms to generate income. He hopes to educate his children despite losses as a result of bottles breaking in the store. He is asking for a loan to buy beers and sodas for resale.

loans.use: to buy beers and sodas to resell

loans.name: Karuni

texts.en:
Karuni is a married woman; she lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Karuni operates a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a stiff competition from other charcoal operators in her business.
 
With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: José Arnoldo

texts.es:
José de 36 años de edad, es acompañado, en el hogar procrearon 5 hijos. La esposa trabaja realizando los oficios domésticos. Él realizo 5º grado de estudio, los niños están en la escuela 3 varones y dos hembras  la mayor está haciendo 6º grado y el segundo 4ª grado, el tercero  está en 2º grado y el cuarto en primero y el ultimo esta de 4 años de edad.

José es agricultor, este trabajo lo desempeña desde que estaba con su padre, él lo llevaba a asombrar  maíz y frijol;  pero se independizo desde hace 23 años. Él cultiva aparte los granos básicos, él no tiene otras actividades solo cultivo de maíz y frijol,  pero eso es para el consumo de la familia Y de vez en cuando trabaja el jornal para a ser algunos gastos de alimentación.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar 4 sacos de abono, 2 de sulfato y dos de formula y cultivar maíz y frijol.  Con el crédito mejorara grandemente porque sin el no puede cultivar y  es una gran necesidad de hacerlo porque son 5 niños y dos adultos 7, sería un poco difícil para sobrevivir sin el maíz y los frijolitos ya que para ellos es lo básico en las comunidades.   

Él tiene un sueño y muy grande, es estar vivo y con buena salud para trabajar muy fuerte para darles estudio a los niños,  porque la vida del agricultor es pesada y no tiene muchos ingresos. Él no quiere eso para los niños de él.
texts.en:
José is 36 years old, married, and has five children. His wife works in housekeeping. He completed the fifth grade. The children go to school. They are three boys and two girls. The eldest is in the sixth grade, the second in fourth grade, the third in second grade, the fourth in first grade, and the youngest is four years old.

José is a farmer. He has done this work since he was with his father who taught him to grow corn and beans. However, he became independent 23 years ago. He also grows basic grains on the side. He does not have other work besides growing corn and beans, but this is for family consumption. Sometimes he works as a day laborer to cover other food expenses. 

The loan that he is applying for with CrediCampo is to buy four sacks of fertilizer, two of sulfate, two of formula, and to grow corn and beans. With the loan he will greatly improve because without it, he could not farm. This is an important necessity because there are five children and two adults - seven in total. It would be difficult to survive without corn and beans since for them they are the basics in the community. 

He has one, very big dream to be alive with good health to work hard to give his children an education, because the life of a farmer is hard and does not make a lot of income. He does not want this for his children.

loans.use: to buy four sacks of fertilizer, two of sulfate, two of formula, and to grow corn and beans.

loans.name: Mona Al Rafid Group

texts.en:
Sawsan is the featured representative of Mona Al Rafid Group. She and the other group members are best friends and have helped each other in times of financial need. They view Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua as a means to help provide them all with better livelihoods.

Sawsan is a 52-year-old married woman of six whose husband works in home decor and painting. Although she has 33 years of experience in tailoring, she finally decided to start an at-home tailoring business two years ago. Sawsan is a crafty woman and also happens to be a master bread baker of 30 years, which she also recently began selling from home. Her loan will be used to open a perfume shop with her daughter (not for a tailoring and bread shop).

Sawsan is the second lady from the left. As for the other group members, Mona is the lady with the pink veil the first from the far left; Nahla is the lady covering her hair with a brown veil, the first from the right; and Zeinab is the second from the right.

loans.use: to open a perfume shop with her daughter

loans.name: Marjona

texts.en: Marjona was born in 1987. She is not married and lives with her mother in southern Tajikistan. Marjona is a higher-educated person. She is an accountant. She has worked for more than 6 years at a local hospital. Marjona does her job well. Little by little, she develops her knowledge and skills. She is going to repair their house as it is in bad condition. She is asking for a loan of 4,000 TJS to buy building materials such as cement, wood, paints, etc. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as cement, wood, paints, etc.

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en:
Sanaa is a 48-year-old married mother of four. Her husband is employed in a cardboard factory, and they both work hard to provide for their children. Eight years ago, Sanaa established her own shop that sells undergarments. She gained the skills to start her business from a  friend working in the same field, and so far her business has been able to provide extra income for her family.

Sanaa is a hard worker who has successfully paid off four previous loans that have helped her grow her business. She's acquired a new loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to complete some needed repairs for her shop and increase her merchandise for the upcoming busy summer months.

loans.use: To complete some needed repairs for her shop and increase her merchandise for the upcoming busy summer months.

loans.name: Enriquieta

texts.en: Enriquieta is a farmer in Aloran. She is 41 years old, married, and a businesswoman. She has a retail business buying and selling whole nuts. She earns a meager income of 8,000 PHP doing this type of work. She owes all her capital needs to PMPC. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase whole nuts to sell. She wishes to earn more so that she can support her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase whole nuts to sell

loans.name: Felina

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Felina works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Felina is borrowing 17,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Felina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha works hard to support her family. Editha is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy wood, bamboo, paints, fishing net, etc for her business. Editha has been in this business for 7 years now.

In the future, Editha would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy wood, bamboo, paints, fishing net, etc. for her business

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Rosemarie works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice and corn. Rosemarie is borrowing 6,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell to customers.

She hopes that her hard work will help her achieve her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 58 years old and married with six children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 28,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell like soap, milk, canned goods, eggs, etc.

Elizabeth has borrowed and repaid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 27 years and also earns an income from a restaurant.

Elizabeth aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like soap, milk, canned goods, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Hamisi

texts.en: Hamisi is a 35-year-old hardworking married man living in Kagadi, Uganda with 5 children who are aged 10 to two years. Three of his children attend school. He has been operating a butchery, selling cattle and farming since 2005 to look after his family. He hopes for prosperity though he is challenged by a lack of enough capital to boost his business. Hamisi is asking for a loan to buy cattle to sell.

loans.use: to buy cattle to sell.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
This is Mariam. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She also sells water to passersby and neighbors.

Mariam wants to repair her leaking water pipes. She is requesting a loan to purchase water pipes to replace her leaking ones. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase water pipes to replace her leaking ones

loans.name: Carrosio Franklin

texts.es:
Carrosio es un joven muy estudioso, es huérfano de padre y vive actualmente con su tía, hermana de su padre ya que su madre apenas se hacia cargo de el, por lo que decidió recibirlo en su casa hace ya 4 años. Ella desea darle una educación q su madre no quiere que tenga porque quiere que trabaje y apenas lo ayuda económicamente. Su tía le da todo en cuanto puede, sin embargo esta atravesando por una crisis económica que no le permite seguir ayudando a Carrosio con el pago de sus estudios por lo que no podría continuar con ellos de no contar con el apoyo de los prestamistas de Kiva.
Carrosio esta muy feliz y agradecido con el apoyo que los prestamistas de Kiva pueden brindarle, el dice que devolverá con estudio y esfuerzo todo lo que hacen por el.
El a pasado por muchas dificultades en la vida y sabe que como el hay muchos chicos en el Perú y el mundo que gracias al apoyo de Kiva y sus prestamistas podrán ser profesionales y salir adelante por lo que considera que hacen una labor muy loable y digna de admiración.
texts.en: Carrosio is a very studious young man. He was orphaned by his father and currently lives with his aunt, sister of his father since his mother hardly cared for him. For this reason she decided to take him into her home four years ago. She hopes to give him the education that his mother did not want because she only wanted him to work so he could help financially. His aunt gives him everything that she can. However, she is going through an economic crisis that will not allow her to continue helping Carrosio to pay for his studies. He would not be able to continue his studies if it weren't for the Kiva lenders. Carrosio is very happy and thankful for the support the Kiva lenders have given him. He says that he will return to school and put all his efforts into it. He has gone through many difficulties. He knows that there are many boys in Perú and the world that, thanks to the support of Kiva and its lenders, can be professionals and continue moving forward and consider the work that they do laudable and worthy of admiration.

loans.use: to pay for technical education in maintaining heavy machinery.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en: Fe is a businesswoman who sells dried fish to earn a living. She is 54 years old, married, and lives in Aloran. Fe supports her husband who is a minimum wage earner. Now that their children are growing, they opt to labor a lot to earn a living. Fe has reached PMPC for her capital needs. She applied for a loan to purchase more kilos of dried fish to sell. Fe hopes to become a wholesaler of dried fish in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more kilos of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Selina

texts.en:
Selina is a married woman; she has three children, all of whom attend school. Selina owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Selina has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other operators in her business.
 
With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Ma. Salome

texts.en:
Ma. Salome is 52 years old and is a widow. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Ma. Salome has a business selling personal products in the Philippines. Ma. Salome requested a PHP 7,500 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more personal products to sell.

Ma. Salome has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Ma. Salome would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more personal products to sell.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is 48 years old and married with seven children, two of whom are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, milk, cream soap, etc.

Flordeliza has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, milk, cream soap, etc.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 57 years old and is married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell like soap, chips, eggs, milk, etc.

Julieta has borrowed and paid loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from a general store and buying and selling cashew nuts.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell like soap, chips, eggs, milk, etc.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is 42 years old and married with one child.  She works hard to provide for her family, running a general store in the Philippines.  Lilibeth requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like spices, soft drinks, soap, and canned goods.

Lilibeth has borrowed and repaid 3 loans from NWTF prior to this loan.  She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from buying and selling cashew nuts and dried fish.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spices, soft drinks, soap, and can goods to sell.

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha appreciates her previous loan that improved her living standards.  Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income.  

She would like to apply for a loan to buy food ingredients such as onions, tomatoes, wheat flour, and maize flour for her business.  She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy onions, tomatoes, wheat flour, and maize flour for her business.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a single woman with one child who attends school.  She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail  business for the past two years selling household items.  She faces a major challenge with seasonality in her business. 

With the loan she is requesting, Jane will purchase household cups, plates, stoves, and spoons for resale.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase household cups, plates, stoves, and spoons for resale.

loans.name: Babati Group

texts.en:
Robson is the father of two daughters who are in school. He is in his thirties and since 2010 he has supported his family by running several businesses. He has a shop selling phones and phone accessories and another selling shoes, radios and TVs. Price advantages (selling at low prices) and quality products from his rivals with high business capital, are challenges facing Robson. Together with those challenges, he makes sure that he keeps good relations and improves through problem solving so as to compete. Robson starts his business from 7 am to 8 pm daily and is able to make a good profit.

He is applying for his twentieth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. With his previous loans, all of which were paid back successfully, Robson opened a new branch and restocked more products. He received a profit which he used to buy a sofa set, TV, cupboard and covered school fees and home food expenses. He dreams that one day he will be able to grow his business capital more. Robson will use this loan to buy high price and quality phone products to catch more customers.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Babati" which consist of three members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy high price and quality phone products to catch more customers.

loans.name: Evangelista

texts.en: Evangelista is from Manamong, Aloran. She is a farmer who grows a variety of crops. She is hands-on in managing her farming activities. For this cropping season, Evangelista has applied for a loan to purchase farm inputs. Evangelista deeply wishes to live comfortably with her children around her.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Hidoyat

texts.en:
Hidoyat lives with her child in a house in bad condition. She is a poor woman. Hidoyat is divorced, and she is the only feed keeper for her child and herself. Hidoyat is a higher educated person. She works in a school as a teacher of small classes. Hidoyat has worked in a local school more than eight years.

She does not have enough salary to repair her house, but she wants so much to repair her house. Hidoyat is asking for a loan of 2,500 Somoni to buy building materials such as cement, wood, paints, etc. She will repair all the rooms of her house. She hopes this loan will help her to make her house comfortable. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as cement, wood, paints, etc.

loans.name: Lizza

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Lizza works hard to support her family.

She has a buying and selling of cashew nuts business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling dried coconut meat. Lizza is borrowing 11,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase more stock of cashew nuts to sell for her buying and selling of cashew nuts business.

Lizza has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of cashew nuts to sell

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a Ugandan married man, aged 36, with four children aged 13 to 6 years all attending school. He lives in Kagadi, where he has been operating a retail shop, farming and owning rentals to earn a living. He hopes to educate his children despite competition. Peter is requesting a loan to buy general merchandise like soap and jelly to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise like soap and jelly to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more goats to raise and resell

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 54 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Liza is borrowing 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Liza has been raising pigs for three years and also earns additional income from pre-paid mobile load.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Darwicha

texts.en:
Darwicha is a 54-year-old single woman and the sole earner for two members of her family. Seven years ago she opened a grocery shop in a Palestinian camp and it has many customers. After facing the struggle of making enough revenue to cover the cost of the shop, she has since started earning a steady income from her business.

She acquired another new loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to buy an ice cream cooler and increase her merchandise since she counts on the coming summer months to make more profit.

She intends to develop her business more one day in a way that better improves her family's livelihood.

loans.use: to buy an ice cream cooler and increase her merchandise

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
As a way of generating income, Julie has engaged in cooking and selling pork and chicken barbecue within her community for almost 10 years now. She is 49 years of age and blessed with only one child. Due to financial insufficiency, she wants to make her business more profitable in order to earn a higher income. 

She plans to cook and sell more snack recipes, but she doesn't have enough capital. For this reason, she would like to avail a loan amounting to 50,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy hot dogs, pork and chicken barbecue and seasonings that are needed. Being a kind and friendly mother, she is hoping that she will further improve the business through this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy hot dogs, pork, chicken barbecue and seasonings

location.town: Brgy. Sto. Domingo, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Nadine

texts.en:
Nadine is a 35-year-old married mother of two. Four years ago she started working as a saleswoman at a shopping center. Nadine previously worked as an accountant's secretary, but her communication and social skills pushed her to explore a more promising career, although her income is considered barely enough to cover the increasing demands of her family. 
	
She is now taking out a loan with Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to pay the rent fees of her house three months in advance. Nadine hopes to continue working hard so that one day she can provide her children with a better education in a private school.

loans.use: To pay the rent fees of her house three months in advance

loans.name: Safarmoh

texts.en:
A woman with a great desire to get ahead in life has been busy for more than 17 years with selling fabrics. Her name is Safarmoh. Safarmoh was born in 1972. She is married and brings up four children. Safarmoh’s husband is an entrepreneur. She is also a perfect businesswoman because she has a great experience in this field. 

Safarmoh buys in bulk fabrics from the bazaar that is located in the capital of Tajikistan and sells them in a local market. She is going to buy a new variety of fabrics for the new summer season. She is asking for a loan of 3,000 Somoni to buy fabrics for the new season. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy fabrics for the new season

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 29 years old. He is married and together they have been blessed with three children. He has been running his business for five years now. He would like to expand his business. Currently he makes an estimated monthly income of KES 26,500.

He would like a loan of KES 30,000 to buy second hand clothes in bulk to sell in order to increase his income. He will use the anticipated income to import new clothes to add on the stock. 

In the future, he hopes that he will be stable enough to educate his children and provide their basic needs.

loans.use: to buy second hand clothes in bulk to sell

loans.name: Maxine Renee

texts.en:
Maxine Renee works hard to support two children. She has a buy and sell of feeds business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 5,200 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have backup light in case of an emergency.

Maxine Renee is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines.

Milagros is borrowing PHP 5,200 through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to be able to extend her business hours even after nightfall.

Milagros is aware that by using the solar lamp, she will be saving money, helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience is widowed and has kids. They live at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

She has operated a clothes selling business, selling from home and door to door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of lack of capital to expand her business.

With the loan she is requesting of 50,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel works hard to support her family. Rachel is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net.

Rachel has been in this business for four years now.

In the future, Rachel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net

loans.name: Patma

texts.en: Patma is a 50-year-old married woman from Marneuli district. She lives in the village of Sarali with her husband and two sons. Patma works hard on family-owned agricultural land, growing cabbage and potatoes in the greenhouse. She always has high quality products, which are sold to local retailers for a good price. Patma's husband greatly helps her with the everyday activities related to her agribusiness. As the family has only seasonal income, she decided to start dairy farming and seek a loan from local financial institutions, but her attempts were unsuccessful because of her poor living conditions. The startup program, a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables rural poor to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. Patma's application was approved under the framework of this program for a loan of 3,000 GEL for purchasing cattle and building a cattle shed. After this, the family will have a stable income that will enable them to cover everyday costs as well as expand their agribusiness in the future. With the support of the Start Up program, Patma will get an opportunity to generate more income and tackle the financial difficulties.

loans.use: To purchase cattle and build a cattle shed

loans.name: Nona

texts.en:
Nona requested a loan from SEF to enlarge her start-up family business. Together with her parents and sister, Nona has been involved in a retail business. She imports clothing and household goods from a neighboring country and sells them to her customers in Goris town.
  
She has applied for this loan to be able to purchase a new stock of supplies for her customers. The loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans, with soft conditions, to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

Please help Nona to enlarge her business and meet her customers' demands.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of clothing to sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married woman; she lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Esther has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other charcoal operators in her business.
 
With the 50,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Gerevasio

texts.en:
Gerevasio is a forty-year-old hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in produce selling as his main source of income though he has other side businesses like a wholesale bar where he earns an extra income. He started this business to sustain his family and have a better standard of living. He faces challenges of competition and weather changes that affect his produce business. He has a vision of owning a big modern produce store in some years to come.

He is requesting a loan to buy more coffee and maize seeds to sell.

loans.use: to buy more coffee and maize seeds to sell.

loans.name: Ahlam

texts.en:
Ahlam is a 51-year-old divorced mother of two. She has sold clothes from her home for quite some time now, with 20 years of experience in this domain. In just a few months, she hopes to establish a small shop to cover the increasing demands of her children, after being left by her husband. When she first started her business, she struggled to find enough capital to buy quality clothes to sell. Now her business is more established and she has a variety of clients.

Ahlam is a new borrower with Kiva’s field partner AL Majmoua. She hopes to purchase a stylish set of clothes for young ladies since the summer season is approaching. In the future, she intends to make more development in her business plan in a way that attracts more tourists and residents from the surrounding areas.

loans.use: to purchase stylish clothes for young ladies to sell

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 58 years old and married with eight children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Rebecca is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rebecca has been raising pigs for 7 years and earns additional income from farming rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Milagro De La Paz

texts.es:
Milagro  de 39 años de edad, estudio Administración de Empresas, es madre de tres hijos de 17,14 y 7 años de edad, quienes estudian, su esposo trabaja como maestro en una comunidad cercana.
Milagro, trabaja como empleada de gobierno en el hospital nacional, por varios años por ley de salario, el cual le queda cerca de su hogar.
Milagro solicita un crédito en credicampo, para gastos de la universidad de su hija, el cual le urge de esa forma cubrirá la necesidad .
Milagro sueña que sus hijos se superen y lleguen a ser profesionales y tengan un buen trabajo igual que ella que con esfuerzo pudo lograr estudiar, y que tengan una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Milagro is 39 years old, she studied Business Administration, is the mother of three children of 17,14 and 7 years old who are in school. Her husband works as a teacher in the nearby community.
