Milagro works as a government employee in a national hospital, for many years by the wage law, which is located near her home.

Milagro is asking for a loan from Credicampo for her daughter's university expenses, which are pressing and this way she can meet the need. Milagro dreams that her children will surpass her and become professionals and have good jobs just like her, and with effort that can manage to study and that they will have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's university costs.

loans.name: Aksante Mungu Group

texts.fr: La cliente Nyamuhirwa est une commerçante  depuis 2 ans et membre d’un collectif d’affaires «Aksante Mungu»,  junior entrepreneur, âgée de 26 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants, dont 3 étudient et 1 autre encore bambin.  Elle est vendeuse souliers usagés. Elle installe son business dans un marché centre de la ville. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre ses activités. Elle va acheter 57 paires de souliers. Son conjoint, lui aussi est commerçant. Elle avait débuté avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite scolariser et nourrir  ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour avoir bien choisi sa cible, en apportant un soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs exclues du système bancaire classique, tout en  leur accordant des crédits sans garantie matérielle, surtout, pendant, la période post conflit dans la région de l’Est Pays.
texts.en:
Nyamuhirwa has been selling used shoes for two years and is a member of the Aksante Mungu businesss group. A young entrepreneur, she is 26 years old, married, and a mother of three children. Three of the children go to school while the fourth is still an infant.

Nyamuhirwa started her business with funds from her husband, who is also a merchant. She makes her sales in a central town market. She is seeking a loan with Hekima so that she can expand her business. She is going to buy 57 pairs of shoes [with her portion of the loan].

In the future, she wishes to feed and educate her children.

Nyamuhirwa thanks Hekima for choosing to support female entrepreneurs, who are excluded from the traditional banking system and who lack collateral; especially during this period of post-conflict in the east of the country.

loans.use: to buy 57 pairs of shoes

loans.name: Bora Group

texts.fr: La cliente Machozi est une brave commerçante, conseillère et membre d’une plateforme d’affaires «Bora», entrepreneur, dynamique, âgée de 56 ans, mariée et mère de 10 enfants qui tous étudient. La cliente est vendeuse des denrées alimentaires. Elle installe sa marchandise à domicile sur l’avenue de la route secondaire de la ville. Elle commença ses affaires avec le premier capital reçu de son mari. Son conjoint est un chauffeur véhicules poids lourds. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 14 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 2 sacs d’haricots, 1 sac de maïs et 50 kg de pomme de terre. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son crédit, scolariser, vêtir et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs exclues du système bancaire classique.Il sied de signaler certaines clientes portent leur bébés.
texts.en:
Machozi is a brave merchant, advisor, and member of the Bora Group. She is a dynamic entrepreneur, 56 years old, married, and a mother of ten children, who all go to school. 

Machozi has been selling basic foodstuffs for 14 years. She displays her goods from her home on a side road in town. She started this business with funds she received from her husband, who is a heavy vehicle driver. Later she benefited from a loan with Hekima.

This new loan will serve to buy two sacs of beans, one sac of corn, and 50 kilograms of potatoes.

Machozi wishes to increase her credit [limit], and feed, clothe, and educate her children.

Finally, Machozi strongly thanks Hekima for helping female entrepreneurs, who are excluded from the traditional banking system, to become independent.

As a note: There are some members in the photo who are carrying their children.

loans.use: to buy two sacs of beans, one sac of corn, and 50 kilograms of potatoes

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Emmanuel, a father of three from Kisii which is a rural town in Kenya known for tea and dairy farming. For the last 10 years, Emmanuel has been selling eggs and tea from his farm as well as engaging in other small businesses to take care of his family. 
Typical of smallholder rural farmers in Kenya, Emmanuel leads a low income lifestyle. He wants to changes this. Emmanuel is seeking a loan to purchase a dairy cow. His biggest challenge has always been raising capital to purchase inputs and expand his agribusiness enterprise. By purchasing a dairy cow, Emmanuel will get an alternative source of income that is sufficient to repay the loan. Cows produce milk every day, providing a more regular and predictable income. 
Emmanuel enjoys selling his farm produce. "I've grown up farming, and selling produce to generate income for my family is the best part of the cycle. I always look forward to selling my produce at the market" he stated. 
Emmanuel promised to name the cow he will acquire Nyakanga. He is very optimistic that Nyakanga will be full of health and productive. He has already set aside land for growing fodder. 
"I am too committed to diversifying to divert funds to other projects. My highest monthly expense is family related... but I am focused on increasing my income so I will not be tempted to spend a KIVA lender's hard-earned money on consumables."

Your loan will go a long way in helping Emmanuel boost his income levels and elevate his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina is a mother of three children, two of whom go to school. She is a first-time borrower with UGAFODE microfinance. She’s a nurse who has a passion to help accident victims. She wants to take a loan of two million UGX to complete payment for her plot of land valued at 7,000,000 UGX, of which she has already paid 5,000,000 UGX.
 
She’s grateful to the lenders for supporting her in her struggle to establish herself with a home. She hopes to complete payment for her plot and slowly build a house. This will help her cut down on rent costs and also give her children decent accommodation. She is hard working and focused. Pictured is the client (center), her husband (left) and the Ugafode credit officer (right).

loans.use: To complete payment on her land

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair the closet and pay for plumbing work for the kitchen

loans.name: Rustico

texts.en: Rustico is a 58-year-old father who is raising his family in a rural community. He cultivates his farm by planting vegetables and root crops for sale. He also engages in a hog-raising business to have an additional source of income. Being a responsible father, he aims to improve their standard of living to give his family a better life. He planned to raise more pigs to sell but he has inadequate capital. For this reason, he is requesting for a loan of PHP 35,000 to buy hog feed, vitamins, vaccines and additional pigs to raise. Through his patience and hard work, he believes that he will make improvements in the business as well as their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, vitamins, vaccines and additional pigs to raise

location.town: Brgy. Belance, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Erilda

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Erilda works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from food vending. Erilda is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials for her fishing business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she is requesting an additional loan to further build her business.

Erilda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for her fishing business

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a hardworking woman who still sells clothes. She greatly thanks Kiva lenders for supporting her financially.
She is requesting a loan to purchase 20 pieces of women's wrap clothes for her business. She joined Yehu to boast her business.

loans.use: to purchase 20 pieces of women's wrap clothes for her business

loans.name: Juan Pablo Unido Group

texts.es:
ANTONY JOSSEP, tiene 23 años de edad, él es socio del grupo "Juan Pablo Unido", formado por seis socios, todos ellos caracterizados por su espíritu emprendedor.

Antony Jossep se dedica a la venta y reparación de equipos celulares, ésta actividad la viene realizando por mas de tres años, inició vendiendo los equipos celulares, pero se dio cuenta que a la vez mucho le preguntaban si reparaba los celulares, por lo que tomó la decisión de estudiar y prepararse para ofrecer éste servicio. Su negocio ha crecido y el cada vez se va actualizando para poder atender la demanda de reparación de equipos de última generación.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en la compra de repuestos para celulares y así surtir su stock.
En la fotografía Antony Jossep está ubicado al lado derecho vistiendo una casa negra, acompañado de sus cinco compañeros y la hija pequeña de una de las socias quien deseaba aparecer en la fotografía.
texts.en: Antony Jossep is 23 years old and a member of the group "Juan Pablo Unido", which consists of six members, all of whom are defined by having an enterprising spirit. Antony Jossep works in repairs and sales of cellular equipment. He's been doing this job for over three years, beginning with sales of cellular equipment and at the same time becoming aware that many people were asking if he also did repairs for cell phones. So he decided to study and train to provide that service. His business has grown and he always stays current with the latest equipment so that he can provide repair service. He'll invest the loan in the purchase of spare parts for cell phones and stock his inventory. Antony Jossep is on the right side of the photo wearing a black sweater, accompanied by his five fellow members and one of their young daughters who wanted to be in the photo.

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of spare parts to stock his cell phone repairs and sales business

loans.name: Divino Niño Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Doris Verónica forma parte del grupo "Divino Niño", éste grupo tiene casi seis meses de formado y lo integran ocho socios.
Doris Verónica, se dedica desde hace aproximadamente tres años a prestar servicios de cosmiatría. Ella escogió estudiar ésta carrera técnica porque se dio cuenta que cada vez las mujeres exigían mas para su arreglo personal, actualmente éste servicio es muy solicitado. Doris Verónica ha iniciado ambientando un pequeño espacio en su casa para brindar éste servicio, le gustaría mas adelante poder tener un gran local, con personal bajo su cargo y que se convierta en un centro de cosmiatría integral.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en la compra de productos para la aplicación a sus clientas clientas para el servicio de cosmiatría como rejuvenecimiento facial, disminución de medidas, etc.
texts.en:
Doris Verónica is part of the Divino Niño Group; this group has been together for almost six months and it is made up of eight members. 

Doris Verónica has been providing cosmetological services for around three years.  She chose to study this technical career because she realized that women demand more and more for their personal appearance; these services are currently very sought after.  Doris Verónica has started setting up a small space in her home to provide these services; in the future she would like to have her own large space with employees to manage and to become an integral cosmetological center.   

She will invest the loan she has received to buy products to use on her customers for cosmetological services such as facial rejuvenation, size reduction, etc.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of products to provide cosmetological services

loans.name: Amparo Del Socorro

texts.es: Amparo se remite nuevamente a solicitar crédito para la compra de insumos como herbicidas y otros fertilizantes y así obtener buenas cosechas, esta siembra estará al cuidado de su esposo, ella obtiene sus ingresos de la venta de cosas de horno y se ayuda mucho produciendo el potencial maíz en su propiedad, así evita comprarlo y obtiene mayores ganancias.  se esfuerza cada día para salir adelante con su negocio.
texts.en: Amparo is applying for a new loan to buy supplies such as herbicides and other fertilizers and thereby reap good harvests.  This crop will be under her husband's care.  She makes her income selling baked goods and growing corn on her property is a great help as she avoids having to buy it and makes more profits.  She works every day to get ahead with her business.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her corn crop

loans.name: Zebo

texts.en: Zebo is a 42-year-old widowed woman. She is a responsible mother of three children. She began her business processing and selling dried fruits when her children were little. It was 20 years ago. During the past 20 years Zebo has been buying dried fruits, processing it and selling it in a local market. Her daughter helps her with managing the business. Zebo and her children want to repair their house. Zebo’s house is in bad condition. She is asking for a loan of 5000 Somoni to buy building materials, wood and soil for repairing her house. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy building materials, wood and soil for repairing her house

loans.name: Salcita

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Salcita works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from buying and selling fish. Salcita is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase additional bundles of fishing net for her fishing business.

Salcita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of fishing net

loans.name: Cuestión De Fe Ii Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CUESTION DE FE II” iniciará el décimo cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Concepción es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de centros de polleras, venta de muebles, venta de ropa interior, venta de olas, venta de pasankallas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Concepción es integrante, ella indica que hace siete años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que le visito en su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  taller de costura; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio anteriormente hace doce años, aprendiendo la técnica de costura en un taller donde trabajaba de operaria, al contar con un pequeño capital decide independizarse.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela por mayor) que adquirirá de los mercados de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es soltera  y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "CUESTION DE FE II" communal bank is starting its fouth Pro Mujer loan cycle at the Los Andes Social Center.  The group is comprised of eight members and its board of directors is led by Concepción, the president.  The businesses that the group members are involved in are varied and include: sales of food, regional dress, furniture, underwear, pots and pans, and ski masks.

The loan will benefit small business owners such as Concepción who joined Pro Mujer seven years ago by invitation from a representative of the institution who visited her at home.  She currently runs a sewing business which she began 12 years ago.  She learned sewing at a shop where she used to work.  She she was able to save a small amount of capital, she decided to work independently.  

Concepción is requesting a loan to increase her capital and buy fabric wholesale at the markets in the city of El Alto.  She will then sew her products and sell them at her stall.  Her work allows her to generate enough income to the support the family, since she is single and has a son.

When asked what she enjoys about Pro Mujer, she says it is the health training the institution offers.

loans.use: To buy fabric wholesale.

loans.name: Apple Group

texts.en:
Jane is a mother of five children, four of them are still in school while one is grown. She is aged in her early fifties and married. For ten years now, Jane has supported her family by running a catering and decoration business. If she has a function, she works from 8am to 8pm, and sometimes until midnight, and is able to make a good profit each month. 

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is her 16th loan request which she will use to buy two groom chairs for her business. Jane used the previous loans (all of which were repaid successfully) to buy serving dishes, decorating materials, big cooking pans and glasses for her catering and decorating. She manages her business well and uses the profit to cover school fees and household expenses. Jane dreams that one day she will be able to own a function hall. 

She will share this loan with her loan group "Apple" which has four members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to buy two groom chairs for her business.

loans.name: Wilson Julian

texts.es:
Wilson es un hombre multifacético e inquietamente trabajador, se dedica a la venta de comidas rápidas en el municipio de Bello, Antioquia y realiza oficios varios en los tiempos en que puede.
Trabaja todos los días de 3:00 Pm a 10:00 Pm y se le nota el gran compromiso y pasión que tiene con su trabajo.
La gran ventaja que tiene es la ubicación de su puesto de comidas ya que está al frente de un gran supermercado con mucho movimiento comercial.
Es un hombre alegre y siempre dispuesto a servir de una manera cordial.
Solicita un aliento económico para comprarse una moto y pequeño remolque en el que pueda transportar su puesto de comidas desde el lugar en que lo guarda hasta su lugar de trabajo, adicional necesita realizar algunas reparaciones a su chaza ya que de tanto movimiento esta averiada.
Tiene mucha fe en su negocio y agradece profundamente estas entidades que le ayudan a personas como él a salir adelante.
texts.en: Wilson is a restlessly hard-working, multifaceted man who works selling fast food in the town of Bello, Antioquia and does several different jobs in his available free time. He works every day from 3:00 PM to 10:00 PM and the great commitment and passion he has for his work is apparent. The big advantage he has is the location of his food cart, because it's in front of a large supermarket with lots of shoppers. He's a happy guy who's always willing to serve courteously. The financial aid he's requesting is to purchase a motorcycle and a small trailer so he can transport his food cart from the storage location to his work site, and he also needs to do some repairs on his cart since it's damaged from so much movement. He has a lot of faith in his business and is deeply grateful to the entities that help people like him get ahead.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle and a trailer to transport his food cart, and do repairs because it's damaged.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: María tiene 60 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y se dedica a la venta de tortillas y su esposo es agricultor y de esta forma es como llevan el sustento a su hogar y mantienen la economía de su familia. María solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir  en la construcción de las paredes del servicio sanitario y para encementar el piso de la vivienda. Con el monto solicitado comprará cemento, arena, ladrillo y hierro. Espera poder contar contar con este financiamiento y así poder dar inicio a las mejoras lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Maria, 60, lives in her own home with her husband.  She sells tortillas and he is a farmer.  Together they support the household and family economy.  Maria is requesting a loan through FUSAI to build walls around her bathroom and to put down a cement floor in the house.

She will use the loan to buy cement, sand, brick and iron.  She hopes to receive the loan and be able to begin renovation as soon as possible.

loans.use: To buy cement, sand, bricks and iron.

loans.name: Katherine Pamela

texts.es:
KATHERINE PAMELA, tiene 21 años de edad, es estudiante universitaria de la carrera de Administración, eligió ésta profesión porque le gusta mucho la planificación y ella opina que eso tiene mucho que ver con ´la Administración.
Le falta sólo un año para terminar la carrera completa, paralelamente ella trabaja en una constructora, para así poder apoyar a sus padres en el pago de la movilidad y refrigerios.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá para pagar el octavo ciclo completo de la carrera de administración y así evitar preocupaciones de último momento en conseguir el dinero para pagar mensualmente.
texts.en:
Katherine Pamela, 21, is studying for a degree in business administration.  She chose this profession because she enjoys planning which she believes is an important of administration.

She only has one year left.  She also works at a construction company to help her parents cover transportation and food costs.

The loan she will receive is to pay for her final term and avoid having to worry about having enough money to pay monthly.

loans.use: To pay for a full term of tuition toward her business administration degree.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en: Due to financial hardship, Tessie aims to improve her small retail store in order to increase her income. She is 38 years old, married and blessed with only one child. She has operated her business for almost two years now. She wants to acquire more stocks of grocery items to sell but she does not have enough capital. For this reason, she wants to take a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, laundry soaps, beverages, seasonings and snack foods to resell. She is hoping that she will obtain her loan to be able to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, laundry soaps, beverages, seasonings and snack foods to resell

location.town: Brgy. Mabasa, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Tou

texts.en:
Tou is 64 years old, married and a loving father of eight children. Tou works hard to support his family, growing and harvesting rice on a few pieces of farmland in Prey Chhor, Kampong Cham province. Tou has been a farmer for more than 40 years and farming has been the major source of his income. Through his hardships, Tou is able to earn a daily income of USD 6, which he usually uses for daily meals and other living costs.

Tou successfully repaid his previous two loans and now has requested a USD 1,500 loan though Hattha Kaksekar to buy a tuk tuk for his son to operate a transportation business, so as to make additional income for the family. He hopes that lenders will not reject his loan and he promises to repay it on time.

loans.use: to buy a tuk tuk for his son to operate a transportation business.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Leonida works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from pig fattening and fishing. Leonida is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients such as sugar, milk, beans and fruits for her food vending business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Leonida has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients such as sugar, milk, beans and fruits

loans.name: Pelagia Aurelia

texts.es:
Pelagia vive en el distrito de santiago, es una mujer con muchas ganas de salir adelante ya que su gran sueño es poder darle a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida. Es por ello que cada día trabaja muy duro en su empleo como obrera de campo en un fundo agrícola, ya que es la única fuente de ingresos que tiene para poder solventar los gastos de su hogar.

Pelagia esta muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá dar la inicial par poder comprar una vivienda, ya que actualmente solo vive en casa de familiares, de esta manera tener un lugar propio donde vivir y poder mejorar cada día.
texts.en: Pelagia lives in the district of Santiago, and is a woman with great desire to get ahead. Her dream is to give her son a higher quality of life. That's why she works very hard in her job as a farm worker, since it's the only source of income she has to pay household expenses. Pelagia is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they provided to her, she'll be able to undertake the beginning of purchasing a home. That would give her a place to live of her own, since she currently lives in a house with relatives.

loans.use: For the beginning of a home.

loans.name: Gloria Cecilia

texts.es: La señora Gloria es una administradora de empresas la cual empleo su profesión por más de 10 años y que luego fue despedida por recorte de personal en la empresa, cansada de prestar servicios a otra persona decidió montar su propio negocio, un taller de confección  en la que realiza ropa para dama que posteriormente vende su hermano en un pueblo. Hoy en día presenta dificultades para seguir operando las cuales son realizar reformas locativas urgentes como reparar el techo ya que se filtra agua y se puede echar a perder mercancía, con el sobrante comprara telas para confeccionar y aumentar sus ventas posicionando sus productos en los pueblos
texts.en:
Gloria worked in business administration for over ten years but she was let go due to organizational restructuring.  Since she was tired of working for other people she decided to set up her own business and started sewing women's clothing which her brother sells in the village.  

Currently she is facing some difficulties because the roof of her shop is in need of urgent repair resulting in water leakage which can damage her merchandise.  She will use part of the loan to buy fabrics for her business to increase sales of her products in the villages.

loans.use: To fix up her workshop since the roof is in need of urgent repair.  The rest of the loan will go toward the purchase of fabrics.

loans.name: René Antonio

texts.es:
René de 47 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, actualmente está acompañado, con ella no tiene hijos, pero les da ayuda a sus hijos del primer hogar. Él vive con su hijastra y su pareja que se dedica a la venta de medicinas  naturales. 
Desde que tenía 19 años de edad se dedica a la venta de artículos de primera necesidad y ropa, aprendió el negocio por su tía que se dedicaba al oficio, además trabaja con ganado propio y sale a vender a diferentes zonas del país y el horario es variable. 
Necesita el crédito para invertir una parte en el negocio, comprara (licuadoras, planchas y hamacas) y otra parte para comprar una pequeña chiva, para crecerla y en un futuro sacarle provecho. Un sueño en el futuro es tener una casa donde tener su ganado, además desea seguir trabajando para mantener a su familia y poder solventar la deuda sin problemas.
texts.en:
Rene, 47, was unable to get an education.  He and his current partner do not have children, but he has children from a previous relationship who he helps support.  He lives with his step-daughter and partner who sells natural medicine.

Since the age of 19 he has been selling home products and clothing.  He learned the trade from his aunt who used to be in the same business.  He also raises livestock which he sells in different areas of the country.  He has a varied work schedule.

Rene is in need of a loan to spend part of it on his business, buying juicers, irons and hammocks, and another part to buy a young goat to raise and sell in the future.  His goal is to have property for his livestock and to continue working to support his family and pay off debt without problems.

loans.use: To buy domestic appliances to sell, such as juicers, irons and hammocks, as well as to buy a young goat.

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es: María tiene 37 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida  y sus tres hijos de 21 años, 19 años y 16 años de edad. Ella trabaja  en una empresa cercana de su localidad donde confecciona suéteres, cuenta con este empleo desde hace 7 años. De esta forma lleva el sustento a su hogar y junto a su compañero de vida mantienen la economía de su hogar. María solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la reparación del techo de su vivienda dado que se encuentra deteriorado y cuando llueve el agua se filtra y moja sus pocas pertenencias. Comprará lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos.
texts.en: María is 37 years old and lives in a house of her own with her husband and their three children, whose ages are 21, 19, and 16. She has been working for 7 years as an employee of a nearby clothes factory. Her income as well as her spouse's go towards paying for household expenses. María is asking for a loan in order to repair the roof of her house, which is in a sorry state and leaks when it rains, wetting what few possessions the family has. She will buy galvanised metal sheets, wood, and nails.

loans.use: to buy galvanised metal sheets, wood, and nails to repair the roof of her house.

loans.name: Al- Itefak Group

texts.en:
Al-Itefak is a group made up of five women from Mokala, Yemen. They are requesting a loan of 150,000 Yemeni rial (YER) from AMB.
	
Hana is the leader of the group. She is a 39-year-old married woman who went to elementary school but could not complete her studies. She is a housewife, and is a vigorous and dynamic woman. The oven in her house is very old and she needs a new one in order to make good bread, cakes and other delicious food. For this reason, Hana is requesting a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase a new oven.

Hana looks forward to furnishing her whole house with new furniture. She hopes to purchase all the home appliances she needs to make her house comfortable.

loans.use: to buy a new oven for baking bread and cakes.

loans.name: Mártir

texts.es:
Mártir de 57 años de edad, es un hombre que estudio hasta segundo grado,  dada las circunstancias que su papá se dedicaban a la pesca  y no tenían muchos ingresos por eso él se dedicó a la  pesca desde muy pequeño, está acompañado  la esposa de él le ayuda a comercializar los pescado que él y su  hijo van a pescar. En su casa solo vive su esposa, su hijo de 19 años  y un nieto.

Mártir  se  dedica a la pesca artesanal desde que era niño, el papá le enseño  el oficio  de esa manera aprendió a pescar para ir pasando los días y llevar el sustento diario a su familia; pero cuando hay días malos para la pesca, cuando la marea esta mala, también se dedica a la  agricultura siembra maíz y frijol. para desplazarme hacia el mar tiene que caminar cerca de un kilómetro de  distancia después recorre muchísimos kilómetros dentro del mar  para ir a pescar, el horario de trabajo es variado depende mucho de cómo este  el día para pescar  algunas bese toca de noche o de madrugada.  
El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar  2 redes  para atrapar más pescado y mejorar sus ingresos para  mejorar la alimentación de su hijo y nieto y  le ayudara mucho en tener un equipo más adecuado para la pesca.

Su deseo es contar con un equipo más  adecuado para la pesca y  tener más ingreso para brindarle el estudio a su nieto.
texts.en: Mártir is 57 years old and studied up to the second form. His father, a fisherman, did not earn much, which is why Mártir had to become a fisherman at a very young age. He is married and his wife helps him sell the fish he and his son catch. He lives together with his wife, his 19-year-old son, and a grandchild. Mártir has lived off artisan fishing since he was a child and learned the trade at his father's knee. This is his main source of income and how he feeds his family. However, he has a secondary activity to guard against bad fishing days, when the bay waters are sour: he grows sweetcorn and broad beans. Mártir needs to walk nearly one kilometre to reach the sea, and then goes very far out to sea to fish. His working hours are dictated by the weather: sometimes, he has to go at night, or at dawn. He asks for a loan in order to buy two nets so as to increase his income and feed better food to his son and his grandson. Having proper fishing equipment would be of great help. He wishes to have equipment more suited to his fishing activities and wants to earn more money to pay for his grandson's education.

loans.use: to buy two nets in order to catch more fish and improve his income.

loans.name: Cecilio

texts.es:
Cecilio vive en Camaná junto a su esposa y su hija  quienes son su orgullo y por quienes lucha arduamente para sacar adelante a su familia.

Desde hace varios años se dedica  a la actividad agrícola, cultivando diversos productos de la mejor calidad que se puede ofrecer en el mercado.
Él es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora, todos los días sale desde muy temprano para poder cuidar de sus cultivos y ofrecerlos a un muy buen precio.

Cecilio está muy agradecido con los prestamistas de Kiva, ya que con su gran apoyo él comprará insumos para poder hacer un mantenimiento a la tierra y dentro de poco poder sembrar para la siguiente cosecha. De esta manera el obtendrá mayores ingresos, mejorando la calidad de vida de su familia y así cumplirá dos de sus mayores sueños: “Brindarle mayores comodidades a su hijita y comprarse su propio terreno agrícola”.
texts.en: Cecilio lives in Camaná with his wife and his daughter. They are his pride and joy and he does everything in his power to improve his family's lot in life. He has been a farmer for several years and pays attention to the quality of the produce he sells at the market. He is very responsible and hard-working, and leaves the house very early every morning to tend to his crops so as to sell the produce at a good price. Cecilio is very grateful to Kiva lenders, whose generosity will enable him to buy supplies to care for his plot of land. He will then be able to sow in preparation for the next harvest. He hopes to increase his income and improve his family's standard of living. He is on track to achieving his greatest dreams: to make his young daughter's life easier and to buy land of his own.

loans.use: to buy supplies to care for his plot of land.

loans.name: Mercedes De La Paz

texts.es:
Mercedes tiene 45 años de edad, está acompañada, su esposo trabaja en la agricultura, ella se dedica a cuidar de sus hijos, también se dedica a la crianza de algunas aves, como pollos que tiene en su casa, la señora no fue a la escuela, ya que sus padres en ese momento no contaban con los recursos suficientes para enviarla a estudiar.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para arreglar su casa ya que el techo de su vivienda ya no sirve, tiene que cambiarlo, ya que ella dice que tiene miedo le caiga encima, por lo que el crédito será de mucha ayuda para ella y su familia, ya que el bienestar de su familia es muy importante, y es necesario tenerlo en buenas condiciones. Sus sueños es que sus hijos tengan a futuro su propia casita, para que cuando ella ya no este puedan vivir seguros y tranquilos.
texts.en: Mercedes is 45 and lives with her husband, a farmer. She takes care of the children and also raises poultry in her backyard. She never could attend school because her family was very poor. She asks for a loan in order to repair the roof of her house, which she fears will collapse on top of her if it is not overhauled. She says this loan is very important to her and her family, since the well-being of her family means a great deal to her, and this means living in a house that is not going to shambles. Her dream is for her children to have a small house of their own one day, so that they can live without worries when she passes on.

loans.use: to repair the roof of her house, which is on the brink of collapsing.

loans.name: Consolanta

texts.en:
Consolata is a widow with four children, two of whom go to school. She is a second time borrower with UGAFODE microfinance, having successfully paid off her previous loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX). She’s a poultry farmer who rears both broilers and layers to sustain her life and take care of her family. She wants to take out a new loan of two million UGX to buy more feed stocks for her chickens. This will help her to buy cheaply and avoid losses due to price fluctuations. 

Consolata is grateful to lenders for helping her with her burdens even when they don’t know her. Her future plan is to put her children through school successfully and also to build a house for them to call home.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of chicken feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy assorted fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials to build and extra room and repair the walls.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Virginia works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fattening pigs. Virginia is borrowing 28,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy items for her store like soap, milk, sugar, canned goods and eggs.

Virginia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF, all of which she successfully paid back. She has now requested an additional loan to further build her business. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of goods for her store

loans.name: Shilingi

texts.en: Shilingi is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work. Besides her dumpling selling business, Shilingi also sells paraffin. She is asking for a loan to buy more gallons of paraffin. She is grateful for the financial support she has received.

loans.use: to buy paraffin for her business

loans.name: Saeeda

texts.en:
Saeeda is a 35-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan.  She has 3 sons and two daughters who are all studying. Her husband has been running her own business of selling clothes for 3 years.  He is responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household. He needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk for reselling, but due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to purchase these clothes.


So Saeeda is applying for a Kiva loan from field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can assist her husband to purchase these clothes in bulk for his business. It will also help him to expand his business and earn a profit with the help of this loan amount. 

Saeeda is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy clothes in bulk for resale

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is 49 years old and the mother of three children. Her husband is a hawker who sells fruit chat. He must feed the entire family and cover household expenses on his earnings. But due to a lack of capital he is not in a position to buy extra fruit for his business.

So Naseem is applying for a 20,000 PKR loan through BRAC Pakistan so her husband can buy different types of ingredients such as fresh fruits, yogurt, dried fruits, etc. for his business. This loan should help him increase the size of his business, improve his sales and earn him the maximum in profits.

Naseem wishes to say she is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy different types of ingredients for her husband's chat business.

loans.name: Abner Isai

texts.es:
Abner de 25 años de edad, es un joven trabajador, está acompañado desde hace cuatro años, tienen un hijo que tiene cuatro meses de nacido, Abner estudio hasta primer año de bachillerato, dejo de estudiar, para dedicarse a trabajar y ayudar su familia, también porque se acompañó y tenía que trabajar para mantener a su familia, la cual depende directamente de él, con respecto a sus actividades, se dedica a la agricultura, también trabaja como moso en un camión de carga desde hace unos cinco años se dedica a estas actividades, trabaja casi todos los días solo descansa los fines de semana.

El préstamo que está solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para terminar de construir  su casa, ya que con esfuerzo la ha comenzado a construir con ayuda de su familia, con lo cual su familia vivirá más tranquila y segura.

 Sus planes a futuro son terminar su casa y  hacerla más grande,  cuidar de su hijo para que crezca y ha futuro estudie y sea un profesional que dependa de sí solo, ya que él no pudo concluir con su estudio.
texts.en:
Abner is 25 years old. He is a young worker, and he has lived with his partner for four years. They have a four-month-old son. Abner went to school up to the first year of high school. He stopped studying in order to work and help his family, and also because he got together with his girlfriend and had to support his family, who depend directly on him. With respect to his work, he dedicates himself to agriculture. He also works as an assistant on a cargo truck. He has dedicated himself to these activities for about five years. He works almost every day and only rests on the weekends. 

The loan he is requesting from CREDICAMPO is to finish building his house. With great effort and with the help of his family, he has started building the house, in which his family will live more peacefully and securely. 

His plans for the future are to finish his house and make it larger, and to raise his son so that he grows up with a good future, studying and becoming an independent professional, since Abner himself was not able to finish his studies.

loans.use: to finish constructing his house.

loans.name: Maysara

texts.en:
Maysara was born in 1955. She is married and has five children. Her three daughters are married. She is a cleaning woman. Maysara’s husband is a washer. She is a very kind person. Her colleagues know her as smart and a hardworking woman. 

Maysara and her husband have little income, so they live poorly. Her second daughter is married and lives poorly also. She has no stove to use. Maysara wants to help her daughter because she has small children. She is asking for a loan of 2000 Somoni to buy a stove for her daughter. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy a stove for her daughter

loans.name: Cesar Narciso

texts.es: Cesar tiene 30 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos de 4 y 8 años de edad. Cesar trabaja como jornalero  y su compañera de vida se dedica a la comercialización de ropa interior y así juntos llevan el sustento diario y mantienen la economía de su hogar. Con el fin de mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales las cuales son muy humildes, solicita este crédito a FUSAI dado que desea mejorar las condiciones de su casa principalmente las paredes y el techo por lo que necesita materiales como lámina galvanizada, madera, y clavos. Confía que de esta forma podrá dar a sus hijos mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Cesar, 30, lives in his own house with his life partner and their two children, ages 4 and 8. Cesar works as a day laborer, and his partner sells underwear. Together, they bring home the daily bread and maintain their household economy. 

With the goal of improving his very humble living conditions, Cesar has applied for a loan from FUSAI. He would like to improve the conditions of his house, especially the floors and roof. Therefore, he needs materials such as galvanized metal sheets, wood, and nails. He is confident that this will allow him to give his children better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy galvanized metal sheets, wood, and nails to repair the roof and walls of his home.

loans.name: Nuria  Del Carmen

texts.es: Nuria de 45 años de edad tiene un pequeño puesto en el mercado de venta de frutas y verduras, tiene mucha clientela por la calidad de los productos y los buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, Nuria vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijas, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de frutas y verduras por mayor, para poder continuar con sus ventas y tener junto con su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Nuria, 45, has a small stand at a market where she sells fruit and vegetables. She has a large clientele due to the quality of her products and her good prices. With the money she earns from her sales, she manages to cover her household expenses. Nuria lives in her own house with her husband and two daughters. She is applying for a loan to buy wholesale fruit and vegetables to continue with her sales and to have a better quality of life along with her family.

loans.use: to buy wholesale fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Peterson

texts.en:
Hello, world! Meet Peterson, a very confident mixed-farmer from Kisii which is a rural town in Kenya. The father of six has been farming and selling milk, eggs and tea leaves from the farm for 18 years now! 

Peterson is seeking a loan. The purpose of this loan is to purchase a dairy cow. With an additional cow, Peterson will increase milk sales and fully utilize his pasture. His biggest challenge, however, is raising the capital. 

Peterson is very passionate about dairy farming as he is about maize farming. He is torn between naming his upcoming cow Nyabati or Nyangera.

Peterson is confident he is the right candidate for this loan because, although he went through much hardship in life growing up, he plans on making amends by consolidating loans and paying off all his debts. 

He strategizes to improve his income with this loan so that he will be comfortable in future paying his children's school fees that is currently taking up most of his income allocation.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Darvin

texts.es:
Darvin nació en Bagua, selva norte del Perú, sus padres perdieron la vida en un ataque a mano de nativos de la zona cuando era muy pequeño, casi todo el pueblo murió aquel día, el sobrevivió de milagro. Actualmente vive con su tía, hermana de su madre y su esposo que lo han criado desde entonces y lo quieren como a un hijo. El estudia electrónica industrial en un instituto técnico y esta muy ilusionado con terminar su carrera y ser profesional, sin embargo esto no sera posible sin el apoyo de los prestamistas de Kiva ya que no cuenta con los recursos económicos suficientes para lograrlo en este momento.
El cree que la educación es el primer paso y piedra fundamental para alcanzar el desarrollo en cualquier pueblo.
Darvin se considera un luchador y sabe que saldrá adelante, por eso esta muy agradecido con toda la ayuda que le pueden brindar os prestamistas de Kiva para poder culminar sus estudios y ayudar a su nueva familia.
texts.en:
Darvin was born in Bagua in the northern jungle of Peru. His parents were killed at the hands of natives of the region in an attack when he was very young. Nearly everyone in the village died that day. Miraculously, he survived. He now lives with his aunt (his mother's sister) and her husband. They have raised him since then and love him like a son.

He studies industrial electronics at a technical institute. He is very excited to finish his degree and become a professional. However, this will not be possible without the support of Kiva lenders, because he does not have the necessary financial resources to accomplish his goal at this time.

He believes that education is the first step and a fundamental stepping stone to achieve development in any region.

Darvin considers himself to be a fighter and he knows that he will succeed. He is very grateful for all of the help which Kiva lenders can offer him to finish his studies and help his new family.

loans.use: to pay for his technical studies in industrial electronics.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en: Naseem is the age of 30; she is a mother of three children and lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a plastic utensils shop for the last 5 years. He manages his household necessities from his own shop; some of his relatives like to purchase from his plastic shop as well. He speaks with a tone which is impressive, and he easily wins the trust of his clients. Due to his behavior and tone, he has built up very good relations with his customers. His plastic utensils shop is very famous in the market – that is the reason his business is running well. His sales have increased a lot, but he does not have sufficient stock to cope with the demand. Therefore, Naseem requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy more plastic utensils stock to sell. Naseem thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more plastic utensils for resale

loans.name: Nita

texts.en: Nita is 51 years old, married and has three children. She owns and manages a small retail store while her husband cultivates their farmland. Due to hardships of living, she aspires to improve her business in order to earn a higher income. She plans to acquire more stock of grocery items to sell, but she has insufficient capital. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos to buy more stock of snack foods, assorted candies, canned goods, laundry soaps, beverages, breads, seasonings and soft drinks to sell. Having patience and strong determination, she believes that she will improve her business and achieve her goal someday.

loans.use: to buy more stock of snack foods, assorted candies, canned goods, laundry soaps, beverages, breads, seasonings and soft drinks to sell

location.town: Brgy. Malasin, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Nimfa works hard to support her family. She has a buy-and-sell dried fish business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buy-and-sell fish. 

Nimfa is borrowing PHP 16000 through NWTF to buy dried fish to sell for her business.

Nimfa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Ma. Elena works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from pig fattening. 

Ma. Elena is borrowing PHP 16000 through NWTF to buy a fishing net, gasoline, etc. for her fishing business. She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Ma. Elena has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net, gasoline, etc. for her fishing business.

loans.name: Confiance Group

texts.fr: La cliente Antoinette est une brave commerçante, vice- présidente et membre d’une plateforme d’affaires  «Confiance», senior entrepreneur, dynamique, âgée de 44 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants qui étudient. La cliente est vendeuse de la boisson locale. Elle installe sa marchandise à domicile dans un quartier périphérique de la ville. Elle commença ses affaires avec le premier capital reçu de son mari. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 27 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Son conjoint est un taximan.  Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 10 bidons de la boisson. Ainsi, elle souhaite, scolariser, vêtir et  nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie  fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs exclues du système bancaire classique, pendant cette période post conflits dans la région de l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
Hekima client Antoinette is a hardworking businesswoman and vice-president of the business group called  «Confiance» (Confidence). She is a senior entrepreneur, dynamic, aged 44, married and the mother of six children who attend school. This client sells local brew. She displays her merchandise at home in an outlying neighborhood of the city. She began her business with start-up capital received from her husband. Later on, she was able to take advantage of a loan from Hekima. 

Antoinette has been in this business for 27 years. Her spouse drives a taxi. This new loan will allow her to buy 10 jerrycans of local brew. In this way, she hopes to pay school fees and clothe and feed her children.  Finally, she would like to thank Hekima sincerely for helping women entrepreneurs, who are excluded from the classical banking system, become independent in this post-conflict period in the Eastern region of the country.

loans.use: to buy 10 jerrycans of local brew

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is a fifty-four-year-old hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He owns a bar as his source of income alongside honey selling and agriculture. He started this business to look after his family. He has personal goals of educating his children and owning a wholesale depot. His main hardships are high competition and inadequate capital to meet the increasing demand. He has hopes of having a wholesale depot in future.
 
He intends to use the loan to buy more crates of sodas and beer to sell.

loans.use: to buy more crates of sodas and beer to sell.

loans.name: Mwanarusi

texts.en:
This is Mwanarusi. She previously accessed a loan that she used to stock her salon business. Her earnings were a big help for her personal, household, and business expenditures.

She is requesting a loan to purchase hair oil, hair chemicals, braids,and shampoos for her business. She appreciates Kiva for their financial support.. 

She looks forward to this financial increase with happiness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to purchase hair oil, hair chemicals, braids, and shampoos for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his mobile phone store

loans.name: Amneh

texts.en:
Amneh is a 48-year-old widow from a small village near Tulkarem city. She lives alone in a very simple house. She works as a farmer on her land where she plants seasonal crops. It is a very good project but the incom is seasonal. 

Amneh would like to start another project, which is a women's clothing store. Amneh took a loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy clothing for her women's store to re-sell. By taking this loan, Amneh will be able to start her new business and improve her living conditions.
 
Amneh appears in the photo in her new store.

loans.use: to buy clothing to re-sell in her women's store.

loans.name: Mpunga Group

texts.en:
Peter, who is in his late thirties, is a married man and father of one boy and girl who are in school. For four years now, he has made his family living by managing a business selling tea with bites, ugali (a porridge made of maize), nyama choma (roasted meat), chips, and soft drinks. He starts business from 7am to midnight daily and is able to make a good profit each month. 

Peter is so happy and thankful to Kiva for their support because now his business has started to grow. He is requesting a third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which he will use to buy food cooking ingredients for his new branch. He used the previous loans (all of which were paid back successfully) to buy business equipment (freezer and cooking stove) and added new food services (soup and soft drinks). Peter earned a profit, which he used to pay for his building costs, covered school fees, home food expenses, and put back into his business. He dreams that one day he will be able to grow his business to hotel-level with modern food equipment like microwaves. 

He will share this loan with his loan group "MPUNGA," which totals two members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy food cooking ingredients for his new branch.

loans.name: Milady

texts.es: Milady de 50 años de edad vive con el esposo quien es taxista y sus dos hijos, ella posee un bazar donde comercializa todo tipo de productos como hilos, listones, agujas, vejigas, piñatas, etc. tiene 9 años de tener su negocio, está ubicada en el mercado central que se encuentra cerca de su lugar de residencia, tiene mucha clientela por la variedad de productos que tiene y por los buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de su ventas y con la ayuda de su esposo logran salir adelante con los gastos del hogar, milady esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y asi tener mejores ingresos y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Milady, 50, lives with her husband, a taxi driver, and their two sons. She has a bazaar where she sells all types of products, such as thread, ribbon, needles, balloons, piñatas, etc. She has had this business for nine years. It is located at the central market, near her home. She has a large clientele due to the variety of products she offers and her good prices. With the money she earns from her sales and the help of her husband, they manage to cover their household expenses. 

Milady is applying for a loan to buy more wholesale merchandise so that she can continue with her sales, thereby earning a higher income and giving her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more wholesale merchandise, such as thread, ribbon, needles, balloons, piñatas, etc.

loans.name: Ismael

texts.es: Ismael de 38 años de edad vive junto a su esposa y sus hijos; el se dedica a la agricultura específicamente al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene muchos años de trabajar en este rubro y se ha hecho de experiencia muy valiosa que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas , el terreno de cultivo está ubicado en una zona de incidencia agrícola, el comercia en todas las zonas aledañas y ya tiene mucha clientela fija, estas personas siempre prefieren su producto pues es de calidad y a precios realmente accesibles además el servicio es inigualable, el quiere invertir en insumos agrícolas pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semillas, abono, insecticida, fertilizantes, controles de plagas herramienta, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía,  Ismael tiene buenas referencias de pago y está seguro que podrá saldar su deuda a tiempo, y a la vez tiene la confianza que podrá darle a su familia la vida que se merecen.
texts.en:
Ismael, 38, lives with his wife and children. He works in agriculture, specifically growing corn and beans. He has been working in agriculture for many years, and he has gained valuable experience which allows him to obtain the best harvests. His land is located in a productive agricultural area. He sells his products in all of the neighboring areas, and he already has a large fixed clientele. These clients always prefer his products because they are of good quality and the prices are very accessible. His service is also unparalleled. 

He wants to invest in farm supplies, but he needs capital to do so. Therefore, he has applied for a loan from INTEGRAL to buy seeds, manure, insecticide, fertilizer, pest control, tools, etc. He will also improve his land, shown in the photograph. 

Ismael has good payment references and he is sure that he will be able to pay back his debt on time. He is also confident that he will be able to give his family the life they deserve.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, insecticide, fertilizer, pest control, tools, etc. and to improve his land.

loans.name: Haytham

texts.en:
Haytham is a 23-year-old single man from Attel, a small village near Tulkarem City. His father works in his blacksmith workshop. It is a good business but the income is barely able to cover all the family needs.

Haytham would like to open his own business, which is a coffee shop. Haytham took a loan from FATEN, which will help him to buy new furniture for his coffee shop. By taking this loan, Haytham will be able to start his own project. 

Haytham appears in the photo in his coffee shop.

loans.use: to buy new furniture for his coffee shop.

loans.name: Ahamd

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 22-year-old single young man from Qabatiya, a small village near Jenin City. He lives with his family in a small house. His mother works as an employee at a local firm where she gets a low income. Ahmad has been working selling fruits and vegetables for the past four years to help his family with their expenses. It is a good business and earns a good income.

Ahmad took a loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more products for his stall to resell. By taking this loan, Ahmad's sales will be increased and also his income.

Ahmad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more products for his stall to resell.

loans.name: Aristides

texts.es: Aristides se destaca como un señor responsable muy reconocido en la zona, toda su vida se ha dedicado a las actividades del campo como es la Ganadería y la Agricultura, su esposa es ama de casa, sus hijos estudian carreras técnicas impartidas por INTA una Institución del Estado sobre hortalizas y manejo y cuido del Ganado, y en tiempos libres ponen en práctica lo aprendido por su padres y estudios.  En años anteriores don Arístides sufrió pérdidas monetarias por la baja en el precio del Ganado, lo que la ha costado recuperarse.  Actualmente tiene la necesidad de comprar Insumos para siembra de Maíz y Trigo por lo que solicita crédito para comprar Gramófono, Sipermetrina, Glifosato, Herbicidas y otros  fertilizantes para la siembra, así aprovechar el potencial suelo.
texts.en: Aristides stands out as a responsible man who is very well known in the area. All of his life, he has worked in the country in activities such as cattle ranching and agriculture. His wife is a housewife. His children are in technical school in INTA, a state institution, where they study mostly about produce, and the care and management of cattle. In their free time, they put what they have learned from their classes and their parents into practice. In previous years, Arístides suffered financial losses sue to the low price of cattle, and it has been hard to recover. Now he needs to buy materials to plant corn and wheat. That is why he is asking for a loan to buy gramaxone, cypermethrin, glyposate, herbicide and other fertilizers for planting. This way, he will take advantage of the soil's potential.

loans.use: materials to plant corn.
